story:
THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO BE A PART OF SOMETHING BIGGER THAN MUSIC

Fires are started by a reaction between oxygen and a fuel of some sort but, for the reaction to occur, the fuel must be heated.  As a musician I've worked relentlessly to provide the world with great music.  As a servant, I've committed to providing the world with the hope we're told is lost.  My music has been heard in movies directed by the likes of Malcolm Lee (Director of Best Man 2), Joshua Butler (Director of Enemy of The State), Karyn Kusama (Director of Aeon Flux), and more.  I've been seen internationally on shows like WWE (wrestling), The Family Feud, Let's Ask America, Right This Minute, TBN's "Praise The Lord," JCTV's "Exit 16," TCT's "I'm Just Sayin" and more.  I am also a licensed minister, husband, and father of four extraodinary children.  Additionally, I've been featured in magazines and radio throughout the world.  I mention all of this to you not as a boast on my achievements but as examples of my dedication to my God given gift.  The hopeless are the fuel, you/we are the oxygen, and the heat is within our ability to inspire through our actions.  Let's make PYRO!

Even with all of the aforementioned accolades, I pride most an award I received from my peers and city officials in 2009, "Cleveland's Finest Dad/Leader of the year."  I am passionate about this album and mission because, for the past two and a half years, I have journeyed the trenches of prisons, schools, rehabilitation facilities and streets to see first hand the impact that ministry through music and service with compassion has had on thousands of lives.  My wife and I have been able to cover some ground on our own and have volunteered our time and finances to get this far.  I am confident that, with your help, we can take this mission much further.  Though I vow to give you some of the greatest music you've ever heard, your contribution will be more than just funding an album; it will be investing into our communities and future.  We want to get this into those whose hands, hearts and lives need it FOR FREE.  On completion, we will be walking neighborhoods and placing hard copies directly into the hands that need to hear this uplifting sound most.  The places our feet are unable to reach, we will digitally distribute free of charge.


What We Need & What You Get

This is just phase 1 (bare bones ground level for launch).  Your contributions will go toward mastering, printing, digitally distributing, and initial marketing.  I hope it's not the case but, if the goal is not reached, all funds raised will simply go toward mastering and printing. (but I'm sure you all won't leave us there)  What's great about this campaign is the amazing perks.  There aren't many investments that gives you an immediate return that's priceless.

I've done tons of research, kept my ears to the ground, and watched other people use this method and actually succeed. There have been many different approaches and fans of music are starting to understand this format, but it's missing something.  Rarely do you have an opportunity to see how bands and artists utilize the funds.

We however, will make ourselves accountable to you to show you how every penny is spent and prove that making a top notch record, and being the change we want to see in society, comes at a price.  Besides, you are our partner.  Who knows, if we exceed our goal, we will be able to do some of the things we have only dreamed about.  The success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become.  We are set up for Flex Funding, which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised.  So, if we don't reach our goal, we will have to reevaluate our plan to complete the vision of the album but we are ready to deliver this thing however our campaign plays out.

Remember, anything that is available through the perks is exclusive to the campaign.   The exclusive listings are all one time offers.

The Impact

      My wife and I have had the privilege of serving with Teen Challenge in two of its locations in Pennsylvania.  If you are unfamiliar with them, Teen Challenge offers: “Christ-entered, faith-based solutions for youth, adults, and families, struggling with life-controlling problems, such as addiction.”  Additionally, we’ve been diligently serving as volunteers for the Richland Correctional Institution in Mansfield, Ohio for the past three years and the Youth Department of Corrections for the last year.  Additionally, we have served in public schools for the past few years with campaigns like "The Make a Difference Movement: Anti-Bullying and Violence." While many of you may know me as a musician and my many other gifts, my heart is to be a master of service.  What I love about service is that there is no set number in who can be involved and, through it, God extends an invitation to us all.

     There are currently about 2 million men and women that are incarcerated.  Here are some alarming numbers, (and this blew my mind) there are more jails than colleges right now in the United States.  There are even some counties in the state of New York where 30% of the population is made up of inmates. (http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/wonkblog/wp/2015/01/06/the-u-s-has-more-jails-than-colleges-heres-a-map-of-where-those-prisoners-live/)

     Other countries don’t have less crime than the U.S. but our sentences are a lot longer, especially for property and drug crimes.  Compared to England, a sentence here in the U.S. for burglary is about 3 times longer for the exact same crime.  This is no endorsement or condoning of crime but rather a call to reduce the occurrence of these offenses by supplying an alternative mentality and encouraging appropriate justice where these crimes are committed.

     Out of the total 2.3 million of those incarcerated, African Americans account for 1 million of them and African Americans are incarcerated at about six times the rate of Caucasians. (http://www.naacp.org/pages/criminal-justice-fact-sheet) “There are more African American men in correctional control now than were enslaved in 1850” (http://www.vox.com/2015/2/23/8088989/john-legend-oscars-speech-quote ) and if this is not corrected now, 1 in 3 African American males born can expect to spend time in prison at some point in his life! (http://www.naacp.org/pages/criminal-justice-fact-sheet)  Surely this is NOT about race but, because I am an African American male and have three sons of my own, I feel compelled to change this in every community and you should too! 

     On May 5, 2015 I will be releasing my 5th musical project entitled: “Pyro.”  It will be a “FREE” downloadable mix tape that will take Christ’s hope, love, and salvation into to the world in an unadulterated way.  People need God’s love and hope and it’s time for those of us who are willing to take it to them!  I plan to take it out into every hedge and highway, BELIEVING God will make this the most downloaded mix tape of 2015.  Will you believe and labor with me to make this a reality?

     Lastly, I feel obligated to let you know that when I first went to prisons voluntarily, I had no real expectation and many stereotypes about those imprisoned; but then I met Al Cleveland.  Honestly, here I was being petitioned to go in and help change lives but this brother changed mine.  Al has already served 20 years in prison for a murder he didn't commit.  I know, we hear inmates proclaiming their innocence regularly but this is different.  I have sat in the courtroom firsthand and witnessed the Innocence Project fight to get him out.  I’ve seen the evidence, or lack there of; no dna, no prints, no weapon, no videotape only a witness from a crooked informant (William Avery) who was a heroine addict.  William Avery even came clean to many media outlets and government officials saying the police paid him thousands to ID Cleveland and three other men of the crime.  He also announced his shame of lying and bearing false witness just to feed his addiction. Avery has come forth now because he claims to have turned his life around and wants to do the right thing.  Regardless of this admission and evidence, Al Cleveland was denied release and remains incarcerated.  Yet, every time I see Al in the Bible studies and worship services, he continues to lift the name of Christ and is one of the most humble individuals I've ever met.  Honestly, Cleveland's story is unique but just ONE example of millions.  There are many who are really guilty of their crimes that need to experience salvation also.  I think of how lost I used to be and all the mistakes I’ve made but, if it weren't for God’s GRACE and MERCY, I wouldn't be here to tell about it! I NEED YOU ON THIS. I need you to pray, sow, support, market, and help me out. The Kingdom of God is at hand. Who’s with me? 

Ecclesiastes 4:9-12 The Message (MSG)

9-10 It’s better to have a partner than go it alone.
Share the work, share the wealth.
And if one falls down, the other helps,
But if there’s no one to help, tough!

11 Two in a bed warm each other.
Alone, you shiver all night.

12 By yourself you’re unprotected.
With a friend you can face the worst.
Can you round up a third?
A three-stranded rope isn’t easily snapped.


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges before us are many but the reward is far greater.  A good friend once said to me "it's not a sacrifice if it doesn't stretch you."  Those words are what continues to keep me motivated in the face of adversity.  I can't guarantee that everything will work according to plan but I can assure you that I have studied, labored tirelessly, prayed, fasted, and committed fully to seeing this mission through to its completion.  We all reap the reward every time an inmate is released and calls me for continued guidance, a student shares their ability to cope with bullying and pushes through to success, a gang member testifies about breaking loose from a destructive lifestyle, and my family shows pride for the example I work to set before them.

story:
The Ticked Off Music Fest is a U.S. concert series dedicated to the prevention, awareness and cure of Lyme disease and other tick-borne illnesses that have become the fastest-growing infectious diseases in the country.

The next event to launch is Ticked Off Music Fest Los Angeles, scheduled for Saturday, March 28, 2015 at the House of Blues at 8430 Sunset Blvd., West Hollywood, CA. Doors open at 5 p.m.

The music line-up features platinum-selling recording artists Cracker. The band is best known for their 1991 release "Cracker," featuring "Happy Birthday to Me" and "Teen Angst," followed by their 1993 release "Kerosene Hat," featuring "Low" and "Euro-Trash Girl." The band is currently promoting their latest release "Berkeley to Bakersfield."

Special guest is Les Stroud from the "Survivorman" TV series. Les and his full band will play songs from his recent solo releases and also field audience questions about his TV show.

LA native and former X and Lone Justice guitarist Tony Gilkyson will play his brand of alternative country.

Nashville-native Alisa Turner will play her breakout hit "Breathing" about her own struggles with Lyme disease.

Also appearing is Lyme activist, author and lead singer Natalie London and her band Hey, King!

Sixteen year-old Lyme survivor and singing sensation Keta will play her original tunes. She will be coming off of a West Coast tour where she opened for platinum-selling artist Sam Smith.

Gregg Kirk and The Zen Engines will play songs from the band's recent CD releases, all inspired by his healing journeys through Lyme disease.

The fest will also feature several well-known speakers from the Lyme community, including "Out of the Woods" author Katina Makris, Lorraine Johnson from LymeDisease.org, and Inanna House founder Mara Williams.

The evening starts when the doors open at 5 p.m. The music starts at 6 p.m. and goes to midnight... 6 straight hours of live music and Lyme education, including the option to purchase 2 drink tickets and butlered hor d'oeuvres, prepared by the House of Blues and catering to meat eaters, vegans, vegetarians and those on a gluten free diet.

Proceeds from the event will benefit LymeLight Foundation, LymeDisease.org and Inanna House.

Lyme and tick-borne diseases are the fastest growing infectious diseases in the country, around the world, and in California. The ticks that carry Lyme disease have been found in all but two counties in California. Infected ticks have been found in 42 of 58 counties. Los Angeles County alone has seven parks where infected ticks have been found. There is a very large community of Lyme Patients in Southern California who struggle to get the help & support they need.

The goal of the concert series is to drive awareness, give tips on prevention, connect those suffering from illness with Lyme-educated doctors, and to educate on the many symptoms of the diseases.

- See more at: http://www.tickedoffmusicfest.com/#sthash.HVWSy...

story:
We are so happy to announce our collaboration with Regernate music (Grammy Award winning Publishing + Recording company) on our first full length album " 10/30".

The trip from Cairo to Nashville,TN will cost a lot of money and we've worked out most of the expenses.. but we are short in 1500$ 

So we thought to look for your support to get this done :)
story_txt: We are so happy to announce our collaboration with Regernate music (Grammy Award winning Publishing + Recording company) on our first full length album " 10/30".The trip from Cairo to Nashville,TN will cost a lot of money and we've worked out most of the expenses.. but we are short in 1500$ So we thought to look for your support to get this done :)

story:
You LOVE Peas & Peas LOVE You.

The reality is that the music industry has changed.  It isn't about "getting signed" anymore.  For us, it is all about touring--seeing your faces & sharing our stories.  We survive by touring, and your support has allowed us to expand our touring from "just Tennessee" to also include North Carolina, South Carolina, Virginia, Kentucky, West Virginia, Ohio, and even Michigan.  (Next year: Georgia, Alabama, Florida, Louisiana & Arkansas.)  This coming year we expect to play more than 200 shows--all because of your support.  Please help us with our next project...


Last Words

We've written a handful of songs that seem to be bound by the thin string of family--as seen through softer, more forgiving eyes.  We all suffer from the disease of "busy".  That daily rush often mutes the light of the characters that exist in all our lives.  The quirky family members, from the dark sheep, rarely seen, to the wacky neighbor, not to be ignored.  "Last Words" is a reflection on how all that quirkiness forms the best parts of who we are.  The soundtrack to the video above is a rough, scratch track of the title-song, Last Words, a tribute to a beloved Vietnam Veteran in our own family.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal here is $6,890 which is actually far less than what we really need to FULLY LAUNCH  a full-length CD, but it WILL allow us to finish recording & add a few guest musicians, mix & master our CD, design artwork, and ship out all the pre-orders and perks to our favorite people... the fans that got us to this point.

  • $3000 - Recording (studio time, guest musicians, etc.)
  • $2100 - Duplication (CDs, jackets & download cards)
  • $1100 - Perks & Pre-orders (CDs, t-shirts, shipping, etc.)
  • $690 - Fees (Credit card, PayPal & IndieGogo)

We truly appreciate the loyalty and trust that you give us by contributing to this CD sight unseen, so we are designing some perks into this pre-order as a way of thanking you.  In addition to a CD or a t-shirt, you also have the option to receive:

  • Jon's Hillbilly Hollandaise recipe that he famously cooks for all those wonderful folks that give us a place to stay on the road.  It comes as a recipe-card-size print of the hand-illustrated original that we use in our own kitchen.
  • A limited edition print of hand-illustrated lyrics for the title-track, Last Words--our tribute to a much-loved Vietnam Vet.  The background patterns in the still images on this page are similar to the lyric illustrations.
  • A hand-written & illustrated BOUND BOOK of lyrics for ALL 10 songs on “Last Words”(similar to the Moleskine® journal Rachel uses while lyric writing ).

  • A house concert (within 250 miles of Gatlinburg or near a town we tour near)

Check out our list of Pre-orders & Perks with a wide range of rewards for your contribution--shipping included.

Our target release date for "Last Words" is August 11, 2015.

Risks & Challenges

We chose Indiegogo because it funds whether or not we reach our goal.  Wondering what we'll do if we don't make it?  Rest assured, you WILL get anything you pre-order.  We have pre-paid our basic recording fees.  We always have t-shirts available.  But, there are challenges.  For example, without your support...
  • We may have to push the release date of August 11th to as late as November.  We are on tour nearly non-stop all summer, and not being able to hire support for the release of this CD like art design & publicity will make the process have to take a back seat until the end of the year.
  • Without your support, we may not be able to afford guest musicians & additional guest vocalists .  We love touring as a duo, but we are ready to bring you a few bonuses including some of the fantastic musicians & singers with whom we've had the privilege to perform while on the road.

Can't Pre-order? You can still help...

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to encourage your friends to support our project.
  • Set a daily reminder in your phone to share EVERY DAY from now until June 20th to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram!

Jon's Hillbilly Hollandaise recipe that he famously cooks for all those wonderful folks that give us a place to stay on the road.  It comes as a recipe-card-size print of the hand-illustrated original that we use in our own kitchen.

A limited edition print of hand-illustrated lyrics for the title-track, Last Words--our tribute to a much-loved Vietnam Vet.  The background patterns in the still images on this page are similar to the lyric illustrations.

A hand-written & illustrated  BOUND
BOOK of lyrics for ALL 10 songs on “Last Words”(similar to
the Moleskine® journal Rachel uses while lyric writing
).

A house concert (within 250 miles of
Gatlinburg or near a town we tour near)


Check out our list of Pre-orders & Perks with a wide range of rewards for your contribution--shipping included.
Our target release date for "Last Words" is August 11, 2015.


Risks & Challenges
We chose Indiegogo because it funds whether or not we reach our goal.  Wondering what we'll do if we don't make it?  Rest assured, you WILL get anything you pre-order.  We have pre-paid our basic recording fees.  We always have t-shirts available.  But, there are challenges.  For example, without your support...

We may have to push the release date of August 11th to as late as November.  We are on tour nearly non-stop all summer, and not being able to hire support for the release of this CD like art design & publicity will make the process have to take a back seat until the end of the year.

Without your support, we may not be able to afford guest musicians & additional guest vocalists .  We love touring as a duo, but we are ready to bring you a few bonuses including some of the fantastic musicians & singers with whom we've had the privilege to perform while on the road.



Can't Pre-order? You can still help...

Use the Indiegogo share tools to encourage your friends to support our project.
Set
 a daily reminder in your phone to share EVERY DAY from now until June 
20th to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram!

story: I need your help! Making music can be really expensive. I'm recording my new EP at Ardent Studios in Memphis, TN and need your help to make this new release be EVERYTHING it can possibly be. my goal is to raise 3000 dollars so we can make this the best musical smash possible!

story:
Open Phones with Randy Malloy:
Missed owner Randy Malloy answering questions about our Indiegogo campaign live on air?  Listen to it here!

Tired of the same stale playlist generated by ratings and sales?

The best rock and roll isn't scientifically tested.

CD102.5 is your alternative to corporate radio.


An independently owned and operated alternative rock radio station, CD102.5 was established August 21, 1990 in Columbus, Ohio.  We need your help to preserve our independence!


Never the last to play a record, always the first; we love to break bands and take chances on artists that may never get exposure elsewhere. Rock and Roll is about taking chances and that's what we do with our playlist. We don't just play a song because it passed some test. We play it because we love it and we know that you will too.

We support local music because every national act was once a local act somewhere.

Passion is our driving force leading us to make a difference not only in Columbus but in the national alternative music scene.

Our heart and soul is music; we are dedicated to listeners and the community. 

Our DJs listen to your requests because unlike conglomerate  radio, we have the time for you. 

Conglomerate radio is dominating the U.S airways because it's profitable.  How is it so profitable you might ask?

Efficiency of scale.

Conglomerate stations don't have a DJ in every market, in fact, they may have only one reaching from L.A to Chicago.  Good luck requesting a song. There's no one there to take your call!

How do conglomerates pick music? They pick music that is scientifically tested and true.  Music that makes $$$, music that is already a big hit.  Say goodbye to your favorite local tunes, up and comers and music discovery.

What do you lose with all that efficiency?

You lose personality.  You lose connection to the community.  You lose opportunities for musicians.  

You  lose your voice.

Through our non-profit, CD102.5 For The Kids, we have donated more than one million dollars to children's charities over the past 25 years.

We believe that radio is more than charts and stats, it's a community.

Our intern program helps many young adults learn essential skills and make invaluable contacts, helping them land careers both in and out of the music industry. 

Hell, half of our staff were interns once.

What began as a rag tag bunch of kids with a passion for music and a desire to make a difference has become a vital force in the music industry. We just have a few more wrinkles and some incredible stories.

WHY WE NEED $$$

When the radio station began it was at the frequency of 101.1 FM. Five years ago, the original owner sold the frequency and tower. This left us with quite a challenge. With no frequency, there was no radio station. With the knowledge that 101.1 FM was making a difference, its employees were not willing to give up. Taking the reins in 2010, long time employee Randy Malloy bought the intellectual property of 101.1 (CD101) and began renting the signal at 102.5 FM. 

For nearly 25 years, we have been a self-sufficient, commercial station, wholly funded by advertisers. Unlike public radio (which we love and support) we have never held a fund-drive or asked for money for radio station operations. 

Until now.  

In 18 months the lease for our broadcasting license is up. When CD102.5 began renting the license, we paid only $12,000 dollars per month.  Since then, the cost has increased dramatically (See Our Time Brokerage Agreement.)

As a mom and pop radio station, for us to be truly independent, the purchase of the broadcasting license is needed.We are single, standalone; we are independent, individual, like you. We aren't a mega corporation, playing the same music across multiple frequencies.  

CD102.5 does not have the resources or the backing of a large radio conglomerate. In order to make this necessary purchase for our long-term sustainability and continued independence, we need enough funding to acquire 102.5 FM. We cannot afford to put a down-payment on a multi-million dollar broadcasting license without your help.  



PERKS






Q&A

"Are you going away?"

No, we are not going to go away, we are trying to secure our independence.

“Why Now?”

In 18 months our lease is up. This is the time for negotiations of a new lease or purchase.

"Why are you doing a crowdfunding campaign?"

When we were at 101.1 FM we owned the tower and frequency. For five years now we have been renting at 102.5 FM. To be truly independent, we need to purchase the broadcasting license to ensure long term stability.

"How long is the campaign?"

The campaign is 60 days.Now through Thursday, September 3 at Noon EST.

“How much are you trying to raise?”

$1 Million Dollars is the goal with  stretch goals up to $5 Million Dollars.

“What is a license?”

The license is the permit issued by the FCC (federal communications commision) that allows broadcasters to use a specific part of the radio spectrum.

“What is a frequency?”

The frequency is the specific dial location on the radio spectrum that is allocated to a broadcaster in our case 1025MHz.

“Can you rent a different license or frequency?”

No, there are no comparable licences or frequencies in our area. Communities are only allowed a certain number of frequencies and therefore they are in limited supply.

“How much does it cost to rent your tower and frequency?”

$20,000 Per Month now. See our Time Brokerage Agreement.

Indiegogo policy dictates that campaign owners have no ability to adjust your perk selection. That means we cannot upgrade your perk, we cannot change your perk and we cannot cancel your perk. Please note that contributions made on Indiegogo are also non-refundable.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?                                                       
invest@cd1025.com

story:
PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!!!


Signed original 8"x10" Glossy Photos from 'The Madman In The Basket' session, individually hand developed.

New Album 'Achilles In The Eurozone'

Archive album perks. (see Gallery above for full list)

Signed original 8"x10" Glossy Photos individually hand developed.


Original Andi painting from the 'Embryo' series.

 Poster for the Andi Sex Gang film documentary.


Original Andi painting from the 'Embryo' series.


Original Andi painting from the 'Embryo' series.

Original Andi painting from the 'Embryo' series.

Original Andi painting 'Christ or Crack?'

Original hand-painted Andi artwork with handwritten lyric line from one of his best known songs, 'Sebastiane'.

Full Album Lyric Book hand written and painted by Andi Sex Gang with a personal dedication to pledger.

For those of you who know me, I can be a man of many words, however I shall endeavour to keep this straight and to the point.
For many years I have dedicated my life to the art of music, forming Sex Gang Children at the beginning of 1982 as well as releasing solo material.
 'Achilles in the Eurozone ' will be my 15th solo studio album release in a career where I've had to fight hard to remain artistically independent.
As the role of the record label has become increasingly ever redundant in pushing alternative music out there as a force to be reckoned within popular culture, crowdfunding has become the all important alternative to the record label. It's a risk, but one worth taking and your pre-orders ensure a signed copy of my new album before it's general release.
Rather than opting for some of the usual perks (t-shirts, stickers etc.), I have included my own abstract hand painted pieces of art as part of the bundle packages on offer. I feel it's more personal. It's another important form of self expression that I want to share with you. By pre-ordering  the new album and any of the bundle rewards on offer, your pledge will help fund production and manufacturing costs of the album. This includes extra studio time for final mixing, editing and mastering. Funds will also go towards producing the much needed promotional videos and the more pledges received, the more you help us translate the album through the all important medium of film, promoting the music with the beauty of its visionary eye.
It is now down to us, the music artists to persevere and follow through with our vision and for you, lovers of the art to help us realise that vision, because.. art is a beautiful reality.
Andi x

GO TO GALLERY TO VIEW MORE IMAGES OF ALL AVAILABLE PERKS.

story:
Hi guys and gals,

For the last 2 years, I've been working on recording my songs.  It's been a long road, and I finally have some recordings that I think would compile a great album.  Now I need a little bit of support to have all these new tunes pressed to CD and vinyl for your rocking pleasure.

I've been fortunate enough to have been able to collaborate with several awesome people to hone in what I believe to be my loudest and most intense material to date - AND I WANT TO GIVE IT TO YA!

To master and print the album, we need $2,000.  All of the other efforts of this project have been paid for by me and my friends.  This last little bit of cash would allow this bad boy to come to life in a timely manner.


We will rock your face.

Love,

Phil Stanley and Naughty Water

story:
My name is Robin Benedict, I am 35 years old and I have been singing in public for just over 10 years. 

When I started performing I had no idea that music would eventually take over my life and be my sole source of income.  

With the help of all of you, my goals and dreams seem so much more within my reach! 

The love I have received at live shows and over the WONDERFUL web has made me realize that I am where I am supposed to be. 

I am so thrilled and excited to be making a 7 SONG FULL ALBUM RELEASE that I am proud of and that you will all be proud of as well. 

With your love and support, anything is possible. I will be documenting this entire process for your enjoyment WHEREVER you are in the world, PEACE AND LOVE TO YOU ALL!!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be spent on the following:
1. Pre-Production sessions-these sessions allow for the actual recording to go smoothly and efficiently.
2. Players-these players are pros and artists as well! Their time is valuable.
3. Studio time
4. Rehearsal Space/Time-these sessions allow for all of the players to be in a room together jamming out creative ideas and getting to know each other
5. Engineering-this is the person who captures all the pretty sounds
6. Co-Production-this is the person who helps little old me bring my songs to life!! 
7. Mixing-this is the process of taking all the pretty sounds (cake batter) and baking them until they are fluffy and moist.
8. A MASTER MASTERER. (THE ICING ON THE CAKE) they say that mastering can make or break your recording. I have sought out some amazing mastering engineers in Los Angeles with the help of a good friend with some GREAT connections, YAHOOOO
9. Manufacturing. Once the mastering is completed it is OFF to printing!! My last and ONLY experience with this process, I received 1000 unwrapped c.d.'s and NO apology!! This process also includes album art/photo shoot.
10. WEBSITE. Lets have someone AWESOME design a functional, and exciting new website! I want you to be able to go to robinbenedict.ca to surf through videos, see what I am up to, write to me, listen to me, and find ME wherever I go. 
The amounts for these things vary and if there is ANY funds left over I would LOVE to look into a radio tracker. For those of you who don't know, this is a person who pitches your songs to popular radio. These people are NOT cheap, and there is NO guarantee but the days of dropping off a cassette tape to the lobby of a radio station are OVER!!!
SO THERE YOU HAVE IT!!! 
For those of you who plan to join in the fun, there are some rewards or PERKS as they are called, carefully thought out for you. From receiving some important mail to taking a ride in my Chevy Cavalier!! The end result is celebration and new friendships, these are things I live for.
The Impact:
I had a video on Facebook go crazy with 5 million views back in October.My email and Facebook inbox blew up! I am still not sure if I understand why or how but I do understand people's heart felt words.
 
I understand when a person messages me about their sick child who loves my voice. I understand having a bad day and being released of the tension and stress through music. I don't NEED this album, I need food, water and shelter!! I just can't shake this feeling that it's not really about me, it's about what I can bring to people! SO..... that being said, I NEED a beautiful product to share. Indiegogo has offered endless opportunities for people to work together, build friendships and share the beauty of success!! 

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks, only challenges! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there are a lot of you out there who are passionate about the arts who wish contribute and just cannot!! This does not mean you can't help......share this page, tell a friend, or just send me a message of encouragement, money isn't everything!

story:
Kate's Story

Hey, Everyone,

I'm an indie folk singer/ songwriter/  fiddler with an amazing new CD project, Six Feet Down. The recording and mixing is almost DONE.  I need some believers to help me finish my CD and promote the music!

This is my 6th album and I promise you, it delivers.  Rooted in my own story, the message of the project weaves through the deeper brokenness of our lives and gives a voice to subjects that music often dances around but never fully addresses.  The beauty of it is it's specific and illusive at the same time.  It calls you out if you've lied and cheated your way through life, yet it gives you a voice if you've never been heard.  This CD will give hope to those who are broken and strengthen all of us to move toward truth and wholeness. 

These songs have already been proven out on the road with a resounding response! Now it's time to go public in a bigger way and get Six Feet Down out with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise will pay for the CD cover and T-shirt design, photography, duplication and yes, a music video!  Any extra raised will be put toward promotion to ensure that the CD get's heard in as many markets as possible.  We are budgeting $6,000 but hope to blow through that goal with your support.

We're offering some great incentives for you to get on board, some as simple as pre-ordering a CD, a download or a T-Shirt to holding a house concert for you and your friends, or a corporate event for your company!

The Impact

Can you imagine hearing one of my songs on the radio and saying, "I helped get that song there!" More importantly, these songs will change lives.  From festivals, churches and wineries to prisons and shelters, people are saying, " I feel like you're singing about my life... Thank you for giving me courage to keep up the fight."  Songs on my last two CD's were featured in films and took awards in several categories, but I believe wholeheartedly that this is my best and most creative project to date. Help Six Feet Down hit the streets and make a difference!

Risks & Challenges 

My greatest fear in releasing this project is that people will think it's only for those who've been really traumatized or that they will be afraid it's too heavy.  But don't we buy "break-up" albums all the time?  I think we would all agree that some of the best songs have come from hard times.   This is also a very vulnerable project for me.  I've poured out musically and lyrically in an effort to capture some of the deeper and more difficult stories I've come across including my own.  But the more I hear, the more I realize how common these stories are.  And the more I play it out, the more affirmation I get...  So, I've chosen to own this project fully with no apologies.

I've also taken a bit of a musical departure from my last project which had more of a country feel.  This record uses similar instrumentation with a very Indie Folk sound.  Everyone who's heard it loves it!  I think my fans will fall in love with it too.

Other Ways You Can Help

The simple act of pre-ordering the CD might get us to the goal, but there are other VERY IMPORTANT ways that you can help that don't cost a thing. Would you tell your friends about this campaign and make some noise about it? Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, whatever it takes, a campaign like this takes a team of folks to get the word out and create a buzz.   Indiegogo has share tools that makes this easy to do!

Well, friends, that's it.  I know a lot of you know me and have come out to our shows and supported me and the Kate White Band in numerous ways.  If you can think back to a moment where something I sang or shared made a difference for you, then you know that sums up what my life and music are about.  Just know I will continue to sing my heart out and bring a message of hope wherever the road leads me. I'm honored that you would consider partnering with me in furthering this dream.

Grateful for you,

Kate White

I'm an indie folk singer/ songwriter/  fiddler with an amazing new CD project, Six Feet Down. The recording and mixing is almost DONE.  I need some believers to help me finish my CD and promote the music! This is my 6th album and I promise you, it delivers.  Rooted in my own story, the message of the project weaves through the deeper brokenness of our lives and gives a voice to subjects that music often dances around but never fully addresses.  The beauty of it is it's specific and illusive at the same time.  It calls you out if you've lied and cheated your way through life, yet it gives you a voice if you've never been heard.  This CD will give hope to those who are broken and strengthen all of us to move toward truth and wholeness.  
These songs have already been proven out on the road with a resounding response! Now it's time to go public in a bigger way and get Six Feet Down out with your help.
  What We Need & What You Get
The money we raise will pay for the CD cover and T-shirt design, photography, duplication and yes, a music video!  Any extra raised will be put toward promotion to ensure that the CD get's heard in as many markets as possible.  We are budgeting $6,000 but hope to blow through that goal with your support.
We're offering some great incentives for you to get on board, some as
 simple as pre-ordering a CD, a download or a T-Shirt to holding a house 
concert for you and your friends, or a corporate event for your company!   
  The Impact
Can you imagine hearing one of my songs on the radio and saying, "I helped get that song there!" More importantly, these songs will change lives.  From festivals, churches and wineries to prisons and shelters, people are saying, " I feel like you're singing about my life... Thank you for giving me courage to keep up the fight."  Songs on my last two CD's were featured in films and took awards in several categories, but I believe wholeheartedly that this is my best and most creative project to date. Help Six Feet Down hit the streets and make a difference!
  Risks & Challenges  
 My greatest fear in releasing this project is that people will think it's only for those who've been really traumatized or that they will be afraid it's too heavy.  But don't we buy "break-up" albums all the time?  I think we would all agree that some of the best songs have come from hard times.   This is also a very vulnerable project for me.  I've poured out musically and lyrically in an effort to capture some of the deeper and more difficult stories I've come across including my own.  But the more I hear, the more I realize how common these stories are.  And the more I play it out, the more affirmation I get...  So, I've chosen to own this project fully with no apologies. 
I've also taken a bit of a musical departure from my last project which had more of a country feel.  This record uses similar instrumentation with a very Indie Folk sound.  Everyone who's heard it loves it!  I think my fans will fall in love with it too. 
Other Ways You Can Help
The simple act of pre-ordering the CD might get us to the 
goal, but there are other VERY IMPORTANT ways that you can help that 
don't cost a thing. Would you tell your friends about this campaign and make some noise about it? Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, whatever it takes, a campaign like this takes a team of folks to get the word out and create a buzz.   Indiegogo has share tools that makes this easy to do!
Well, friends, that's it.  I know a lot of you know me and have come out to our shows and supported me and the Kate White Band in numerous ways.  If you can think back to a moment where something I sang or shared made a difference for you, then you know that sums up what my life and music are about.  Just know I will continue to sing my heart out and bring a message of hope wherever the road leads me. I'm honored that you would consider partnering with me in furthering this dream.
Grateful for you,
Kate White

story:
The campaign fund raise to pay jazz musicians performing with Warren Smith during his residency at John Zorn's The Stone (February 24 - March 1, 2015), in order to release as many of these performances as possible.

Warren's work as a sideman across many genres is legendary to those who have followed his career.  As Eugene Chadbourne notes in Warren's All Music biography:

"His reputation has always been that of a no-nonsense, hard-working, and dedicated performer, so he is a favorite working partner of bandleaders or composers who want to present projects with an absolute minimum of hassle or attitude from their collaborators. This list includes Anthony Braxton, Charles Mingus, Henry Threadgill, Van Morrison, Count Basie, Sam Rivers, Tony Williams, and Joe Zawinul."  We can add to this list Bill Dixon. Makanda Ken McIntyre. and Max Roach.

And speaking of Max Roach (from here):

"Of all of Max’s “disciples”, Warren Smith is king. King – not only because of his age (75), and his elevated status among musicians (find me another musician whom everyone likes and admires) – but because he most fully embraces Max’s concept of the percussive arts."

(M'Boom's eight original members in Paris, late '70s/early '80s.  Max Roach seated in the middle of the bottom row, Warren Smith seated to his left.)

This residency at The Stone is an opportunity to reveal Warren's skills as a composer and bandleader.

Once the residency is over Warren will listen to all the performances and he will release the music he feels makes the cut.  Funds from this campaign will go to the musicians who perform on those recordings.  All other costs associated with recording and finishing these recordings are already covered.

And while a compilation of the best performances will be released as a compact disc, the bulk of the music will be released digitally.  

In this way participants in this campaign will be assuring that Warren's work as a bandleader will be available to future music fans.  No musician will ever have the career Warren has had -- jazz, Motown, Broadway orchestras.  Here is a moment to celebrate Warren's contributions and build on them.

In addition to the cd compilation perk, these four catalog releases from Engine Studios are available as downloads for the donors to this campaign:

Warren Smith: Natural/Cultural Forces (Listen)
The Dogon Duo: Warren Smith & Andrew Lamb (Listen)
Andrew Lamb Trio: The New Orleans Suite (Listen)
Stephen Haynes: Parrhesia (Listen)

All donations are tax deductible.

story:
ALL SOCKS WILL BE SHIPPED IN MAY, EVEN IF WE DONT HIT GOAL...HELP US RAISE MONEY FOR THE AUSTIN HUMANE SOCIETY...

About Us

Socxers is a premium sock company based out of Austin TX.  We are dedicated to producing the finest quality socks that are meant to evoke imagery though colors, shapes, and patterns.

A major part of our business model is giving back and helping non-profits raise funds through the sale of custom socks designed for that non-profit.  For this campaign, we chose the Austin Humane Society as our non-profit. 

Serving the Austin community since 1952, the Austin Humane Society (AHS) is the longest standing no-kill shelter in Austin. AHS transforms the lives of animals and the people who love them through life-saving programs that find animals homes, serve animals and people in times of crisis, prevent future homelessness though spay and neuter, and engage the community to be a part of the solution. Over the past year, AHS has unleashed hope for over 11,000 animals thanks to the generosity of our donors.




The Campaign


This Campaign is very important to not only Socxers & the Austin Humane Society, but also to the thousands of cats and dogs that come through their doors each year. 33% of every dollar that goes to this campaign will help dogs and cats with surgery, finding homes, food, and much much more.

Our goal is to raise $15,000 through this campaign, which would net the AHS $5,000!  That is full medical care for 25 dogs and 25 cats, or 50 nights of shelter for 5 homeless animals, or spay/neuter surgery for 100 dogs and 100 cats! 

The rest of the funds will go toward production and shipping.  We have samples from our manufacturer and have been meticulous about the finance side of the business, so we have total confidence in our plan executing to perfection when we hit our target. 






The Socks

All of our socks are premium cotton knitted on a Jaquard loom. We have both women's and Men's socks available, so please make sure to choose which one you are looking for.

Men's Size: 8-13

Women's Size: 7-13



HappyDog - This sock will be revealed upon hitting 100% of our goal


Rewards


We have some pretty cool perks in our purchases in addition to our awesome socks!  The favorite being our $50 level, which gets you a dog bowl, dog toy, and 3 pairs of unique socks designed for the Austin Humane Society.




Even if we don’t reach our goal, we still will be giving 33% of all funds raised to the Austin Humane Society and we will be shipping out all the perks to our backers. 


Stretch Goals


We have decided to not only include stretch goals, which you can see below, but also include Fetch Goals!  For every $15,000 backed, we will donate an extra $500 to the Austin Humane Society on top of the 33%.  That's an additional 25 nights of shelter for one lucky dog or cat!  




Let's Play Fetch......


Treats

All of our $30+ Backers will receive an extra treat.

We are proud to partner with Woof Gang Bakery & Grooming here in Austin, TX.

    

http://www.woofgangaustin.com/



Timeline



Risk's: Right now we foresee no issues, production is already underway on all the socks. we expect to ship within 3-5 days of indiegogo releasing funds.


Every animal has walked a different path in life (or 9).  Some come from puppy mills, others are abandoned or lost, and too many are physically abused. They all have stories to tell and need your help.  This is why we chose #walkamileintheirpaws.  Walk a mile in their paws is our way of raising awareness for all animals that are in need of aid.  Every Sock will have a paw print on the bottom.  Even if you're not adopting, you can still walk in their paws by making a donation or backing our campaign.

Your contribution is appreciated by us and all the animals at the AHS shelter here in Austin, TX.  We hope you enjoy your socks!

Paws Up,

Socxers & Austin Humane Society


Learn More At: http://www.austinhumanesociety.org/

story:
Empowering Youth is as Easy as 1-2-3!!

1 person can empower youth on 2 continents and make an impact that lasts for 3 years by supporting Music to Empower Youth 2015! This campaign's goals are to create a performing arts theatre for the youth One Vibe Africa serves  in Kisumu, Kenya and to establish Madaraka Festival as an annual event to support youth empowerment in Seattle, Washington for the next 3 years.

What is One Vibe Africa?

One Vibe Africa is a Seattle based nonprofit that empowers disadvantaged youth in Kenya by providing them with after school music and arts classes that enable them to develop their artistic talents and avoid negative activities. One Vibe’s Music & Art Program provides young people with classroom space, trained instructors, instruments, a recording studio and community of mentors to support them. One Vibe is empowered to do this by the support of communities in Seattle, Washington who work with us to create local cultural programs that generate funding and support for our organization and its work.

What is Madaraka Festival?

Madaraka Festival is a concert organized by young artists in Seattle that brings musicians from around the globe to the emerald city to raise funds and awareness to support One Vibe’s Music & Art Program. The event bring diverse communities together to share artistic expressions of empowerment inspired by Africa and celebrates the powerful role that music and the arts play in creating vibrant communities.

Madaraka Festival 2015 takes place on May 31st at EMP Museum. An amazing array of musicians are travelling to Seattle from all over the world  to make this one of the most entertaining and empowering musical events the region’s ever seen! The all-star line up includes Sauti Sol (Kenya), Blitz the Ambassador (Ghana/UK), M1 of Dead Prez (FL), Dax Lion (Jamaica), Jus Moni (WA), Aisha Fukushima (CA), Babaluku (Uganda/Canada), Project Lion Heart (WA), LaRue (WA) and Zack Okello (Kenya). The Northwest is already buzzing with excitement for the inspiration these artists will ignite in our community. All that is needed now  is YOU! 

But here’s the thing…

All the money we have is being  used  to serve youth in Kenya so we are a little short on funds. We can’t hold this event unless we raise much of the cost in advance. Hence the Indiegogo campaign! As the saying goes “It takes a village..” and we need you to empower us so we can empower the kids in our global village. If you want this event to take place then now’s your chance to make it happen!

We need you support! 

We want to make sure that EVERYONE can be a part of this cause. Through this campaign, those who can be with us that night have the opportunity to enjoy an exclusive VIP experience of Madaraka Festival in return for their much needed support. Even those who aren’t able to join us in person for the event can be part of the movement and enjoy exclusive souvenirs of the occasion. We also know how much music and art lovers cherish limited edition works – so we have some amazing perks in return for your pledges. Many of them are works of arts created by talented young artists in Kenya who will be empowered by your support. 

All contributions are tax-deductible through Omprakash Foundation, which is a 501© (3) nonprofit corporation that is the fiscal agent for One Vibe Africa. 

This is the opportunity for you as 1 person to make a positive impact on 2 continents that will resonate for 3 years….Its as easy as 1-2-3!

story:
Short Summary

Bercel Music was created three years ago under the initiative of Philippe de Chalendar (French conductor and cello enthusiast) and has since been  organized and taught each summer by Ditta Rohmann (cellist) and László Fassang (organist). These outstanding musicians have established a world-class, seven-day masterclass with a special atmosphere, giving much more to the students than just instrumental knowledge. Bercel Music’s strength is in working with groups of young musicians to  develop creativity and innovation. In addition, the musicians get to know the music and art of interpretation from multiple perspectives thanks to  several guest lecturers, who every evening invite the students into a yet undiscovered field. 

What We Need & What You Get

The first two years of the masterclass have been very successful and attended by international cellists. The course fees  have been very modest thanks to the generous support of the Chalendar family. This year, we are inviting other mentors to be part of our long-term journey, which we hope will  blossom into a regional festival and major artistic venue.

We want to provide the opportunity for talented students with financial difficulties to attend as well. Therefore, we are raising funds to provide scholarships for those that cannot afford the course fees. Additional costs cover the expenses of the visiting guest lecturers, an element of the course that truly enriches the entire experience. 

In return for your support, we invite you to become a part of the Bercel Music community. We will arrange several online streaming events where you can observe our courses and hear exclusive live performances from our world-class musicians. 

The Impact

The impact of Bercel Music does not only limit itself to the international musicians visiting for the summer course. Participants also present several concerts during the course, welcoming audiences from near and far. With the help of modern information processing, webcasting will enable a worldwide audience to have a glimpse inside the special musical world of Bercel. Through this process, this will be the first year in which artists will be invited to share the inspirational week with the musicians.

story:
Hey Guys!

First off, I want to thank you for clicking on my page, my name is Aleko and I am a singer-songwriter from New Jersey. It wasn't until only recently that this project started, deciding it was about time to release these songs. I’ve compiled my work together and I’m taking it into the studio, some of which I’ve already recorded, for my debut EP with Matt Weber of the band Young Statues.

The title of the campaign “Help Aleko Get to Nashville,” is only part of the big plan. After having finished the EP I will have physical copies made to take them from New Jersey to Tennessee, and time spent going there will be used to play shows and distribute the merchandise. Going to Nashville is not the end goal, despite the title of the campaign. As a whole I am looking to not only play shows in Tennessee, but to collaborate with as many talented artists as I can. Doing this will guarantee a diverse array of material and ensure that this momentum is held forward.

I have been wanting to do this for a long time now, and I’m taking every opportunity I can to push this forward. With your help I can both accomplish this goal as well as keep the flow of material going for both current and future fans alike.

Where I need your help most!

Reaching this goal will allow me to finish recording the EP, putting as much of effort and emotion that I can into each song, and support hard copies of my debut EP; more merchandise could follow should the goal be met, or even exceeded. This will give me comfort in being able to spend time in Nashville to give this tour both a productive and successful close, performing and collaborating with other artists.

By contributing you will receive a set reward based on the amount you donated. From digital copies of the EP, handwritten notes thanking each individual who’s shown support, to a signed hard copy of the EP. Whether I reach my goal or not, these donations will be put towards this project. Every donation helps, no matter how big or small, and words cannot express how thankful I am for the support. 

Alternatives.

If you can’t contribute that is fine, but there are other ways you can help.

Simply sharing this page with your friends, family, and getting the word out about this project would benefit me as well. I am dying to show you what I’ve been working on.

You can find me online primarily through Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube to keep up to date with the whole recording process. I want to keep this moving forward, and whether your help is through word, finances, or even both, you play a huge part in keeping this up.

am dying to show you what I’ve been working on. 
You can find me online primarily through Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube to keep up to date with the whole recording process. I want to keep this moving forward, and whether your help is through word, finances, or even both, you play a huge part in keeping this up.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for visiting my crowdfunding page, it really means a lot that you are here!

  • My name is John, I'm 18 years old, i work two jobs, and go to school. I'm also a musician. I have been writing music for years, and now I am finally ready to release my EP "Falling" which is set to release on July 24th of 2015.
  • "Falling" is a small compilation of 5 songs about love. Falling in and out, and how it feels. Emotions of anger, happiness, content, and regret run through your ears as you go along the journey of someone who has a fallen in love.
  • Being an independent artist, means that no one helps me, or funds me, but me. Which is no big deal, honestly I like it that way. But i need help. I am going to have a release party, i have to get physical copies made, and it is going to cost me a lot of money. So that's where you come in!

"Falling" is a small compilation of 5 songs about love. Falling in and out, and how it feels. Emotions of anger, happiness, content, and regret run through your ears as you go along the journey of someone who has a fallen in love. Being an independent artist, means that no one helps me, or funds me, but me. Which is no big deal, honestly I like it that way. But i need help. I am going to have a release party, i have to get physical copies made, and it is going to cost me a lot of money. So that's where you come in!

story:
It's time for another Reggae Worship album. This one is going to be chocked full of reggae interpretations of today's biggest anthems with a healthy dose of Christafari originals. Imagine timeless classics by the likes of Israel Houghton, Matt Redmond, Jesus culture and Hillsong United reinterpreted for reggae lovers worldwide with Christafari's signature sound!

We literally spent every cent that we made off of our last album paying songwriting royalties to the original artists and helping fund our various mission trips.

Thanks to your prayers and support on our last project, we were able to visit 5 continents and see over 68,000 decisions for Christ! The Lord truly has done great things. And we believe that this is just the beginning. Imagine all the incredible things that the Lord will accomplish through this new project!

We've already begun recording the album, but still need to raise at least $30,000 in order to complete it. Here is how the money will be spent:

• $10,000 will go towards the actual recording costs (studio time, paying session players, flights and food for out-of-town featured artists and the licensing costs for all of the hit songs (covering songs is not cheap).

• $10,000 for mastering, artwork, manufacturing and delivery of thousands of CDs plus printing and shipping all the fancy perks that you are going to choose from!

• $10,000 will be allotted for music videos, advertising, marketing and promotional costs for the album. We didn't ask for this last time. That was a big mistake. It took us another year until we could afford to start promoting our album--ouch! Not this time.

• Anything above our $30,000 goal will go towards the standard fees taken by Indiegogo and PayPal and help us maximize the reach of the gospel of Jesus Christ through this album.

We honestly can't do it on our own.

Would you please consider partnering with Christafari and help make our Reggae Worship Anthems project a reality? There are some awesome perks that you can choose from as a special thank you from us for your help.

So what are you waiting for? BECOME A MEMBER OF OUR TEAM TODAY, and when the album comes out and we've seen thousands of lives changed throughout the world, you can honestly smile and know that you're a part of something that is truly making a difference!

===================================

PLEASE SHARE this link to all your friends and family through email, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Blogs, etc...THANKS!

story:
From Rachelyn, Creator of The Rita Rose Show: 

Hello there!
 If you don't happen to be familiar with Rita Rose, she's a 1950s doll inspired from the two showgirls who provide comedic relief in White Christmas. The Rita Rose Show is summarized as a 1950s Comedy/Rockabilly show, in which Rita Rose sings covers of the fabulous ladies of Rockabilly as well as to original tunes written in a similar style. She's a charming gal that leaves her audiences smiling throughout the show with her adorable accent and comedic tendencies.
Since the show has progressed after its premiere in 2013, my dreams for The Rita Rose Show keep getting bigger and bigger. One of those dreams was to have a residency at a resort type venue as it's the perfect show for that particular audience. Guess what? That dream is coming true! Starting June 1st, 2015, I'll get to perform the show while on contract as an Entertainer at a resort. When I received the job offer, I immediately thought, "Before I go, I HAVE to record an EP with my dear Chicago friends who have performed with me and helped shape the show!" 
Recording an EP (and eventually album) of my original tunes was also one of those big dreams. Not only would it be beneficial to have as a souvenir available for future audience members to able to remember the show, but also it would be sentimental as the incredibly talented musicians that I plan to record on the 5 Song EP with me have been there throughout the early shows and have been nothing but encouraging every step of the way.
Where will the funds go? 
  • Funding will go towards studio time, mastering the recordings, securing rehearsal spaces, musician payment, CD artwork, CD Printing, reward merchandise, postage to ship the rewards, and towards the costs of the Farewell Rita Rose Show on May 18.
  • Rewards include a digital download, CD, tickets to the Farewell Rita Rose Show, tickets to future Rita Rose Shows, T-Shirts, Signed Posters, Personalized Video Messages, AND private performances of The Rita Rose Show! 
  • If the goal of $6,000 is not met, the funds will go towards the Farewell Rita Rose Show on May 18, and anything left over will go towards marketing The Rita Rose Show. 

Risks & Challenges

This campaign may seem last minute---and it is! When I received the job offer, I debated for a few days whether or not to launch a crowdfunding campaign due to the fact that we're extremely limited on time to rehearse, record, and get the CD mastered as schedules vary, and my departure from Chicago is just a few weeks away. Obviously, since you're reading this, I felt that it was now or never! 

Other Ways You Can Contribute

If you're unable help fund, as a starving artist, I completely get it! ;) The fact that you've read this far means the world to me. You CAN, however, be a huge help by sharing this campaign on social media with the Indiegogo share tools or by telling your family and friends about it. :)

XOXO

story:
Brooklyn's own upstart wind symphony is the first NYC based group ever invited to WASBE!:

Who We Are
The Brooklyn Wind Symphony (BKWS) is a select all-volunteer 65 piece wind ensemble run for and by our members.  We are a diverse, yet like-minded, group of advanced instrumentalists who play the most esteemed repertoire for symphonic wind ensembles and regularly share this craft with the public. Since its inception in 2008, BKWS has performed at Columbia University, Lincoln Center, the Midwest Band and Orchestra Clinic in Chicago and most recently Carnegie Hall. BKWS has also been featured twice on Performance Today which is America's most popular classical music radio program with an audience reach of 1.4 million listeners each week.
"The Brooklyn Wind Symphony's ability to flourish outside of an institution is, in a word, extraordinary." --Viet Cuong, 2013 ASCAP Young Composer Award Winner
"...I thank all involved for showcasing the unmatched artistry of wind instruments and for sharing their love of this art form with Brooklyn and beyond." --Marty Markowitz, Former Brooklyn Borough President
The World Association for Symphonic Bands and Ensembles (WASBE) strives to promote symphonic bands and ensembles as serious and distinctive mediums for musical expression and cultural heritage. Invitations to perform are extended after a rigorous blind audition process and ensembles from around the globe apply to perform for this bi-annual conference. BKWS was accepted upon its first submission and will be one of very few community ensembles in attendance. While our passion for music secured an invitation, your support is what will send our musicians to WASBE conference in San Jose, CA this July.



(Photos by Christopher Rushing)

What We Need 

BKWS is sponsored by the Metropolitan Music Community (MMC) which is a 501c3 non-profit run entirely by volunteer effort. Our operating budget and low overhead allows us program adventurously but special projects such as the WASBE conference require additional financial support. All donations to this project are tax deductable!

We need $9000 for the following:

  • Most of our 65 members are paying for this trip out of pocket but we need to cover travel for our members who have financial hardship.
  • Cross country oversized instrument transportation to and from San Jose. 
  • Printing and shipping the programs that let conference attendees know who we are and our mission
  • Specialty percussion instrument transport while in San Jose.

The Impact

BKWS' WASBE performance is fantastic stage to showcase our organization's unique "by the community, for the community" mantra:

  • Our performance will show conference attendees that high quality wind band music is achievable by volunteers and in an urban setting.
"The ceiling tiles hang so low that it’s easy to imagine Maestro Ball’s baton sticking 

straight in, if a passionate enough passage came along. Written on the chalkboard 

is “Maslanka/Markowski”, both very kindly sharing a big letter ‘M.’ They begin 

rehearsing Symphony No. 4, and when the low reeds enter for the first time, the 

room transforms into a cathedral..." --Michael Markowski, First Prize Winner of the Inaugural Frank Ticheli Composition Contest




  • BKWS values serious contemporary works of both established and emerging composers. All but one of the compositions on our WASBE program were written by living composers and several works are from composers under the age of 30.


  • The caliber of our musicianship is so exceptional, that BKWS ensemble members Jeffrey Hodes and Samantha K. Enriquez will be featured as soloists on two concertos including the West Coast premiere of David Maslanka's Clarinet Concerto.



  • BKWS makes it a point to share musical gains with our community. Many of the composers who we are featuring on this program have already shared their talents by working with our sister ensemble the Grand Street Community Band and with our biggest fans, the awesome music students at Grand Street Campus. 

(Photo by Jasmine Britt)

  • Our continued appearance at conferences like WASBE allow us additional interactions with internationally recognized artists, conductors, and composers. It is our hope that our appearance at the WASBE conference will entice even more of these individuals to share their wealth of knowledge with our local Brooklyn music community in the future.


Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from financial support, you can help us realize this goal further by doing the following!

  • Share this Indiegogo link with your friends--let them know that you believe in community music too!
  • Like the Brooklyn Wind Symphony on Facebook and/or follow us on Twitter, then invite others to do so that we can broaden our audience reach for this project and continue to generate conversation about our love for the wind band!
  • For our local supporters, join us at our WASBE send off concert at the Grand Street Campus on Saturday, June 13th at 2pm at 850 Grand Street in Brooklyn. Proceeds from the concert will also go towards getting the ensemble to WASBE.
  • For our supporters in the San Jose area, join us at our WASBE performance on July 13th, at 8pm at the California Theatre in downtown San Jose, CA.

For our supporters in the San Jose area, join us at our WASBE performance on July 13th, at 8pm at the California Theatre in downtown San Jose, CA.

story: The heart of The Savage Radley lies in rural western Kentucky, land of meandering rivers, rolling fields and tight-knit communities. Stemming from the tradition of delta folk, Shaina Goodman and Stephen Montgomery meld themes of community, loyalty, heartbreak, and perseverance into their captivating indie folk narratives. Houses, The Savage Radley’s upcoming album, embodies the difficult but liberating task of finding who you are in a new place. The Savage Radley is passionate about preserving the tradition of music that tells a story. You can help TSR raise $10,000 to record (Which includes: Studio fees, producer fees, mastering, travel cost, studio musician expenses, equipment maintenance), distribute (Which includes: Pressing the album, album art, digital card fees, digital card art, postage), and promote (Which includes: EPK graphic design fees, Promotion Photos, media team fees) their first album. Preserve the music of a rural river culture. Click Contribute Now.

story:
Greg Jones:

"Faded" is a song about my grandparents: their farm, their lives, and their impact on my life. It is so much more than about memories. Everything in life is once new and bright, just like the barn and car on the album cover. We all have hopes and dreams, and just like the barn and car, these can fade too. Along with the other songs on this album, you will be encouraged to find hope in your daily struggles; and to carry on despite what life throws your way.

 Today I am asking for your help. Writing and recording the songs is only the first part of the challenge. These songs need to be mixed, mastered, and ultimately put into a format for you to be able to enjoy.  
 You will find a variety of ways that you can contribute to the final process of this album becoming a reality.   Everything from a $10 donation, which rewards you with an autographed CD; to a $250 donation, which rewards you with a private concert in your own home, church, or place of business.
If you are unable to contribute financially to this project, you can still be a HUGE help in making this dream of mine a reality. You can share this on social media with your family and friends, in case they would be interested in helping.

Thanks to ALL of you for helping with this amazing project!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello all, my name is Reggie of PuppetMaster Entertainment! First I'd like to thank all who took the time to look at our campaign and decided to make a contribution. I'm very excited about helping my artist Mr. Envi' get back on the road for his first official album tour this Fall 2015! Many of you may have seen post here and there promoting shows in the Ark-La-Tex area or followed local tours on social media I've presented, but I'm ready to expand up to 20 cities all over the U.S.!

What We Need & What You Get

As exciting as this will be for us, everything comes with an expense. My team and I are looking to raise funds primarily for gas, merchandise, CD's, lodging and a rental van. 

As you can see there are many ways for you to get involved. Any amount we'd humbly and truly appreciate. We hope to meet as many of you as possible on the 2015 Damage Kontrol Tour. 

The Impact

It is important to me that my team will be maintaining gas in tank, as well as food in our stomach, and a place to lay our heads. No matter what, we'll enjoy every moment in the experience and arrive home safely. 

We hope to fulfill the majority of rewards no later than September 2015, should the project be incredibly successful and exceed our expectations, but depending of how many supporters, we could run into delays. We will keep you informed of our progress via social media.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when completing any project, including making an album and touring. We have a dedicated team to help us along the way, and a few friends and family members to call on should we need additional help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone isn't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all in advance.

story:
About our project

The Matt Jacobs Band is one of the best and most successful blues and rock bands in The Netherlands. The next step is recording the new CD with original songs. The studio has been booked already, and the funding will be used for mixing, mastering, artwork and so on. The goal? Producing an international sounding album that will break our boundaries.

Stardom, here we come!

Our goal is 5000 dollars. Why? A good mix and sublime mastering is essential to get our music across. Do you support blues and rock? Do you love real music? This is your chance to join our community and help us out on our road to stardom!


    Our band

    Feel free to visit our website: www.matt-jacobs.com. We used to play a bunch of cover songs, but we are ready to take over the world now with our own songs!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you don't have any money, please help us by sharing this project with your friends. This will sure help!

About our project
The Matt Jacobs Band is one of the best and most successful blues and rock bands in The Netherlands. The next step is recording the new CD with original songs. The studio has been booked already, and the funding will be used for mixing, mastering, artwork and so on. The goal? Producing an international sounding album that will break our boundaries. 
  Stardom, here we come!
 Our goal is 5000 dollars. Why? A good mix and sublime mastering is essential to get our music across. Do you support blues and rock? Do you love real music? This is your chance to join our community and help us out on our road to stardom!
    Our band
Feel free to visit our website: www.matt-jacobs.com. We used to play a bunch of cover songs, but we are ready to take over the world now with our own songs!
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't have any money, please help us by sharing this project with your friends. This will sure help!

story:
Short Summary


5 Points Blok Party  was founded in 2015 by business owner, entrepreneur  & community organizer Joseph Marshall (http://www.kindsociety.net)  &  Rick Bradshaw , a proud veteran and small business owner,  graduate of Tennessee State University, aspiring philanthropist  & regional director of Concrete Magazine  . This event will attract hundreds of fans & residents, who will inject thousands of dollars into the Alabama economy. This festival  is important to our efforts to progress and preserve the culture in the community, strengthening the bond, trust and rapport with our residents.

Your contribution will help us secure the tools and resources necessary to serve you and the community and deliver a fun, rich  cultural experience .

Five Points is one of Huntsville's Historic Preservation Districts, established in 1999. Initially part of the 1892 East Huntsville Addition, it developed slowly over the course of a century. This neighborhood's significance lies in its illustration of the evolution of middle-class housing in 20th century Huntsville, rather than a concentration of one period. Learn more about Huntsville's first suburb (Click Here)

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help cover the most cost effective expenses,  and invest in the local prosperous commerce.

Our goal is to raise $3,500. A detailed expense report (Excel)  is available upon request and will be delivered within 14 business days after the event. You will receive a receipt for all donations, monetary or material.

Costs include but not limited to

  • Performance Stage - $500

  • Sound & Lighting - $500

  • Complimentary snacks & beverages -  $500 (Donations are welcome. We need all we can get)

  • Moon Bounce - $350

  • Childrens activity Booth - $100

  • Security - $100

  • Marketing and promotion - $1,200

  • Event & Staff T-Shirts - $500

  • Videographer - $100

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Pass out flyers, share us on your social networks (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter)
  • You can also use cool share tools here at indiegogo.

All donations and contributions are welcome. Food, snacks and beverages must be sealed and in its original packaging. ( You may donate items at the following locations or schedule a pickup/dropoff on our facebook page (See Tim Miller).
