story:
Short Summary

We've formed 'Bostin', a one-time only 'Boston' tribute band, in order to record our own version of their classic hit 'Amanda' to help raise much needed funds in aid of our much loved friend and colleague Amanda Attwood.

Why We Are Doing This

Earlier this year Amanda was struck down by a life-changing and very unexpected stroke. Amanda, a 34-year old mum of two, has been part of our team since 2012 and we were all taken aback when we heard the shocking news of her sudden illness.

We have all been thinking about Amanda and her family a lot over the past few months. As a team we like to think of ourselves as a family, and like any good family we wanted to show Amanda how much we miss her and wish her a speedy recovery.

So, when one of the team heard Boston's 'Amanda' on the radio on his drive to work one day a light-bulb moment happened.

The team already has a few budding musicians, as well as its fair share of show-offs, so the idea of putting together a band with a group of supporting performers to record a cover version of the song seemed a good one.

 We hope that the song will put a smile on Amanda's face and let her know that we miss her. We also hope that we can use this as an opportunity to raise some funds the benefit both Amanda and her family and the Stroke Association, the UK's leading stroke charity.

What Are We Going To Do

Our newly formed band 'Bostin' will be going in to the studio to professionally (!) record our own specially adapted version of the classic Boston song 'Amanda' (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hLZs7d1CPms).
We are also going to try to record a 'lipdub' video (for example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nMuRWRqpQXQ) of the song, featuring our pledgers, colleagues and friends.
All of which will be posted on our Facebook page for you all to enjoy: https://www.facebook.com/songforamanda
So, we really need you all to pledge us for as much as you can so that this can be as awesome as it can be!

Your Pledges

We've put together a range of perks that we feel will help us to raise as much money as possible. 

There's something for everyone, and hopefully you can be as generous as possible to help us raise our target of £500.

Some of the money raised will be used to help fund the production of the song - this will entirely be for things we have to buy, it will not be to pay the 'musicians' (we're all giving out time and skills free of charge) or to pay anyone in a profitable way. We will make sure that as much as possible makes it's way to Amanda and the Stroke Association - you can hold us to that!

Risks & Challenges

Without wanting to be too serious here, the biggest risk is that a stroke could hit anyone of us at any time. We all have a responsibility to live a healthy and fit lifestyle, but we also need invaluable research to be funded by charities like the Stroke Association to make sure that the risk of stroke is understood and minimised for all of us. We also need to support valuable networks of carers and volunteers who help those who have experienced a stroke to get back to a normal life.

The more we get from your pledges, the more we can give and the closer we all get to living a life that is free from the threat of an unexpected and devastating stroke.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can donate directly to the Stroke Association here: https://www.stroke.org.uk/donate/make-donation

story:
Version Française  (English version below)

En route pour l'enfer

Hell Of A Ride c'est un éboulement sonore de gros riffs, de rythmiques lourdes, une explosion de moteur V8 chargé à la nitroglycérine, une virée d'enfer portée par un Heavy "Stunt" Rock aux accents de Metal, au parfum de Southern Rock et aux racines de Hard Rock. 

Non seulement le groupe s'offre un arsenal auditif puissant et rôdé, mais il s'appuie sur un univers visuel fort, inspiré d'un cinéma galvanisé au Rock'N'Roll. Il suffit d'écouter les titres de leur EP "Fast As Lightning" (produit par Charles "Kallaghan" Massabo) pour être transporté dans cet univers bercé par la soif de vivre, la revanche, la nostalgie et l'adrénaline. 

C'est sur cette trame que Hell Of A Ride s'est bâtit une réputation scénique fulgurante, amenant le groupe à jouer en première partie de Black Stone Cherry (USA) dans une Maroquinerie pleine à craquer avec un public réactif dès les premières notes du Show. Enchaînant concerts et showcases radio, le groupe décide de dévoiler une facette plus posée en rodant un set acoustique entièrement revisité pour en faire une captation live. Celle-ci figurera sur la version "deluxe" de leur EP qui sortira en 2013 sur le label "Send The Wood", distribué physiquement par "Season Of Mist" dans de nombreux points de vente en France. 

Hell Of A Ride fera alors de nombreuses apparitions dans des Festivals Rock/Metal franciliens (Mennecy Metal Fest, Triel Open Air...) et dans l'émission "Une Dose 2 Metal" présentée par Stéphane Buriez (Loudblast)...

Avec Hell Of A Ride, préparez-vous à vivre au rythme d'une course poursuite infernale !


Faites partie de notre histoire

Nous sommes vraiment impatients de vous faire découvrir notre nouvel opus. Nous avons toujours porté à coeur de vous faire vibrer aussi bien par notre musique que par notre image.
C'est pourquoi, pour franchir cette prochaine étape dans notre histoire et vous faire découvrir en avant première la bête, avant sa sortie mondiale le 26 octobre 2015, nous avons plus que jamais besoin de vous.
Peu importe ce que l'industrie de la musique est devenue au fil des années, il y aura toujours une chose sur laquelle nous pourrons compter, votre soutien. 
Nous voulons que ce nouvel album soit quelque chose d'unique pour vous comme pour nous et dont nous pourrons tous être fiers. Notre histoire est aussi la votre, plus que tout, nous espérons que vous vous joindrez à nous pour la suite de la route.


A chacun sa "Bête noire"

"Bête Noire" est le premier album studio de Hell Of A Ride, enregistré à Paris par Charles "Kallaghan" Massabo et mixé/masterisé par ses soins à Los Angeles. Ces 11 titres démontrent tout le savoir-faire du groupe en matière de refrains accrocheurs et fédérateurs avec une énergie maîtrisée à la perfection. Rempli de subtils clins d’œil aux monuments du Hard Rock et du Metal de ces 20 dernières années, "Bête Noire" offre une explosion de morceaux addictifs. De "Aphrodisiac Cadillac", véritable hymne de débauche Rock'N'Roll,  à la ballade abrasive "Rain Of Fuel", H.o.a.R vous transportera, rappelant la machine rythmique d'AC/DC, les riffs sexy des Guns'N'Roses et de Nickelback, la puissance de Metallica et les envolées mélodiques de Shinedown et d'Alter Bridge. Le tout porté par une sonorité riche en couleurs, digne de groupes tels que Faith No More, Korn ou encore Marylin Manson, Hell Of A Ride sait manier un large registre sans jamais tomber dans les clichés. 

L'album sera edité en version Digipack avec un CD de 11 titres, une superbe qualité visuelle, un contenu exclusif, un booklet racontant la suite des aventures de john "MAD DOG" Ringsdale. La version numérique bénéficiera, elle aussi, de ce contenu en version pdf. Il sera disponible chez tous les disquaires, plateformes d'écoute et de téléchargement numérique le 26 octobre prochain.


Ce dont nous avons besoin

  1. Avec 3000 euros, vous nous aiderez à promouvoir l'album et couvrir les coûts de merchandising.
  2. Avec 5000 euros, un clip sera réalisé !
  3. Si votre générosité l'emporte et que nous dépassons les 5000 euros, nous pourrons vos proposer toujours plus de contenus exclusifs, de vidéos, de clips...


Votre aide sera récompensée

Chaque don sera récompensé, soyez le premier à écouter, toucher, sentir...  la "bête", les nouveaux t-shirts... et recevez votre récompense avant la sortie de notre album.
A chaque pallier de 1000 euros atteint une surprise sera révélée...


D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas faire de don, rien de grave. Vous pouvez toujours contribuer à ce que le monde soit au courant de cette campagne, alors n'hésitez pas à la partager sur Facebook, twitter, google+... Plus il y aura de monde et plus nous aurons la chance d'atteindre, voir dépasser notre objectif.
Répandez le message à travers le web. 

NOUS NE VOUS DIRONS JAMAIS ASSEZ MERCI ET Ô COMBIEN ON VOUS AIME!!!

English version

Road to Hell

Hell Of A Ride is a rumbling sound of big riffs, heavy rhythmics, an explosion of a heavy charged V8 engine filled with nitroglycerin, a trip to hell carried by a Heavy "Stunt" Rock with Metal accents, Southern Rock flavor and Hard Rock roots.

Not only the band offers a powerful and strongly developed auditive arsenal, but it relies on a strong visual universe inspired by a galvanized Rock'N'Roll cinema.  Just listen to the track "Fast As Lightning" from their 1st EP  (produced by Charles "Kallaghan" Massabo) to be carried in this world rocked by the thirst for life, revenge, nostalgia and adrenaline.

It is on this basis that Hell Of A Ride has built a tremendous live reputation, allowing the band to open for Black Stone Cherry (USA) in a sold out Maroquinerie in Paris with a fantastic and reactive audience from the first notes of the show.  With concerts and radio showcases back to back, the group has decided to unveil a more calm facet of their music with an acoustic set entirely revisited to make a live recording.  This version will appear on the "deluxe edition" of their 1st EP released in 2013 on the label "Send The Wood", distributed by "Season Of Mist" in many stores in France.

Hell of a Ride appeared in many Rock & Metal Festivals (Mennecy Metal Fest, Triel Open Air...) and in the French TV show "Une Dose de Métal" hosted by Stéphane Buriez (Loudblast).

With Hell of a Ride, get ready to live to the rhythm of an infernal car chase !




Be a part of our history

We are really looking forward for you to listen to our new album. We have always been keen to make you vibrate through our music as well as our image. That's why, to take a step further in our history and introduce you to the Beast before its worldwide release on October the 26 2015, we need you all more than ever. No matter what the music industry has become over the years, there will always be something we can count on, your support. We want this album to be something unique for you and for us, so that we can all be proud of. Our story is also yours, and most of all, we really hope that you will join us for the rest of the ride.



To each his "Bête noire"

"Bête Noire" is Hell Of a Ride's first studio album recorded in Paris by Charles "Kallaghan" Massabo and mixed / mastered by himself in Los Angeles. These 11 tracks demonstrate the know-how of the band's regarding catchy and federative choruses and unifying energy controlled to perfection. Filled with subtle nods to the monuments of Hard Rock and Metal over the last 20 years, "Bête Noire" offers an explosion of addictive songs such as "Aphrodisiac Cadillac", an hymn of debauchery Rock'N'Roll to the abrasive ballad "Rain of Fuel". Hell of a Ride will carry you, recalling the rhythm machine of AC / DC, Guns'N'Roses and Nickelback sexy riffs, the power of Metallica and the melodic flights of Shinedown and Alter Bridge. All supported by a rich tone color, deserving of groups such as Faith No More, Korn or Marilyn Manson, Hell of a Ride knows how to handle a wide register without falling into clichés.

This album will be edited in CD Digipack version of 11 tracks, superb visual quality, exclusives contents, a road book telling stories of john " MAD DOG " Ringsdale. The digital version release will benefit, too, this content in pdf format. It will be available in all stores, listening platforms and digital download on October 26th.



What we need

  1. With 3000 euros, you will help us to promote our album and cover the merchandising costs.
  2. With 5000 euros, a music video will be released !
  3. If your generosity wins and we go beyond the 5000 euros,  we can offer you even more exclusive contents, videos...


What you get

Each gift will be rewarded, be the first to listen, touch, smell... the beast, the new tees... and receive your retribution before our album release.
Each step of 1000 euros reached, a surprise will be revealed...


Other ways you can help

If you cannot make a monetary contribution, don't count yourself out. There are still ways you can help us achieve our goal. Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, google +...
Let's do whatever it takes to get the awareness out there! The more people that know about our fundraiser, the better. 


WE NEVER SAID ENOUGH THANK YOU AND HOW MUCH WE LOVE YOU!!!

If your generosity wins and we go beyond the 5000 euros, 
we can offer you even more
exclusive contents, videos...




What you get
Each gift will be rewarded, be the first to listen, touch, smell... the beast, the new tees... and receive your retribution before our album release.Each step of 1000 euros reached, a surprise will be revealed...


















Other ways you can help


If you cannot make a monetary
contribution, don't count yourself out. There are still ways you can help us
achieve our goal. Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, google +... Let's do whatever
it takes to get the awareness out there! The more people that know about our
fundraiser, the better. 

WE NEVER SAID ENOUGH THANK YOU AND HOW MUCH WE LOVE YOU!!!

story:
CrowdFestival Community! (UK BASED FESTIVAL)

https://www.facebook.com/crowdfestivaluk?pnref=... - Please like & share our Facebook page :)

WHO AM I?
Ill start by introducing myself. My name is Michael Evers which some of you may find hilarious as Im here asking you all to help set up the best festival we've ever heard of and the person who set up Glastonbury is called, Michael Eavis. Haha I know! Here I am trying to set up a festival... Anyway, my friends call me Mike, I don't mind either but what I do mind is the fact I don't know who is asking for me when I'm with my dad, yes you have guessed it, my dad is also called Michael Evers! 

My job... Currently I work as an Estate Agent, dealing with property in and around Liverpool and now you're asking why Im here trying to do this, so I will tell you. I like to think of myself as a people person and real life interaction for me, is what life is about. But that is my opinion, this may differ for other people, after all, the internet is a great place and that's why i'm here! I can't lie, I do love my job but mainly for the reason of meeting new people. Of course, Liverpool does have nice buildings and I'm sure some of you will agree. 

YOU ARE IN CONTROL OF THE IDEA
Okay people, here it goes... Im a Liverpool based Music loverrr who wants to start up , ' Crowd festival'. I've been working on this idea for numerous years and now it is ready to wear it's wellies! As they say you have to walk before you can run, I fully believe this idea is ready to run...

You may ask what makes this festival any different from the rest? Well, this is where it gets good. This festival is different because it is funded by US for US! In my opinion this should mean WE get to choose the line up? Well if you were thinking the same, then you would be correct in thinking so. How exciting is this?!? WE are in control of what will be the biggest community based festival in the world.

'Crowd festival' will have an online voting poll which will allow US to elect any act WE want. This is a crowd fund based exercise so I will say depending on the amount raised will depend on what acts are affordable within OUR funding community. But I'm sure YOU had already realised that! As this is all about team work, WE can decide what we do with any left over money, there will be options available for YOU to choose from in terms of donating to charity and even down to how WE advertise. I am as much apart of this plan as YOU guys! After all, a community based brain is better than a single one and as the saying goes, 'together, we can achieve anything'.

My aim is to bring people together with all kinds of music tastes and create a social environment where we can all experience new music and get a long. Whether you like Black Keys or Calvin Harris, my goal is to have a place WE can enjoy both. It is not much to ask for is it, after all WE like what WE like! Gone are the days WE pay for our ticket and have a line up given to us.

The Festival will be held over a three day period in August 2016. We aim to have ten top of the chart acts on each day with a lot of new and upcoming artists playing their own stages. There will be a mixture of style and sound at 'CrowdFestival' it will be everything from Electronic, Dance/House through to Indie Rock and Metal. The best thing is we can decide who plays! 

THE COSTS
I will start this section by saying that if we do not meet the funds required to take our festival straight to the top we will still run it regardless and provide a Crowdfunded Festival. We will definitely continue to grow our Community each year and provide great Music for us by us. 

Anyone who donates for a, 'ticket option' will receive a valid ticket for the Festival. The website will be launched when we reach £15,000 in total. The first acts will be posted for vote when we reach £50,000. When we reach £250,000, that is when things get super exciting! Let's do this!!

Okay, so back to what this section is about, through extensive research, 'Crowd Festival' have calculated the running and maintenance cost to be Two Million Pounds to make this the event of a lifetime. If we reach 5 million pound then that can only mean an even better festival! We will make sure this is something worth donating too. I agree, It does sound a lot but with anything extreme, it sooner becomes much more possible as long as we have people around us to help. This money will cover staff wages, acts, land hire and maintenance costs. This won't be a walk in the park, there is a lot of planning to do but together we can do anything. A man with a pound in his pocket can not achieve what a community of 5 milliton can when they put their pounds together. 

WHAT IS NEXT
Once we have succesfully reached our goal and the polling is completed, every ticket entitled person will receive their tickets bio 1st class recorded delivery . I bet you cannot wait now, I know i can't! 'Crowd Festival' will take place the summer of 2016. The location will be confirmed once the Campaign has finished. Im sure we all have a few ideas in mind! (100% UK BASED) EEEEEEK!


Other Ways You Can Help

Im sure we all understand donating money is not the only way people can help us, if we all could, we all would appreciate it if we were to share this Campaign on our own Facebook Profiles, Twitter Accounts and any other form of social media. 

There is no better advertisement than word of mouth!

Thank you for your involvement and cheers to US!

I bet you cannot wait now, I know i can't! 'Crowd Festival' will take place the summer of 2016. The location will be confirmed once the Campaign has finished. Im sure we all have a few ideas in mind! (100% UK BASED) EEEEEEK!
    

Other Ways You Can Help

 Im sure we all understand donating money is not the only way people can help us, if we all could, we all would appreciate it if we were to share this Campaign on our own Facebook Profiles, Twitter Accounts and any other form of social media. 
There is no better advertisement than word of mouth!
Thank you for your involvement and cheers to US!

story:
We are Moonlight and Morning Star. We are musicians, songwriters and anti-pipeline/anti-fracking activists. We’re honored that you are here listening to our story.

Over the last year we’ve become deeply passionate about the untold environmental devastation caused by fracking, and through our activism helped convince our town to ban a high pressured fracked gas pipeline that Kinder Morgan, a subsidiary of Tennessee Gas Pipeline Co. wants to build in our beautiful Connecticut River Valley. This passion led us to write a song called "Time To Stop The Pipelines” which we’ve been singing throughout Western, MA.

 People in our area have loved the song and have encouraged us to get it out to folks across the country who, like us, face the destruction and dangers that fracking and its pipelines bring. 

    We’ve launched this campaign for two purposes: 1. to make a high quality audio recording of the song with a group of great musicians, and a youtube video  that incorporates both the song and our spoken word presentation, "When The Water Spoke". 

And 2. To reach people who do not yet understand the enormous damage and destruction created by fracking and fracked gas pipelines and those who might be able to stop this travesty. 

                                          FRACKED WATER  LOOKS LIKE THIS!

                   EXPLOSIONS AND LEAKS ARE EVERYWHERE!

 We’d love for people to have a song to sing to uplift them in their fight against the massive destruction of our land, water and air, being foisted upon us by companies that will reap huge profits. 

We envision that our video will help spread awareness about the dangers to all forms of life that we are facing due to fracking, pipelines and compressor stations. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW SO THAT WE CAN MAKE THE RECORDING WITH OUR BAND ON AUGUST 13, 2015. IT'S JUST 3 WEEKS AWAY!

We will use the funds we raise to pay for: studio time; the recording engineer; the band; the videographer; copyright, duplication and distribution costs; graphic artist costs.

Please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and colleagues who believe in this cause.  We cannot thank you enough for your support!!!!

 STOP FRACKING AND FRACKED GAS PIPELINES!

SUPPORT RENEWABLE ENERGY - WATER, WIND AND SUN!!

LET’S PRESERVE A SAFE AND HEALTHY LIFE ON OUR BEAUTIFUL EARTH FOR GENERATIONS TO COME!!!

Cover photo on video: Rene Theberge c 2015        Above photo:  Diane Norman

story:
Short Summary

The Darkroom Project is set up and run by Kim Conway  

and Jo Bridges

We are two professional photographers who are passionate about film photography and traditional printing techniques. 

Having both graduated from University with photography degrees, it became apparent that there is a lack of traditional  photographic darkrooms in Kent. With hundreds of photography students leaving universities, colleges and schools locally each year having studied hard and gained darkroom expertise and qualifications; as well as artists and hobbyist's who also use or are interested to learn traditional analogue photography and printing methods, we realised that there is a real need for an affordable facility that reflect the on-going revival of film photography.

The Darkroom Project will provide a range of photographic services. The  main Darkroom will houses 9 enlargers –  35mm, medium and large format. There will also be a negative developing booth, negative drying cabinet and print drying rack. Next to The Darkroom will be a viewing room with light boxes and a print retouching area. 

The Darkroom will also offer a variety of workshops pitched at a varying abilities; from first timers to ‘master-classes’ where professionals can hone their skills in specific printing methods. "Alternative" historic techniques will also be taught. One to one tuition and support plus career progression to photographers of all abilities will be available.

Bookings will be  for a morning or afternoon session.

Tuesday – Friday morning session (10am-1pm)

Tuesday – Friday afternoon session (2-5pm)

Each session costs £15 and all users will be required to pay an annual Resort Facilities Membership fee of £35 before using The Darkroom; this will also give members the use of ALL Resort's Hire facilities, including Hello Print Studio,  Firebird Jewellery Studio and access to the Resort Gallery -The Darkroom will invite its users to submit work for an annual show.

We have done a lot of the core structural work ourselves

                                                               

and have been very lucky and are very grateful to professional photographer Jason Evans and The Ramsgate Music Hall for hosting three fund-raising gigs which has raised the funds to enable us to complete the electrics and plumbing.

We are in the final stages of completion and with your help, we hope to raise the £2,500 we need to able to complete our project and to get the space ready to welcome the first members in September.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £2,500  to: 

Install the workstations; 

Buy the negative drying cabinet;

Have the print racks built 

and to enable us to have all our equipment PAT tested for safety.

In Return we offer various "Thank you" rewards ranging from hand made fine art photographic prints, to complimentary darkroom sessions, one to one tuition and workshops. 

If we do not reach our £2,500 goal, we will put what donations we have received towards buying as much of the remaining items and services we need to reach completion, so you can rest assured every single penny we raise will be used to get The Darkroom Project up and running. 

The Impact

Traditional photographic darkrooms have been in steady decline since the emergence of digital photography and Photoshop. We feel it is important to keep film photography and darkroom printing techniques alive. We have nothing against digital photography and software editing but nothing beats the joy of 'making' a photograph; the developing of the negative and printing process is magical when you see a fine art photographic print appear before your very eyes. It is still a wonder to experience and it is always a joy to be 'hands on' in the creation process. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute a financial donation,  this doesn't mean you can't help:

If you have a spare working negative drying cabinet or print drying rack or if you are qualified to PAT test electrical equipment, then we would be very grateful! 

Please share this campaign with your friends and with people you think may be interested. It is very easy to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
side

Jason's Story

Hey there!  Thank you so much for visiting my page! My name is Jason Christopher and I'm a singer/songwriter originally from Athens, Al.  I've been involved in music since I was in the second grade in some shape form or fashion... Anywhere from singing lead soprano in the local Boy's choir, My high school band playing the snare drum, playing my very first songs at open mic nights in college, and finally to signed songwriter in Nashville.  I LOVE MAKING MUSIC!  Plain and Simple! I also love Jesus Christ my Lord and Savior! My whole life I've been a believer, but at the same time I guess I always had it in my head that "I will settle down and be a good little christian soon, but for now it's about "me".  Uhhhggg, that pains me to write, but it's the truth! Or WAS the truth that is!  About a year ago, Jesus came to my front door, knocked on it, and snatched me right out of my shoes when I opened the door! ;)  Seriously, he started working on me in a BIG way and I have been blessed beyond belief, as well as have personally witnessed many miracles during this short amount of time. Needless to say, I now live my entire life with him at the front of every thought. That said, my goals have changed. I don't mean my style or anything like that, I mean I feel divinely inspired! I feel inspired to bring music back to something that is real, inspirational, emotional, and "good". Enough of the songs about killing, raping, degrading women, worshiping false idols, and so on and so forth. 


I’ve decided to join Indiegogo and ask for help from LOVERS OF JESUS AND  MUSIC FROM ACROSS THE GLOBE so I can make a “real” and genuine album.  One that is the same quality as one of the really big studios would put out. What do I mean by “real” album?  I mean that it’s straight from my soul, and I don’t want anyone telling me what I can and can’t “feel” when sharing my music that came straight from my life, experiences and own personal creative takes on things! You see, I’m a song writer and as such an artist...Telling me this or that won't fly is like telling a painter that he's not allowed to use the color red!  I don’t churn out 10 songs a month that are radio ready for the masses of people that the big labels have brainwashed into thinking are great! I’m a Christian and a country boy with a lot of soul and a rock and roll heart! Hear the music from this album I want to make, and you’ll know exactly what I’m talking about! All I’m asking for is the chance (with all else being equal) to prove to YOU that people want to hear “genuine” music that isn’t manufactured by “The Machine”. You see, I believe that "pop music" is directly inspired by the devil himself and has consequently brainwashed people into thinking that crap is good music and is morally good for people to listen to.  If you can help me make this album, then you’ll be helping me achieve this goal. You’ll also help open doors for the 1000’s of other creative minded (and really talented) people that don’t want to sell their soul and creativity out to a mainstream record label. That goal alone should be enough to either help me out, or find someone like me and help them "jumpstart" their career.  Thank you again for even taking the time to visit my page!  God Bless all of you!

What I Need & What You Get

I know that $15,000 seems lofty.  However, you have to realize that I’m making a go of this alone, as well as I want to do this is the most professional way possible.  When you break down doing an album on this scale you have to consider the following:

·  It’s anywhere from $50-$100 per instrument, per song for just the musicians.  So at a rate of $75 and 4 musicians, that is $3,000 spent right there. 

·  Renting the studio is another huge expense.  At any reputable studio this is a major expense.  Let’s just say that I can find one for $400 per day. Hopefully, I can get through this in 4 days for the basic stuff.  That’s another $1600!

·  Then you have all the “variables” that will be hard to put an exact number on, but there is paying the sound engineer.  He/ She will charge by the hour, or they will figure it in to the cost of renting the studio which will at least double the cost of the studio fees.

·  Producer.  While I absolutely want to have a huge part of this, I am not on this side of the table so I need someone to guide me and the rest of the musicians.  I have friends, so let’s say I can do this for $1,000

·  Mixing and Mastering.  This is where (usually) a totally different sound engineer/producer hybrid person will take each track, break it down and adjust all the many sound levels associated with them.  This is also where I would do the “real” singing part.  This will cost on average another $150 per song which will tack on another $1500

·  Finally there are all the expenses that are related to the release of the songs and the album itself.  We are talking about a website, promotions, hard copy’s, copywriters fees and miscellaneous fee’s from every Tom, Dick and Harry that tells you that you have to license your music in certain ways in order to protect it and get credit for it.  I have absolutely zero idea as to how much this will cost, but I know from just releasing some songs on basic internet channels can get not only expensive, but also very confusing. 

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN FOR YOUR GENEROSITY. 

I don’t want to leave anyone that donates even $1 out, so here is what I can promise. 

·  Every single person that donates anything will receive a personal letter of gratitude from me, as well as a digital copy of all songs on the album before I release it.

·  For anyone who Donates $50 to $499,  you will receive all of the above, plus one of the first hard copies of the album that will be signed by me with a personal thanks.  You will also receive a hard copy of any album I release in the future. 

·  For anyone who Donates $500 to $4999 will receive all of the above PLUS 2 tickets to my release party that I can PROMISE YOU will be a super fun event in Nashville.  You will also receive 2 tickets to ANY EVENT I am a part of for one year after the albums initial release!  You will also get a special mention and “thank you” on any hard copies of the album that gets distributed as well as the same on any website that is mine.

·  For anyone who Donates more than $5,000, well you’ll be my favorite person on the planet for years to come!  You’ll of course get everything above,  but you’ll also have tickets to ANY SHOW that I EVER PLAY for the rest of my life!  You’ll also get transportation, hotel and will be by my  side at the release party in Nashville.  You'll also receive one of my personal guitars, autographed and with a special thank you etched in.

The Impact

Look,  I’m not sitting here all jaded and thinking that I’m going to be the next "big thing". That's not even my point or my goal!  I do believe in myself, my vision, my creativity and my talent enough to think that it’s possible to help make "real" and "decent"  music popular again!   How about this though…… If this album has ANY sort of success at all,  it will help to open the doors and let real inspiration and creativity rule the roost again, instead of the “machines” that pump out music that people just THINK they like! Wouldn’t it be cool if you joined me on this journey and became a part of something REALLY IMPORTANT to music in general?  That really important part would be shifted from the labels and back making the artists and the Fans the important parts of music again?  It used to be like this folks!  That freedom has slowly eroded through the years!  HELP ME TAKE IT BACK!

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks and challenges.  None of the songs may ever get downloaded.  You just can’t predict that! What I can tell you is that EVERY SINGLE DIME of the funds I raise will go towards the music and promotion of this music project.  The more money I’m able to raise, the better quality music I can make and the MORE I CAN PROMOTE IT! 

  • I have been in this game for 10 years.  I KNOW how to navigate it.  I also have learned many valuable lessons that will hopefully keep this project from being an epic flop.
  • I have written with and shared the stage with tons of super successful musicians.  There are individuals that I “could” ask for help, but I have chosen this avenue because I really want to see how much interest I can build on this thing, and I honestly BELIEVE IN IT!  I also don’t want to ask one person for this kind of money.  Success or not, I would personally feel like I owed one person way too much.  Plus, most of those people are fine with letting the machine pick what music hits the masses!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this project! This really is something that someone needs to do in order to “fix” the music industry as it stands today!  I REALLY want to have a part in this, and by you simply sharing this story, you can have a part of it too!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! That’s why they are there!

AGAIN… THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR EVEN READING THIS!  IT MEANS MORE THAN YOU CAN IMAGINE TO ME PERSONALLY JUST TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN! GOD BLESS EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU! #soulfullofjesus
story_txt:
sideJason's Story Hey there!  Thank you so much for visiting my page! My name is Jason Christopher and I'm a singer/songwriter originally from Athens, Al.  I've been involved in music since I was in the second grade in some shape form or fashion... Anywhere from singing lead soprano in the local Boy's choir, My high school band playing the snare drum, playing my very first songs at open mic nights in college, and finally to signed songwriter in Nashville.  I LOVE MAKING MUSIC!  Plain and Simple! I also love Jesus Christ my Lord and Savior! My whole life I've been a believer, but at the same time I guess I always had it in my head that "I will settle down and be a good little christian soon, but for now it's about "me".  Uhhhggg, that pains me to write, but it's the truth! Or WAS the truth that is!  About a year ago, Jesus came to my front door, knocked on it, and snatched me right out of my shoes when I opened the door! ;)  Seriously, he started working on me in a BIG way and I have been blessed beyond belief, as well as have personally witnessed many miracles during this short amount of time. Needless to say, I now live my entire life with him at the front of every thought. That said, my goals have changed. I don't mean my style or anything like that, I mean I feel divinely inspired! I feel inspired to bring music back to something that is real, inspirational, emotional, and "good". Enough of the songs about killing, raping, degrading women, worshiping false idols, and so on and so forth. 



I’ve decided to join Indiegogo and
ask for help from LOVERS OF JESUS AND  MUSIC FROM
ACROSS THE GLOBE so I can make a “real” and genuine album.  One that is the same quality as
one of the really big studios would put out. What do I mean by “real” album?  I mean that it’s straight from my soul, and I
don’t want anyone telling me what I can and can’t “feel” when sharing my music
that came straight from my life, experiences and own personal creative takes on
things! You see, I’m a song writer and as such an artist...Telling me this or that won't fly is like telling a painter that he's not allowed to use the color red!  I don’t churn out 10 songs a month that are
radio ready for the masses of people that the big labels have brainwashed into
thinking are great! I’m a Christian and a country boy with a lot of soul and a rock and roll
heart! Hear the music from this album I want to make, and you’ll know exactly
what I’m talking about! All I’m asking for is the chance (with all else being
equal) to prove to YOU that people want to hear “genuine” music that isn’t manufactured
by “The Machine”. You see, I believe that "pop music" is directly inspired by the devil himself and has consequently brainwashed people into thinking that crap is good music and is morally good for people to listen to.  If you can help me make this album, then you’ll be helping me achieve this goal. You’ll also help open doors for the 1000’s
of other creative minded (and really talented) people that don’t want to sell
their soul and creativity out to a mainstream record label. That goal alone
should be enough to either help me out, or find someone like me and help them "jumpstart" their career.  Thank you again
for even taking the time to visit my page! 
God Bless all of you! 
What
I Need & What You Get
I know that $15,000 seems
lofty.  However, you have to realize that
I’m making a go of this alone, as well as I want to do this is the most
professional way possible.  When you
break down doing an album on this scale you have to consider the following: 
· 
It’s
anywhere from $50-$100 per instrument, per song for just the musicians.  So at a rate of $75 and 4 musicians, that is
$3,000 spent right there.  
· 
Renting
the studio is another huge expense.  At
any reputable studio this is a major expense. 
Let’s just say that I can find one for $400 per day. Hopefully, I can
get through this in 4 days for the basic stuff. 
That’s another $1600! 
· 
Then you
have all the “variables” that will be hard to put an exact number on, but there
is paying the sound engineer.  He/ She
will charge by the hour, or they will figure it in to the cost of renting the
studio which will at least double the cost of the studio fees. 
· 
Producer.  While I absolutely want to have a huge part
of this, I am not on this side of the table so I need someone to guide me and
the rest of the musicians.  I have
friends, so let’s say I can do this for $1,000
· 
Mixing and
Mastering.  This is where (usually) a
totally different sound engineer/producer hybrid person will take each track,
break it down and adjust all the many sound levels associated with them.  This is also where I would do the “real”
singing part.  This will cost on average
another $150 per song which will tack on another $1500
· 
Finally
there are all the expenses that are related to the release of the songs and the
album itself.  We are talking about a
website, promotions, hard copy’s, copywriters fees and miscellaneous fee’s from
every Tom, Dick and Harry that tells you that you have to license your music in
certain ways in order to protect it and get credit for it.  I have absolutely zero idea as to how much
this will cost, but I know from just releasing some songs on basic internet
channels can get not only expensive, but also very confusing.  
WHAT
YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN FOR YOUR GENEROSITY. 

I
don’t want to leave anyone that donates even $1 out, so here is what I can
promise.  
· 
Every
single person that donates anything will receive a personal letter of gratitude
from me, as well as a digital copy of all songs on the album before I release
it. 
· 
For anyone
who Donates $50 to $499,  you will
receive all of the above, plus one of
the first hard copies of the album that will be signed by me with a personal
thanks.  You will also receive a hard
copy of any album I release in the future. 

· 
For anyone
who Donates $500 to $4999 will receive all of the above PLUS 2 tickets to my
release party that I can PROMISE YOU will be a super fun event in
Nashville.  You will also receive 2
tickets to ANY EVENT I am a part of for one year after the albums initial
release!  You will
also get a special mention and “thank you” on any hard copies of the album that
gets distributed as well as the same on any website that is mine. 
· 
For anyone
who Donates more than $5,000, well you’ll be my favorite person on the planet
for years to come!  You’ll of course get
everything above,  but you’ll also have
tickets to ANY SHOW that I EVER PLAY for the rest of my life!  You’ll also get transportation, hotel and will be by my  side at the release party in Nashville.  You'll also receive one of my personal guitars, autographed and with a special thank you etched in. 
The Impact
Look,  I’m not sitting here all jaded and thinking
that I’m going to be the next "big thing". That's not even my point or my goal!  I do believe in myself, my
vision, my creativity and my talent enough to think that it’s possible to help make "real" and "decent"  music popular again!   How about this though…… If this album has ANY
sort of success at all,  it will help to
open the doors and let real inspiration and creativity rule the roost again, instead of the “machines”
that pump out music that people just THINK they like! Wouldn’t it be cool if
you joined me on this journey and became a part of something REALLY IMPORTANT
to music in general?  That really
important part would be shifted from the labels and back making the artists and
the Fans the important parts of music again? 
It used to be like this folks! 
That freedom has slowly eroded through the years!  HELP ME TAKE IT BACK! 
Risks
& Challenges
Of course there are risks and
challenges.  None of the songs may ever
get downloaded.  You just can’t predict
that! What I can tell you is that EVERY
SINGLE DIME of the funds I raise will go towards the music and promotion of this music project.  The more money I’m able to raise,
the better quality music I can make and the MORE I CAN PROMOTE IT!  

I have been in this game for 10 years.  I KNOW how to navigate it.  I also have learned many valuable
     lessons that will hopefully keep this project from being an epic flop.

I have written with and shared the stage with tons of
     super successful musicians.  There
     are individuals that I “could” ask for help, but I have chosen this avenue
     because I really want to see how much interest I can build on this thing,
     and I honestly BELIEVE IN IT!  I
     also don’t want to ask one person for this kind of money.  Success or not, I would personally feel
     like I owed one person way too much. 
     Plus, most of those people are fine with letting the machine pick
     what music hits the masses! 


Other
Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute,
but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about
     this project! This really is something that someone needs to do in order
     to “fix” the music industry as it stands today!  I REALLY want to have a part in this,
     and by you simply sharing this story, you can have a part of it too! 

Use the Indiegogo share tools! That’s why they are there!
     

AGAIN… THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR
EVEN READING THIS!  IT MEANS MORE THAN
YOU CAN IMAGINE TO ME PERSONALLY JUST TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE
THIS HAPPEN! GOD BLESS EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU! #soulfullofjesus

story:
Welcome!


Intention:
The intention of this campaign is as follows:  We would like to raise $5,900 in the next two weeks in order to create a jazz album featuring some of the best young and upcoming jazz artists on the west coast.  The album will feature original songs and the collective talents of Cameron Smith, Aron Caceres and Ben Sibley.   These players deserve wider recognition, and the chance to make something creative for your listening pleasure.  Please go to www.sibleydrum.com to hear two of our unmastered tracks.  Click on "music" and then listen to either "Nica's Dream"  or "Yes or No" to get a taste of our sound.  Thanks!
The Costs:
1.  Paying the band.
We think the band deserves to be paid for their creative endeavors.  As such, each member will receive $500 for their time spent rehearsing and recording.  There are three members in the band, so that makes $1500.
2.  The Studio.
The recording cost of the studio is $1000 for recording, mixing and mastering.
We are excited to be recording at Dead Oak Studios right here in Santa Cruz. Evan Nolen will be our fearless engineer.
3. The Album.
  We would like to make 300 cd's.  This costs $1000.
 
 We would also like to make vinyl records.  This costs $800. 

4.  Promotion and Post-production costs.
We would like to use $1000 for various post-production, promotional and advertising costs.
5. Album Art.
We are paying $500 to a local artist in Santa Cruz to create the "Tarot themed" album cover art.  
6.  Indiegogo fees
The extra $100 goes toward covering the fees that Indiegogo charge for their services. 
7.  We will use the finished album to help further our artistic goals as artists and create an artifact for you and yours to hopefully enjoy. 
  Please visit my website at www.sibleydrum.com to listen to "Nica's Dream" and "Yes or No."  Click on "music" to listen to the song.  These two songs are not yet mastered but will give you a taste of what Aron, Cameron and I sound like.  Check it out!  If you like what you hear please support our campaign and keep the spirit of jazz alive.

Thank you!

story:
Après la brillante prestation du Chœur Africain des Jeunes au Symposium Mondial de la Musique Chorale à Séoul en Corée du Sud en Août 2014, nous avons été invités à prester successivement à EXPO MILANO 2015 en Italie et au Festival EUROPA CANTAT à Pécs en Hongrie (Juillet-Août 2015).

Au terme du symposium sur la musique chorale à Séoul, le Chœur Africain des Jeunes a été fait

- Ambassadeur de bonne volonté de l’IFCM (International Federation for Choral Music),

- Ambassadeur de la Fondation UNTWO ST-EP pour la lutte contre le VIH SIDA, et pour le programme en faveur du développement durable, Africa Youth Sing.

Le Chœur Africain des Jeunes est un Chœur formé de choristes venus des quatre coins de l’Afrique, munis de leur amour pour le chant et leur culture, les impliquant dans des causes sociales, solidaires et humanitaires.

story:
Hi, my name is Oliver Turnill and I am a professional golfer raising funds to compete in the US for the 2015 season. I will use this season as a springboard to compete on the Web.com Tour and PGA Tour in the future. 

My season will consist of travelling in the US playing mini tour events (e.g. NGA Tour, eGolf Tour, etc.) with a focus on Monday Qualifying for the Web.com Tour. Events are mainly played in the South East of America, however occasionally I will play in other parts of the US. At the end of the season, I will be competing at US Q School where I hope to obtain a 2016 Web.com Tour card.

Some Key Achievements:

  • Two professional wins
  • Many amateur victories
  • England Boy/Youth International
  • First 2007 NJCAA Division II Ping All America Golf Team
  • Course Record Holder - Rocky Creek CC, Vidalia, Georgia 62 (-10)

Contributions will cover:

  • Full season on the 2015 NGA Tour or similar (entry and travel expenses) 
  • Monday Qualifying for Web.com Tour and PGA Tour
  • End of year Qualifying School for Web.com Tour
  • Mini tour events when schedule allows (1-2 day events)
  • Coaching, fitness and memberships
If total target is not met, then funds will still be put towards golf events!!
Any contribution may be tax deductible, please seek advice from your financial advisor.
For Investment opportunities or have any queries, please contact me at oliturnill@yahoo.com 

Thank you for your time,

Oliver

story:
Molweni abantu! ( Hello to all the people)

My name is Tarynne Swarts and I am a singer songwriter and pianist from South Africa.  Although classically trained,  I have always known the importance and richness of the African cultural musical heritage. South Africa  Known as the "rainbow nation"  has a diversity of cultures and languages (officially having 11 languages) and as a result is rich in musical resources. A few of the songs on this Cd will be recorded, in isiXhosa, a native language to South Africa, characterized by clicks. Miriam Makeba, is one of the most famous export singers from South Africa that has characterized the click sound by singing in isiXhosa,her most famous song is Pata,Pata which uses the ¨Q¨ click.  Traditionally, Xhosa music is passed on from generation to generation orally.  However, due to this tradition there is a fear that the Xhosa music may become extinct because, the music has not been preserved or written down, only passed down orally from generation to generation. Therefore it is important for Xhosa music to be preserved.Being overseas I have realized the importance of  preserving the cultural musical heritage of South Africa.  I see myself as a cultural bridge between Africa and Europe which allows me to take the best of both worlds and create something new.  All music is interconnected and i look forward to fusing some different styles together, in this Afro -fusion album.  The three main benefits of the recording of this CD are:  

1.The recording of the music itself, implies that it will be preserved for future generations.  

2. Certain African rhythms will be preserved:for example in my song Mbaqanga

3. This CD hopes to educate the world about African music which up to this point has not been as largely investigated or studied in comparison to other musical genres. 

4. Some of the songs will be recorded in isiXhosa, which will also preserve the African, click language from becoming extinct, due to globalization. 

This is a continuation of a campaign that we have already started.  So far we have already collected 1670 (this includes the indiegogo percentage already deducted.  euros in funds and an additional 1500 euros, our own personal contribution to the project. Right now we are on 3170 euros, it is our aim to be able to get up to 5216 euros minimum. So we are launching a new campaign to gather the remaining, 2046 euros to reach 5216.   Below you can see the breakdown what we can do with 5216 euros

With 5000 euros this is what we can achieve

3 days in studio cost per day  300 x 3= 900 euros

Mixing and mastering of the 8 track cd additional ( 300 euros)

Bassist ( 150 x8 euro per song = 1200 euros

Drummer( 150 x8 songs=1200

Guest Pianist (2 songs 300 euros) I will record the rest on my own

sax and trumpet 1 songs (300)

Backup singer 2 songs ( 300)

Design of tshirts and regalia( 50)

Design of Cd  100 euros

gifts and regalia ( 100 euros)

postage  of gifts ( 150 euros)

Indiegogo percentage ( 4 %) on each donation

9% deducted for a campaign that doesn't reach its target=150 euros

166 euros to agua de coco

Total=5216 euros


With 7890 euros we wil be able to do the following:

4 days in studio cost per day  300 x 4= 1200

Mixing and mastering of the 8 track cd additional ( 600 euros)

Bassist ( 150 x8 euro per song = 1200 euros

Drummer( 150 x8 songs=1200

 Pianist (2 X 300 euros) I will record the rest on my own

sax and trumpet 1 songs (300)

Backup singer 2 songs ( 300)

Design of tshirts and regalia( 50)

Design of Cd  156euros

gifts and regalia ( 200 euros)

postage  of gifts ( 200 euros)

Indiegogo percentage ( 4 %) on each donation

9% deducted for a campaign that doesn't reach its target

+-384 euros

600 euros to agua de coco

We will be able to add a percussionist.  Since the songs are primarily african, having the african percussionist would add another flavor to the overall quality of the cd

150X5=750

guitarist 1 song :150

Piccolo penny whistle player 2 songs: 300

Total 7890 euros

Thanks to all my amazing friends all over the globe that have helped with this project!! and thank you for your patience!! As you can see recording a cd is not an easy or cheap process but its worth the fight!! Here is a map of all the people the countries that have donated!  I'm sure I have friends from even more parts of the globe! It would be so great if we could fill this map up and see how unified we all are through this project!

<script src="http://cdn.amcharts.com/lib/3/ammap.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

<script src="http://cdn.amcharts.com/lib/3/maps/js/worldHigh.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

<script src="http://cdn.amcharts.com/lib/3/themes/dark.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

<div id="mapdiv" style="width: 1000px; height: 450px;"></div>

<div style="width: 1000px; font-size: 70%; padding: 5px 0; text-align: center; background-color: #535364; margin-top: 1px; color: #B4B4B7;"><a href="http://www.amcharts.com/visited_countries/" style="color: #B4B4B7;">Create your own visited countries map</a> or check out the <a href="http://www.amcharts.com/" style="color: #B4B4B7;">JavaScript Charts</a>.</div>

<script type="text/javascript">

}

</script>


Off course ideally, our main aim is goal would be to reach our objective of 7890 in order to have the best professional Cd recorded with the best musicians and team but we will be satisfied if we can at  least get to  5000 euros in order to break even.

As a songwriter my genre of music is Afro-fusion. I beleve I will be offering something new and unique to the music market.  We have already recorded a demo in Nomadas Studios, in Andalucía, Spain featuring 4 of my own original songs. You can hear a sample of these songs on sound cloud. We have also created a professional website with, Invoca studio in Siles, Jaen. The cd will include 8 tracks some of these titles are listed below. The other two are in the selection process.

1. Pachamama

2. Culela

3. Vuka Afrika

4. Mbaqanga

5. Namhlanje

6. Aphrodite

1.  The title Pachamama, means mother earth in Inca mythology and it talks about how we should protect the earth.It will be the title track of the album

2. Culela is a new song which has a afro cuban rhythm.  African music was transported to Cuba during the time of slavery and as a result there is a big African hybrid influence in Cuba.  


3.The song Vuka Afrika, is a song in hommenage to Mandela and utilizes African rhythms


4.  We plan to record, a song called Mbaqanga. Mbaqanga is a style of music and dance in South Africa.  This song really captures the spirit of South Africa. It gives that Ubuntu feel of being in a South African township and enjoying the sense of community. A township is similar to a "favela". This song utilizes the African rhythms and beats of Mbaqanga.  In the near future, my team and I would like to go to South Africa, to record this song, in Africa in the Townships with South African musicians.


5 .  The song Namhlanje  is a song, which is a fusion between different styles. It also uses African rhythms. The title Namhlanje , means Today , translated into IsiXhosa, an indigenous South African language.  It is a song about hope and fighting for your dreams .  We are also planning to record a live music video for this song.

 Although our  main objective is to raise the euros to record a professional CD, this campaign to me means more than recording a CD. We would like to bring awareness to musical educational programs in Africa and we would like to donate a small percentage to an Ngo named Agua de Coco, who have established a co-curricular  activity in Madagascar to promote Musical Education programs to young children and also to give children a safe haven to go to after school, to keep them off the streets.

We believe that music unites, educates and brings people together and this is the ideology that my music hopes to achieve. We should all raise our awareness of important issues in the world and I believe the most important place to start is through Education.  As the late Tata Nelson Mandela said ¨Education is the most powerful weapon, which you can use to change the world¨
story_txt:
Molweni abantu! ( Hello to all the people)My name is Tarynne Swarts and I am a singer songwriter and pianist from South Africa.  Although classically trained,  I have always known the importance and richness of the African cultural musical heritage. South Africa  Known as the "rainbow nation"  has a diversity of cultures and languages (officially having 11 languages) and as a result is rich in musical resources. A few of the songs on this Cd will be recorded, in isiXhosa, a native language to South Africa, characterized by clicks. Miriam Makeba, is one of the most famous export singers from South Africa that has characterized the click sound by singing in isiXhosa,her most famous song is Pata,Pata which uses the ¨Q¨ click.  Traditionally, Xhosa music is passed on from generation to generation orally.  However, due to this tradition there is a fear that the Xhosa music may become extinct because, the music has not been preserved or written down, only passed down orally from generation to generation. Therefore it is important for Xhosa music to be preserved.Being overseas I have realized the importance of  preserving the cultural musical heritage of South Africa.  I see myself as a cultural bridge between Africa and Europe which allows me to take the best of both worlds and create something new.  All music is interconnected and i look forward to fusing some different styles together, in this Afro -fusion album.  The three main benefits of the recording of this CD are:  1.The recording of the music itself, implies that it will be preserved for future generations.  2. Certain African rhythms will be preserved:for example in my song Mbaqanga3. This CD hopes to educate the world about African music which up to this point has not been as largely investigated or studied in comparison to other musical genres. 4. Some of the songs will be recorded in isiXhosa, which will also preserve the African, click language from becoming extinct, due to globalization. This is a continuation of a campaign that we have already started.  So far we have already collected 1670 (this includes the indiegogo percentage already deducted.  euros in funds and an additional 1500 euros, our own personal contribution to the project. Right now we are on 3170 euros, it is our aim to be able to get up to 5216 euros minimum. So we are launching a new campaign to gather the remaining, 2046 euros to reach 5216.   Below you can see the breakdown what we can do with 5216 eurosWith 5000 euros this is what we can achieve3 days in studio cost per day  300 x 3= 900 eurosMixing and mastering of the 8 track cd additional ( 300 euros)Bassist ( 150 x8 euro per song = 1200 eurosDrummer( 150 x8 songs=1200Guest Pianist (2 songs 300 euros) I will record the rest on my ownsax and trumpet 1 songs (300)Backup singer 2 songs ( 300)Design of tshirts and regalia( 50)Design of Cd  100 eurosgifts and regalia ( 100 euros)postage  of gifts ( 150 euros)Indiegogo percentage ( 4 %) on each donation9% deducted for a campaign that doesn't reach its target=150 euros166 euros to agua de cocoTotal=5216 eurosWith 7890 euros we wil be able to do the following:4 days in studio cost per day  300 x 4= 1200Mixing and mastering of the 8 track cd additional ( 600 euros)Bassist ( 150 x8 euro per song = 1200 eurosDrummer( 150 x8 songs=1200 Pianist (2 X 300 euros) I will record the rest on my ownsax and trumpet 1 songs (300)Backup singer 2 songs ( 300)Design of tshirts and regalia( 50)Design of Cd  156eurosgifts and regalia ( 200 euros)postage  of gifts ( 200 euros)Indiegogo percentage ( 4 %) on each donation9% deducted for a campaign that doesn't reach its target+-384 euros600 euros to agua de cocoWe will be able to add a percussionist.  Since the songs are primarily african, having the african percussionist would add another flavor to the overall quality of the cd150X5=750guitarist 1 song :150Piccolo penny whistle player 2 songs: 300Total 7890 eurosThanks to all my amazing friends all over the globe that have helped with this project!! and thank you for your patience!! As you can see recording a cd is not an easy or cheap process but its worth the fight!! Here is a map of all the people the countries that have donated!  I'm sure I have friends from even more parts of the globe! It would be so great if we could fill this map up and see how unified we all are through this project!
Create your own visited countries map or check out the JavaScript Charts.
Off course ideally, our main aim is goal would be to reach our objective of 7890 in order to have the best professional Cd recorded with the best musicians and team but we will be satisfied if we can at  least get to  5000 euros in order to break even.As a songwriter my genre of music is Afro-fusion. I beleve I will be offering something new and unique to the music market.  We have already recorded a demo in Nomadas Studios, in Andalucía, Spain featuring 4 of my own original songs. You can hear a sample of these songs on sound cloud. We have also created a professional website with, Invoca studio in Siles, Jaen. The cd will include 8 tracks some of these titles are listed below. The other two are in the selection process.1. Pachamama2. Culela3. Vuka Afrika4. Mbaqanga5. Namhlanje6. Aphrodite1.  The title Pachamama, means mother earth in Inca mythology and it talks about how we should protect the earth.It will be the title track of the album2. Culela is a new song which has a afro cuban rhythm.  African music was transported to Cuba during the time of slavery and as a result there is a big African hybrid influence in Cuba.  3.The song Vuka Afrika, is a song in hommenage to Mandela and utilizes African rhythms4.  We plan to record, a song called Mbaqanga. Mbaqanga is a style of music and dance in South Africa.  This song really captures the spirit of South Africa. It gives that Ubuntu feel of being in a South African township and enjoying the sense of community. A township is similar to a "favela". This song utilizes the African rhythms and beats of Mbaqanga.  In the near future, my team and I would like to go to South Africa, to record this song, in Africa in the Townships with South African musicians.5 .  The song Namhlanje  is a song, which is a fusion between different styles. It also uses African rhythms. The title Namhlanje , means Today , translated into IsiXhosa, an indigenous South African language.  It is a song about hope and fighting for your dreams .  We are also planning to record a live music video for this song. Although our  main objective is to raise the euros to record a professional CD, this campaign to me means more than recording a CD. We would like to bring awareness to musical educational programs in Africa and we would like to donate a small percentage to an Ngo named Agua de Coco, who have established a co-curricular  activity in Madagascar to promote Musical Education programs to young children and also to give children a safe haven to go to after school, to keep them off the streets.We believe that music unites, educates and brings people together and this is the ideology that my music hopes to achieve. We should all raise our awareness of important issues in the world and I believe the most important place to start is through Education.  As the late Tata Nelson Mandela said ¨Education is the most powerful weapon, which you can use to change the world¨

story:
7 performances, 7 songs, 7 monuments, One Film.


Summary :

Long term friends, musician Marina Gasolina and film director Fernando Nogari spent two weeks during last summer traveling in former Yugoslavian territories. They visited there some  famous monuments/ WWII memorials, called Spomeniks. They already had plans on working together, and this journey gave them the inspiration they needed. They saw in these derelict constructions, the perfect environment to stage a sequence of audiovisual performances unified by one central theme: Utopia and its impossibility; themes Marina explores in her new album to be released, co-produced by Ladytron's Daniel Hunt. 

The goal is to shoot a movie over 7 performances about 7 songs in 7 Yugoslavian monuments with the collaboration of Haute Coiffure artist Charlie Le Mindu, who will sign the art direction.


We will be shooting our journey during a period of two weeks and we'll produce a few independent visuals, staged in each one of the monuments, alongside with a Short-Film directed by Fernando Nogari.

"It's freely inspired by Janet Cardiff & George Bures Miller sound installation from 2008 : "The Murder of Crows" and by the Japanese Gutai Group performances which, amongst its preoccupations, their manifesto expresses a fascination with the beauty that arises when things become damaged or decayed. The process of damage or destruction is celebrated as a way of revealing the inner "life" of a given material or object."

This will be the basis for an audiovisual live show Marina will perform on a tour, starting second semester of 2015, throughout France and Europe. 

For more information about the whole project and artistic statements:

 www.facebook.com/utopiathefilm



What we need:

We are planning to go on a journey to film in former Yugoslavia from March 30th to April  15th  2015.

The operational team will consist in 10 people:

  •  Marina Gasolina: Writer, Composer, Performer

  •  Fernando Nogari:  Film Director and Writer

  •  Charlie Le Mindu: Art Director

  •  Céline Degrave and Nicolas Chomarat : Executive Production 

  •  Sound engineer, Assistant Director, Make up artist, Local Producer

  •  Driver

The budget we claim will help to finance the road trip, the production and post-production costs.

  •  Plane tickets 

  •  Filming material (RED Scarlet X Cooke Lenses) 

  •  Assistant fees

  •  Van rental (insurances and gasoline) 

  •  Food/Beverages, Bed & Accommodation for the whole team 

  •  Props for Art Direction

  •  Post-Production


Listen to a demo from Utopia:



Other ways you can help

We would be very grateful if you could use the IndieGogo Share Tools and any other means possible to draw attention to our campaign!

You can also read and print the full pitch for our project by clicking here: http://goo.gl/elTjWy <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

From now on:

  •  If you want to book one of the Marina Gasolina’s live performance, please contact: nicolas.chomarat@gmail.com

  •  If you want to distribute Marina’s EP or merchandising in your store, please contact: nicolas.chomarat@gmail.com

  •  If you think of  sponsors, patrons, or anyone that could help this project happen besides this crowdfunding, please contact: celine.degrave@gmail.com

  •  If you just love us, join our fan page!

Marina Gasolina:  www.soundcloud.com/marinagasolina

                                   www.facebook.com/officialmarinagasolina

Daniel Hunt:           www.ladytron.com

Charlie le Mindu:   www.charlielemindu.com

Fernando Nogari:  www.fernandonogari.com

story:
Hi, I am Triana, a young singer songwriter. I have played music all of my life. Lately my song writing has really taken off and I’ve put together enough music to make my first CD. I am really excited about it! It is an amazing dream that is coming true. My family and some really great and talented friends have banded together and are working hard with me to get it done. Good things are starting to happen, but I am at a point in the project where I need some additional financial support to create and deliver a quality recording.

The additional funding of $6,700 is needed to pay for studio time, additional recording equipment, and the printing of the CD’s. I need your support in order for this recording to happen. Making this recording will bring my songs out into the world in a real way. It is important to me to be able to share them with you and I believe you will all really enjoy the CD we are making together with your help. My hope is to raise enough money with this Indiegogo campaign to accomplish all this.

The community of amazing artists that I am surrounded by are working to create unique t-shirts and posters for this project. With their help I am able to offer some really neat stuff in return for your financial support. Right now I have Triana t-shirts and posters available for you. With your donation you are becoming a part of this recording project and are helping to launch a musical artist.

Thank you so much for checking this out. Please share this campaign with your friends.

story:
Shine Bright Baby have been a band for over 7 years, we are signed to an independent record label and we strive to create great music that is both inspiring and hopeful.

   Touring is an expensive but necessary endeavor for any serious musical act. In the beginning, we borrowed my parents awesome Astro van with a super small trailer to get to shows. It was cramped and ridiculous looking but we made lots of good memories those years traveling the US. In 2012, we found a great deal on a used 15 passenger van and bought it. We finally had our first band owned touring vehicle! By the end of the year we had raised enough money through our first successful crowd funding for a much needed new trailer. This set up served us well (and many miles) until last February when we got into a weather related accident in northern Minnesota totaling our beloved trailer. With your generous donations, we were able to purchase a new one several months later and hardly missed a beat. 

    As you can see, this band has never been just been about us. As uncool as van and trailers are, you guys have always understood how vital they are to our existence as a band. It's what gets us your city, your church, your community. There are so many incredible people we have met and not touring is simply not an option for us. Now we are looking at our trusty van that we love (most of the time) with almost 300,000 miles and the touring schedule we are lining up for 2015. 2014 this band played more shows and covered more miles then we ever had before - it was incredible!

   Very soon we are releasing new music. We are beyond thrilled to share them with because we feel like it's the best work we have ever done. We want to tour as much as we can to share these new songs and their stories with with both old and new fans. We spend more hours on the road then anything else, and of course, more money in fuel then anything else. Help keep our band on the road by donating so we can offset the cost of newer vehicle. We have put together some creative incentives if you choose to back this campaign - please take the time to check them out cause every dollar counts. 

Thank you for your continued support and faith in what we do! We truly couldn't do without you. 

-emily and nathan

story:
Black Swan prayerformances are a unique and uplifting experience!  We blend ritual, ceremony, music, sound, dance, story, mythology and astrology in a way that serves to awaken, inspire, unify and heal humanity.  Visionary mystics Donny Regalmuto and Heather Salmon bring decades of experience as professional performers, healers, producers and agents of social change.  Guided by the energies of astrology, the cycles of nature as well as planetary and current issues these popular cutting edge prayerformances have been featured at Burning Man, and festivals including the Health and Harmony Festival, Alchemy Festival, Journey Home, Maui's Earth Day Festival, the One Peace Festival and Mystic Garden & Island Festivals, as well as the Walnut Creek Crystal Fair, conferences, retreat and cultural centers, hot springs, churches, temples and yoga studios across California, Hawaii, Oregon, Mexico and Canada!  We have collaborated with some of the world's finest musicians, renown spiritual teachers and luminaries including the late Lady Loreon Vigne the ArchPriestess of the Temple of Isis (Geyserville, California), Hawaiian Kahuna Auntie Pua, Oakland Cosmic Mass creator Rev. Dr. Matthew Fox, South African born spiritual teacher Mirabai Devi, Makeda Dread the legendary radio personality and executive director of San Diego's famous World Beat Center, Devaa Haley and Stephen Dinan of the Shift Network, as well as visionary artists Alex and Allyson Grey.  Most recently we are excited to announce that Black Swan has been contracted to appear as ourselves in an upcoming feature film.  Ever creating ever expanding, our hope is that our work will help to elevate global consciousness and inspire and bring about a peaceful, thriving and just human experience on Earth. 



GOALS

To date, we have been mostly self-funding and now we are seeking support in attaining our next goals of:

1.  Creating a funding base for our community events so that they can be accessible to all by subsidizing the production costs which would also enable us to do larger events and webcasts.

2.  Purchasing more AV Equipment for our Maui studio to video and audio record events produce media.

3.  Adding to our collection of instruments including purchasing more special semi precious crystal singing bowls for our sound healing.

4.  Marketing our 18 CD + 1 DVD Collection to expand sales and generate revenue.

In addition, as we are a ministry of the Black Swan Temple, a Project of Inquiring Systems, Inc. a California 501(c)(3) Corporation we are able to offer Tax Deductible Receipts for donations.




Here is what your contribution will immediately help support:

*  Production costs for our Winter Solstice Community Ceremony at Maui's renown Lumeria Center (Dec. 21st)

*  Our New Year's tour with dates in Toronto (Dec. 28th) and Harbin Hot Springs (Jan. 3rd)

*  New Video Cameras

*  Special Effects and Stage Lighting

*  Sound & AV Production Equipment

*  Website Development & Online Mystery School

*  Publicity & Promotion

*  Management Fees

We thank you so much for your consideration in helping us raise funds to support the expansion of our work into the world.  You can also help by sharing this campaign with your friends!  If you've enjoyed our events, rituals or ceremonies please let others know that too!

We wish you all the best for this holy day season!

Much Love & Aloha!

Heather & Donny



"Absolutely glorious, was incredibly illuminating, peaceful and moving." 

~ H.Young

"Soul travelers raising consciousness" ~ S.LaRosa

"The ceremony was deeply healing for all who came! It helped to bring a sense of solidarity and hope.  I had "lost some hope" and for the first time in a long time I feel "hopeful" again. ~ K.R (Tijuana, Mexico)

"I am still glowing in waves from the Black Swan Mystical Alchemy concert in LA last night! Heather and Donny wove together a magical healing tour of the higher realms for myself and the other guests, seamlessly blending various musical cultures and traditions into a delightfully uplifting creation of sound and interactive experience. What a blessing! I heard people speaking of physical healings after the music and I certainly experienced such profound peace and love, for myself, for the others who were fortunate enough to be present there, for the performers, and really for all of life! There are moments where one is grateful for life's gifts and sharings, and last night was one of those moments. Definitely to be remembered vividly! A perfect night!" ~ V.Fulkerson

"It is always a great Inspiration to see You, Dear High Priestess. The crystal bowls are alive, and you bring their voices into resonance, their message to our World for Peace, Love, and Harmony.” ~ Dr. Enrico Melson

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Here's a list of things we need to accomplish this project.

The Music Video & EP

    • Funding to record the actual song (roughly $140).
    • Floral Arrangements for the set ($???)
    • A Casket (Thanks Matt Cruz!)
    • A Videographer ($???)
    • Time to do complex stop motion filming ($???)
    • Funding to edit the video properly ($???)
    • Proper suits for band members to perform in (formal dress). ($???)
    • Funds for packaging and distribution of the video through various channels ($2400)
All contributors will be invited to participate in various location video shoots if you can attend. All contributors can list as many names in the dedication list as they desire. These are the names of the loved ones we have lost on our dedication list. There will be a music cd single and a dvd released to contributors at certain donation levels, the video will be made available to share for free on youtube of course.

The DVD

If we ever get this far... will contain the video Wings of Despair, along with special clips, etc.

The Single CD

We will have roughly 2 tracks including the song Wings of Despair and Breathing Fire

Risks & Challenges

This project almost seems unattainable to us and on a level beyond anything we have thought of doing. Coordinating so many details and executing the entire plan may take us months, if not most of the year. 

  • We want this to be done professionally and proper. I don't even know if $2000 is enough to finish the project. I am just projecting the amount as what I know we can "pull off something" with... but the more we raise, the easier and faster we can release this music video and deliver our message.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out! 
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
