story:
Deutschland zeigt Flagge 

Wir, die Initiatoren von „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“, sind davon überzeugt, in einem offenen Land mit mitfühlenden und hilfsbereiten Menschen zu leben! Wir glauben daran, dass die gesichtslose Masse sehr wohl bereit ist, Menschen zu helfen welche nicht das Glück hatten in einer sicheren und stabilen Umgebung zu leben. 

Mit „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“ wollen wir ganz Deutschland in einen Ort des Willkommens verwandeln, zum Startpunkt eines neuen Lebens! Wir wollen ganz öffentlich zeigen, dass die vielen verzweifelten Menschen in Deutschland einfach HERZLICH WILLKOMMEN sind! 

ABER all das schaffen wir nur gemeinsam – zusammen mit Euch! Lasst uns unsere Autos mit Flaggen schmücken – wie zu WM oder EM – und mit Armbändern deutlich zeigen, dass es uns nicht egal ist, wie in UNSEREM Land mit hilfsbedürftigen Menschen umgegangen wird, die sich uns anvertraut haben! 

Wir zeigen Flagge! Sei auch du dabei!!!


Produkte Deutschland zeigt Flagge


Wie funktioniert „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“?

Mit den Autofahnen, Armbändern und Schlüsselanhängern von „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“ kann jeder Mitbürger ganz öffentlich ein Statement für Menschlichkeit abgeben und Deutschland in einen Ort des Willkommens verwandeln.

Was passiert mit den Einnahmen?

Unser primäres Ziel mit „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“ ist nicht die Generierung von Spendengeldern, sondern eben ein „Zeichen zu setzen“ bzw. „Flagge zu zeigen“. Trotzdem wollen wir an der Aktion „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“ natürlich nichts verdienen. Die Gelder werden genutzt, um die Produktion zu finanzieren und unser Projekt in die Welt zu tragen.


Team der 360 Online Performance Group GmbH


Wer steckt hinter „Deutschland zeigt Flagge“ ?

Hinter dem Projekt steht zunächst einmal die 360 Online Performance Group GmbH, ein junges Team welches sich normalerweise auf die Entwicklung von Online und Mobile-Geschäftsmodellen stürzt.

Zu den ersten und definitiv aktivsten Unterstützern zählt markengold PR, eine befreundete PR-Agentur aus Berlin.

Die Gruppe der Unterstützer und Multiplikatoren wächst seitdem beständig und wir sind einfach dankbar für jeden, der unsere Idee ein Stückchen weiter in die Welt trägt!


Risiken und Herausforderungen

Wir sind nicht naiv! Natürlich ist uns bewusst, dass wir mit unserer Aktion & Eurer Unterstützung alleine, die Situation der Hilfesuchenden leider nicht maßgeblich verbessern. Doch wir können sehr wohl zeigen, dass die Ablehnung und der Hass nur von einer kleinen dumpfen Minderheit getragen wird. Und das alleine ist schon sehr viel wert…

Die Produkte sind fertig designed und gerade quasi auf dem Weg in die Produktion, so dass wir hoffen bei frühzeitigem Zuspruch schon Ende September ausliefern zu können. Wir können es kaum erwarten, eine Welle der Hilfsbereitschaft und Herzlichkeit durch Deutschland schwappen zu lassen!

story:
CHA WA: FUNDING OUR FIRST FULL-LENGTH STUDIO ALBUM

Cha Wa is a band of Mardi Gras Indians & musicians who represent the essence of Mardi Gras Indian & Second-Line culture.We have deep roots in the historic culture of the Uptown Mardi Gras Indians. We want to carry on the tradition of combining Funk Music with Mardi Gras Indian chants, pioneered by the Wild Magnolias over forty years ago.  This album combines our love for the street tradition with modern funk from our generation.

Mardi Gras Indian history in the Crescent City dates back to the 19th century. African American men adorned suits hand sewn with rhinestones, beads & feathered crowns on Mardi Gras day because they were banned from the segregated Parades in New Orleans. By wearing these “suits” Mardi Gras Indians are paying homage to the Native Americans who harbored their ancestor’s in their tribes as they escaped from slavery.

Cha Wa, meaning “We’re coming for ya!” is a slang phrase used by every Mardi Gras Indian tribe. The band features legendary Mardi Gras Indians Irving “Honey” Banister and J’Wan Boudreaux on vocals and Norwood “Geechie” Johnson on bass drum, along with New Orleans music veterans Joe Gelini on drum set, John Fohl on guitar, Seizo Shibayam on Guitar, Devon Taylor on Sousaphone & Bass, Steve Malinowski on organ, Yoshitaka 'Z2' Tsuji on piano. Special Guests included Davell Crawford, Norwood 'Geeichie' Johnson (original bass drummer for The Wild Magnolias) & Ben Ellman (Galactic).

If you’re lucky enough to find yourself on the corner of Second and Dryades on Mardi Gras Day, you will hear “Cha Wa” chanted in celebration throughout the streets.


New Orleans is the cradle of American music (Jazz, R&B, Funk, Rock’n’Roll), and Mardi Gras Indian Rhythms & Chants significantly influenced them all. Funding this album will allow New Orleans Mardi Gras Indians & Musicians to continue to have an artistic & cultural voice in our cities legendary musical landscape.

We have published a line item budget that clearly outlines the production costs adding up to $20,000, these include:

·  RECORDING STUDIO COST & MUSICIANS FEES- $7,100 

·  PRODUCER FEES- $3,000

·  MIXING & MASTERING FEES- $5,500

·  MECHANICAL LINCESES- $500  

·  ARTWORK- $1,000

·  PRINTING/PACKAGING- $2,500

·  SHIPPING- $400

Under the "perks" tab, we offer a wide variety of incentives to our album backers. You can contribute a little or a lot, and as they say “every bit counts”! 

One of the reasons we chose to use Indiegogo as a crowdfunding platform is because they allow flexible funding goals. This means if we don’t reach our target goal we can still keep the contributions instead of having them refunded and avoid an “all or nothing” budget strategy like Kickstarter.

Touring around the world and managing our budget has taught us how to be thrifty & efficient. Completing this album on time and distributing incentives to our funders is of the utmost importance to us, and we have a track record of living up to our commitments.

If you cannot contribute to our campaign you can still show us some love. Tell your friends, coworkers & share it on social media. It takes a village to fund an album!

story:
Hi Friends! 


Quick Update**** I'm heading to Tauranga on the 18th December to record the song Awaken with Inflame Recording Studio. I'm so expectant! Life is one journey well worth exploring... you never know the great adventures you might just discover along the way! 

***Aaaaahhh! Level of excitement is officially through the roof! At long last I am finally putting out my Debut Worship Album - Awaken.... AND God willing also the EP.... God Arise and I would love your support!!!***

Thank you so much for coming to check out the Pre-Sale for this project!  I've never put out an album before and I'm SO excited about it!!!And I'm grateful that you're here and on this journey with me!

My Journey! 

Over the past 15 years I've been on this journey of learning about who I am. 
Coming to know the Lord has made all the difference and the inspiration for my songs have come through my walk with Him... through internal battles that I've had and some truly AMAZING breakthroughs. I've also written from life events that have impacted me. One of the songs on the Album - 'The Great I Am' was inspired by a mission trip that I went on to Zambia a couple of years ago - having had a life changing experience at a local orphanage. 
I'm a worship leader and passionate about helping others connect to the King of Kings. I believe in Worship - I believe in the power that it has to bring healing, revival, joy, peace, freedom and wholeness. This is my contribution of light to a world that is filled with darkness. 
I've been writing songs since I was 16, BUT over the last couple of years I have literally felt like God was tugging at my heart strings almost daily to do this. So here it is! It's time to stop sitting on what God's given me and release what He's deposited. 
I am an unsigned artist and this is why I'm asking for your support in helping me to release a sound that will ignite hearts and minds. 
All funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards:

All funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards:

  • Recording Studio Costs (covers studio time, mixing & mastering, paying the studio musicians and the music producer)
  • Merchandise Artwork & Design, Pressing CD's & Digital Download Cards + T-shirt prints

I'm aiming to raise a minimum of $10,000

Why?

This is will allow me to: 

  • Record some additional songs
  • Launch a professional promotional campaign (including social media marketing, internet & college radio campaign,  and professional website design/maintenance)
and hopefully
  • Launch a ministry tour (paying the supporting musicians, covering costs of transportation, food and lodging on the road)
  • Film & edit a music video with a professional film crew

What's in it for you?

Know that by sowing into my Ministry, you have helped me bring a life long dream to fruition. You will have also sowed into the lives of those who may be ministered to by my music. 

You will have also sowed into a local Christian ministry as the producer I will be working with has a budding ministry, specifically working with Christian Artists and has a heart for releasing the sound of worship in this nation. 

Oh and there are some cool perks too - Keep an eye out. I may add some new perks as the campaign goes on! 

Unable to contribute?

I totally appreciate that you've taken the time to read through this and would be so grateful if for could share this via Facebook, Twitter and any other social media you're enrolled in. 

Like and share! YAY!

God Bless you and may God awaken all that has been deposited inside of you!

story:
Here's the Story: Patricia Kayser Debut Album [Libre]

Hola! My name is Patricia Kayser I am a singer/songwriter/musican born and raised in Guayaquil, Ecuador.  I moved to Miami in 2004, when my youngest brother, Chris, was diagnosed with Autism. He used to be very shy and unexpressive, but I found that music was a great tool to help him communicate and interact with others. This motivated me to open a non-profit organization called Autism & Music (http://www.autismandmusic.org/) ; and it also inspired me to keep playing the guitar and even to start composing my own songs.This is how my journey into the infinite world of music started.

For the past two years, I have been writing some colorful songs. I like writing about my own life experiences through enthusiastic lyrics and fresh melodies. It feels amazing to be able to connect with people through my life stories. I am grateful for the encouraging feedback that I have received so far!

I am so excited to nurture what started as a handful of demos recorded on my home microphone into something full, professional and unique.

I have teamed-up with a wild, talented creative artist/musician to work on my debut EP album. His name is Jose Bila Rodriguez, better known as "Compay" Jose. He is set to put this machine in motion. He will help me arrange/produce most of my songs. Also, if you follow us on our YouTube channel, he will give you a Behind the Scenes tour through the making of this album (English and Español).


** A percentage of (%) of the earnings made through my musical project will be donated to the “Autism & Music Foundation”.


Siganme los buenos!

Instagram/Twitter: @KayserMusic

www.facebook.com/PatriciaKayserOfficial


Jam it up, Act libre ~ 

- Pati


What We Need & What You Get

The $12,750 we are campaigning for is to help fund the creation and distribution of my debut EP album (6 songs). Also, it will help produce a music video to one of the songs. Here is an estimated breakdown to show you where your money will be used:

- Cost of recording, mixing and mastering $6,000

- Cost of one music video $4,000 +

- Cost of goods for rewards $2,000 +

- IndieGogo and Credit card fees $750

In exchange for your support we are offering exclusive items, some of which are only available through this campaign and are limited in number. So when they're gone, that be it!

This experience is about our interaction with you, we want to connect with you! If there is a perk you want to see added, or have a suggestion please feel free to contact us! 

Perks















Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for checking out my campaign for this long! Whether you have contributed or not, I appreciate your time and your curiosity.

Please share this campaign with friends, family and anyone else who may be interested in my music. 

 Get ready for some fresh jams! 

THANKS!

- PK

story:
Think bands are just for boys?  WRONG!

We're a non-profit organisation loosely based on the U.S. Rock n Roll Camp for Girls model, the first of it's kind in Scotland!  

We just ran 6 weeks of vocals, guitar, bass and drums workshops for women and trans*folk on a shoestring budget with borrowed equipment and a lot of improvisation (we literally hauled the amps and guitars to the venue by bike trailer every week!).  We had no idea how successful it would be, but the demand surpassed our wildest dreams!

We want to run an autumn term, with extra workshops in activities like sound engineering, music tech, and DJing, which women are generally not encouraged to take part in.  In order to achieve this we need to get our hands on more equipment, something we have found that external funders have been reluctant to pay for. That’s where you come in! 

We need gear!

We managed to pick up an old battered drum kit that was languishing in a second hand shop, but it's missing cymbals, and someone donated us a bass guitar and amp, but apart from that we've been using our own personal guitars and borrowing amps!  Here's what we reckon we need to keep going for years to come (we're eco-conscious and will be purchasing everything second hand wherever possible!)

A hi hat stand and cymbals, two bass guitars, two bass practice amps, two electric guitars, two practice amps, a keyboard, four sets of drumsticks, and some string sets.

But why does the world need a Girls Rock School?

We feel that projects like GRS are important because women aren't encouraged to pick up electric instruments or get behind the drums, and  if they do they're expected to wear as little as possible.  In fact, it’s difficult for women at every stage of becoming a musician. There’s not enough role models, and the female musicians who are visible are usually airbrushed and pouting on the covers of magazines and album covers, making young girls feel that they have to sexualise themselves to get anywhere. If they do make it in to the local music shop they can expect to be patronised by the male staff, and then when they form a band, they end up forever playing lower down the bill while male bands headline.

Girls Rock School is open to ALL women, including transwomen, and also genderqueer people.  We ensure that all of our workshop spaces and venues are wheelchair accessible, and we don't discriminate on age, race, religious denomination, or anything else you can think of.  Our workshops are free (although we encourage those who can afford it to donate what they can to help us cover venue costs) so they're accessible to those on low incomes.

    Here's what our participants said..

    'What an amazing opportunity to get to learn drums in an all female, fully supportive environment'

    'I really loved the environment that came to life at GRS, almost as if I was free to be myself and think of nothing else but the music. GRS is incredibly empowering and has helped me gain a lot of confidence'

    The attitude of the teachers was excellent - created a very supportive and encouraging atmosphere'

    What can go wrong?

    We've applied for funding to help us with venue costs and specific workshops like DJing and sound tech.  If we get turned down, we'll just go ahead with the basic vocals, guitar, bass and drums workshops, and probably end up having to hassle people for donations a bit more,  And we might not have enough guitars etc so we would have to limit the numbers, and maybe not be able to pay our volunteer drum tutors their travel expenses. 

    Apart from that, not much can go wrong.  We did it before on almost no money (although it was EXHAUSTING!), so we know we can do it again. 

      I'm skint - can I help in other ways?

      YES!!  If you want to volunteer, get in touch.  We can use people to help with tutoring, blogging, social media, promotion, and we always need roadies!  (We'll definitely give you a badge for that!)

      Also if you could just tell people about us, and our sisters, the Rock and Roll Summer School for Girls Glasgow, that'd be awesome, cheers!
story_txt:
Think bands are just for boys?  WRONG!
We're a non-profit organisation loosely based on the U.S. Rock n Roll Camp for Girls model, the first of it's kind in Scotland!  
We just ran 6 weeks of vocals, guitar, bass and drums workshops for women and trans*folk on a shoestring budget with borrowed equipment and a lot of improvisation (we literally hauled the amps and guitars to the venue by bike trailer every week!).  We had no idea how successful it would be, but the demand surpassed our wildest dreams!
We want to run an autumn term, with extra workshops in activities like sound engineering, music tech, and DJing, which women are generally not encouraged to take part in.  In
order to achieve this we need to get our hands on more equipment, something we
have found that external funders have been reluctant to pay for. That’s where
you come in!  
  We need gear!
We managed to pick up an old battered drum kit that was languishing in a
 second hand shop, but it's missing cymbals, and someone donated us a bass guitar and amp, but apart from that we've been using our own personal guitars and borrowing amps!  Here's what we reckon we need to keep going for years to come (we're eco-conscious and will be purchasing everything second hand wherever possible!)A hi hat stand and cymbals, two bass guitars, two bass practice amps, two electric guitars, two practice amps, a keyboard, four sets of drumsticks, and some string sets.
  But why does the world need a Girls Rock School? We feel that projects like GRS are important
because women aren't encouraged to pick up electric instruments or get behind the drums, and  if they do
they're expected to wear as little as possible.  In fact, it’s difficult for women at every stage of becoming a musician. There’s 
not enough role models, and the female musicians who are visible are 
usually airbrushed and pouting on the covers of magazines and album 
covers, making young girls feel that they have to sexualise themselves 
to get anywhere. If they do make it in to the local music shop they can 
expect to be patronised by the male staff, and then when they form a 
band, they end up forever playing lower down the bill while male bands 
headline.

attitude of the teachers was excellent - created a very supportive
and encouraging atmosphere'

story:
A Debut Folk Rock Album with a Positive Spin!

Folk rock singer-songwriter Liz Fanora Jones is bringing you a soul-infused inspirational debut album with a positive message: Be Authentic, Embrace Love & GO FOR YOUR DREAMS! This has been Liz's dream, and with your help, we can create it!

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to fully fund the album by reaching our campaign goal of raising $10,000, which would allow for a stellar full-length album to be recorded at Songfield Studios in Los Angeles, California. For contributing, you'll get AWESOME perks like an autographed copy of the final product, concert tickets, super cute totes, or even your very own PRIVATE SHOW!

The Impact

Liz's passion is positivity and optimism and she knows that through sending out positive vibes and energy starting from within yourself, a domino effect of positivity and joy flows through planet earth and out into the cosmos! By contributing to her campaign, YOU ARE CREATING THAT POSITIVE ENERGY FLOW! Wow, you are one rockin' human being! (Unless, you're an alien, of course, and if so, welcome to earth!) 

Risks & Challenges

There's always a million reasons not to do something. Liz was born with an almost unhealthy determination for manifesting her dreams into reality and with the help of the committed, like-minded people at Songfield Studios, Liz is prepared to overcome and conquer any challenges that occur. Even if we don't reach the campaign goal, we'll still put whatever funds we raise to make the best damn album ever! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help our cause by just following Liz on her journey, reaching out via social media, and supporting her artistic endeavors on Patreon.com. There you can donate a buck or two for every music video she releases, which also helps with production costs and creating new art! http://patreon.com/LizFanoraJones

THANK YOU SO MUCH for checking out this campaign! We hope to hear from you soon!

www.LizFanoraJones.com

story:
Oh, it's love alright.

Hi there, Perseverance Family Band here.  

We are a Buddhist-Bluegrass-Psych-Folk band hailing from Boston! This here is one of our early song nuggets just to give you a taste. We've been playing the Boston/Somerville/Cambridge scene, getting our vibe in focus. We've just kept gaining momentum this past last year, and now we're gearing up to share our music with a wider audience. We're SO close to releasing our first EP! Also, we're going on an East Coast tour for the bulk of the month of July. 

(It's a little soon, we know, but we're in love, so what could go wrong? gulp)

We know you'll love our tunes, and we hope a few of you will also be touched to shed some baggage; perhaps feel relieved enough to spread some of the liberating acceptance which is actually pretty subversive in this crazy world... 

We've had such a fantastic experience sharing our music so far! We cannot wait to spreading the love to other parts of the country, meeting lots of new awesome people along the way, story swapping, and harmonizing with endless glee! 

Here's the hitch. Launching a tour (not to mention an album) takes werk, yo, not to mention resources. Family, friends, countrypeople! Halp!  We can't do it without you! We would be so endlessly grateful if you would gift us a little extra fuel so we can launch our band into more-than-merely-digital space, like the rocket ship of fearless folky fusion it was birthed to BE.

Our stage lineup for this grand adventure: 
Carly Nix: mother hen, songwriter, vocals, musical saw 
Hannah Hudson: cormorant of justice, mandolin, vocals
Joe Goldbeck: night owl, bass
Nora Maynard: eagle eyes, fiddle, vocals, songwriter
Alex LaRue: bee's knees, guitar

Chris, Greg, Anthony - WE WILL MISS YOU FELLAS SO DARN MUCH! Good thing we'll have the rough EP to listen to in order to comfort ourselves during those lonely nights on the road, sigh...


Trigger Warning: Straight Talk

So. 

We need to raise $3,000 to finish our EP and make it from Boston to Florida and back in one piece! Here's a breakdown of our costs:

$800 to finish recording/mixing/artwork

$1,200 for gasoline and vehicle repairs 

$1000 to help supplement living expenses while on the road and 500 kazoos

Playing our first tour is a really exciting challenge, and with your help we will not hemmorage cash for thousands of miles up and down the country. But wait there's more; exciting meeerrrrcccchhhhh!  

If we don't reach our goal of $3,000, all the funds raised will still help us out a lot on the road. We are determined to make this tour happen hell or high water, and it will be so much better with your support. Thank you, for cereal real. 

Perks!!!

$5  E-HUG: Thank you for helping make our dreams come truuueeeee! You will get a        thank-you email and hopefully will join our mailing list so we can sing our thanks        at your face in the future :D

$10  Digital EP. Be the first to hear our debut album! 

$20  Limited edition EP (CD) with original artwork (snazzy, lemmetellyou) (1/250) 

$20  Get a copy of the EP in digital format and we'll also send you a hand-decorated post card while we're on the road to say thanks and hello!

$30  Our first t-shirt + digital EP (1/100)

$40  Limited edition tour poster with original artwork + digital EP (1/100) 

$50 Limited edition EP (CD) + Screen-printed item of our choice. maybe a t-shirt?? maybe an oven mit! who knows! provide size info just in case.

$100  All the Swag!! Limited edition EP (CD) + Our first t-shirt + Lovingly decorated postcard + Limited edition poster + Mystery screen-printed item of our choice! 

$200+ All of the Swag PLUS A PERSONALIZED MUSIC VIDEO 

Limited edition EP (CD) + Screen-printed tshirt + Lovingly decorated postcard + Limited edition Poster + Mystery screen-printed item of our choice... 

++++ YOUR favorite song arranged & performed by PFB in a personalized music video! And many, many analog hugs when/if we ever get to tackle you in person!! WOW! THANK YOU, FRIEND, YOU ARE A KEEPER


Tour Schedule

Please hit us up if you're on our route, we'd love to see you! 

Monday, July 6th: Woodstock, NY
Friday, July 10th: Philadelphia, PA
Tuesday, July 14th: Charlotte, NC
Wednesday, July 15th: Atlanta, GA
Thursday, July 16th: Inverness, FL
Saturday, July 18th: Asheville, NC
Thursday, July 23rd: New York, NY


Want To Help Our Tour Thrive Even More??

Please help spread the word about our album and tour by sharing our Facebook posts, Bandcamp links, etc. THANK YOU! <3 <3 <3 <3 <3, PFB

story:
BACK ON THE GREEN!

Watch This Space For Lineup, Dates & Location 

Hey there, I'm Wayne Coy. Bay Area based radio guy and music lover. Like a lot of people who were fortunate enough to grow up here in the 70's & 80's, I was exposed to some amazing live musical talent over the years. For many of us, a rite of passage were those day long, multi-artist music festivals at the Oakland Coliseum. They were amazing events that left an indelible mark on us all. The stuff of legends, it was a great time to be alive and to share in the spirit of Rock and Roll.

With more than 30 years of radio experience and over half of that time spent promoting and producing music events with my company (Got Live Entertainment,) I have always had the goal of bringing back those great times and that wonderful music to the East Bay. My dream of getting us all "Back On The Green" again is about to be a reality. The artists are rehearsed and ready, tickets are set to be printed, the stage is being prepared and the gates will open up soon.

All that's missing is YOU! 

You can help make these the two greatest "Daze" of the Summer and renew a rockin' tradition in the Bay Area at "Day On The Green." 

What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine, putting together an event on this scale takes quite a bit of heavy lifting. Most of it has begun already. The contributions we receive here will be used to fortify our production efforts and guarantee that you get the best possible concert experience at "Day On The Green." Top notch sound and video, amenities, great food and beverage options and of course, some of the best Classic Rock tribute performers in the world. To say thanks, we have some awesome perks available to you for supporting the cause, including (of course) tickets to the show(s) at  prices you will not find anywhere else. These two shows are just the beginning. We have big plans for future events and want you to be a part of it.     

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, I am so grateful for your support. Please help us spread the word and share our campaign with any one you know that would love to get on board. I really appreciate YOU. Thanks! 

NOTE:  IN THE CASE OF EVENT CANCELLATION FOR ANY REASON OTHER THAN AN ACT OF GOD, ALL PERKS THAT INCLUDE EVENT TICKETS WILL BE REFUNDED IN FULL.

story:
Please help me change someone's life.

Every year around birthday time, I am overwhelmed with the pouring of affection I receive from all my Facebook friends. I am always showered with gift, flowers and drinks. This year please do not buy me anything... instead please help me change a young man's life.

His brother has been saving for far to long to buy him a hearing aid, let's make it happen a lot faster.

The good news is the amazing Bronwyn Carabez from the Carabez alliance has donated NOT ONE but TWO hearing aids, http://www.carabezalliance.org.au/

So the money we are now raising is for doctor assessment, visits and fitting we now only need about $1,500.00.

The other good news is that Bronwyn and I are now taking about starting a Carabez Alliance Bali, stay tune for more great news around January 2016...

I would truly appreciate your support, anything from a few $ to more if you can.

Merci, Marc/ Claire de Lune

story:
Everyone knows we've been busting our humps trying to get our album done for over a year now, and it's been one thing after another.

we're not asking for anymore than we need, our goal will provide us with the funds to not only finish our album in a timely fashion, but also to press it and the b-sides ep as well, plus the music video for the single.

this isn't a hand out, we've paid out of pocket for it every step of the way so far, and we're just needing some help to finish!

 

We're asking for three thousand dollars to finish everything!

for you at home donating we have some very special exclusive gifts for you depending on the donation, can't wait for you guys and girl to see whats coming, we just need a little more help!


this is not the end

we have so many new things in the works for our future, we are far from done in anyway!!

T.o.P

story:
About Me:

Hello! I'm Joelle Lurie, a NY based jazz/pop singer, originally from Boston. I play with my great band -- we are all close friends who formed our group while living on the same block in Upper Manhattan after music school. We also run a wedding/special events band business where we play at fun & fabulous parties: 'Joelle & the Pinehurst Trio'.

In 2014 I self-released my first full length album called 'Take Me There', (produced & arranged by my longtime bandmate & collaborator, Ben Gallina), which debuted in the Top 10 iTunes Jazz albums & helped us welcome wonderful opportunities such as an NPR feature (http://bit.ly/1iiw53q), playing at the Rainbow Room, Regattabar, & more. Other highlights include: James Beard Awards at Lincoln Center, NY Stock Exchange, Boom Boom Room at the Standard Hotel, & repeated shows at Rockwood Music Hall.

It was a blast making the last record -- and now I want to make more!

What kind of music, you ask? Great question.

Jazzy pop, poppy jazz. But this time in the form of 2 EPs (short albums of 4-6 tunes). 

1. Holiday/Christmas tunes -- I want to put a unique Pinehurst twist to my favorite holiday tunes. 

2. Original tunes -- I've been writing a lot, on my own & also along with my collaborators, Ben Gallina (longtime bass player & friend), Charlie Lurie (longtime guitarist & brother).

I'm driven, excited, and have a specific goal/plan -- all I need is your help to make it happen.

How would I use your help?

  • To commission arrangements, rehearse with my band, then hit the recording studio
  • Post recording: mixing, mastering, photo/artwork
  • Marketing/publicizing the CDs properly to get it out there

Why and how?

  • I want to get both my original songs out there, as well as record holiday tunes in a way they have never been heard before.
  • I finished my first record with a successful Kickstarter campaign. I was super organized and determined to make it a finished product my supporters would love. I think they did!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help!

  • 'Like' my FB page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Joelle-Lurie-The-Pinehurst-Trio/362910994067?pnref=lhc
  • Feel free to share this campaign on social media via the Indigogo share tools above: @jojolurie
  • Check out my websites: www.joellelurie.com / www.pinehurstmusic.net
  • Check out my album 'Take Me There' on iTunes, Spotify, Bandcamp

With love and thanks for any type of support you can give,

xo Joelle

Jazzy pop, poppy jazz. But this time in the form of 2 EPs (short albums of 4-6 tunes). 
1. Holiday/Christmas tunes -- I want to put a unique Pinehurst twist to my favorite holiday tunes. 
2. Original tunes -- I've been writing a lot, on my own & also along with my collaborators, Ben Gallina (longtime bass player & friend), Charlie Lurie (longtime guitarist & brother).
I'm driven, excited, and have a specific goal/plan -- all I need is your help to make it happen.   How would I use your help?  To commission arrangements, rehearse with my band, then hit the recording studio
Post recording: mixing, mastering, photo/artwork
Marketing/publicizing the CDs properly to get it out there    Why and how?  I want to get both my original songs out there, as well as record holiday tunes in a way they have never been heard before. I finished my first record with a successful Kickstarter campaign. I was super organized and determined to make it a finished product my supporters would love. I think they did!


    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, you can still help!  'Like' my FB page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Joelle-Lurie-The-Pinehurst-Trio/362910994067?pnref=lhc

Feel free to share this campaign on social media via the Indigogo share tools above: @jojolurie Check out my websites: www.joellelurie.com / www.pinehurstmusic.net

Check out my album 'Take Me There' on iTunes, Spotify, Bandcamp   With love and thanks for any type of support you can give,xo Joelle

story:
Hi, we are Red Letter, made up of Justin "JG" Goss (vocals), Garry "Geeno" Norris (drums), Kaleb Henderson Redd (keyboard), Davioze Pulliams (bass), and Tymothy "DJ Miko" Peterson (DJ).


­­­Some of you may know JG from his previous projects and we hope you can join us in supporting our latest musical creation. Red Letter is a full time band and ministry for all us, and will be putting all of our energy and focus first and for most God and making this the band we all believe it can be.

We wanted to do a live arrangement of the album along with some new original songs. We have been rocking live shows, and are now ready to record a album. We have all played for several Churches and bands before, however decided to use our collective experiences to launch this band ourselves....of course, with your support. 

Making an album isn't cheap, and that's just the start of costs that bands have to worry about. From music videos, promo shots, flights, merchandise, and fixing broken gear..... As you know life in a band can get pretty expensive. These costs can run into the tens of thousands. What we are focusing on right now is getting our album out and heard by you.

The $2,500 we are campaigning for is to help fund the creation and distribution of our debut album. Here is a quick breakdown to show you where your money is going:

•  Cost of recording, mixing and mastering $1,200 +

•  Cost of goods for perks $1,100 +

•  IndieGoGo and Credit Card Fees $200.00+

In exchange for your support we are offering exclusive items, some of which are only available through this campaign and are limited in number. So when they're gone, that's it. 

This experience is about our interaction with you, we are here to listen to you. If there is a perk you want to see added, or have a suggestion please feel free to contact us! 

We broke the budget down by department below. We believe it will be workable to produce this album with $2,500.00. However, we hope to reach beyond the goal. 


Thank you so much for checking out our campaign and reading this far. Whether you have contributed or not, we appreciate your time and checking us out.

Please share this campaign with friends, family, church and anyone else who may be interested in our music. You can also use the handy Indiegogo share tools or check us out on social media. #RedLetter #JGXRedLetter 

Also don't for get to check out JG's Pursuit of happiness album: 


Thanks - Red Letter.

story:
Gang Awareness & Prevention; a.k.a. God Answers Prayers
 is holding its inaugural “Day-in-the-Park” event called ‘Stay Lit’  
  • When: August 30th 2015  Noon- 8pm 
  • What: “Stay Lit” BBQ-youth activities and concert for at-risk youth 
  • Who: All Mentors/Mentees and their families 
  • Why: This event is primarily for Mentors & Mentees of formerly incarcerated boys & girls. A celebration of youth turning their lives around and starting a new chapter, which includes positive role models and clean fun.
  The day-in-the-park will include: 
a) Early morning filming for video of album release for one of our volunteers 
b) Early afternoon BBQ for families & volunteers 
c) Fun/game activities for teens and adults emphasizing team building and cooperation with others 
d) Concert starting in early evening (5-8pm) Christian contemporary worship &  Christian RAP artists... intermingled between songs with Mentee testimonies.
We have over 100 youth and their siblings who need to learn how to have good, clean fun...without breaking the law!
Surrounding neighborhood youth from inner city Sacramento are also invited.
We hope to attract several hundred "high-potential" boys and girls.

Since this is a free event, we are asking anyone who can help donate to offset for costs of organizing the outreach and renting the park.

If you would like to donate, please donate on this page and look up the "GAP concert". 

Or go to our website and use PayPal. www.gapgangs.com 

What We Need 

Details:

  • WE need $500 for the cost of the City Park Fees and another $500 for food: Hotdogs, buns, chips, soda, water, etc.  Total $1,000
  • We are going to feed a lot of people!
  •  If we don't reach our entire goal we will still do the BBQ-- have FUN activities and Feed whoever comes! It will simply have to come out of our personal pockets....which we are used to. 
  • But the fact is we don't have budget for this. We don't get any government funding and there are NO major donors. 
  • Volunteers are who we are! "Do gooders" who go into the juvenile jails and county and state prison. 
  • We simply NEED your help keeping the young people, boys & girls away from illegal activities and a thug lifestyle.
  • We will do our part to rebuild the foundations of this lost generation.          Ezekiel 22:30.

What You Get

  • Perks~ Free dvd's from the artists and some of the BBQ if you come and join us
  • Satisfaction of knowing you helped keep the streets of this city a safer place
  • Understanding that showing wayward youth a different way to have fun is a huge step toward a changed life! Our mentor will stay in their life (see below)

The Impact

G.A.P. 2015 Mission~ Rescue 50 young people in the Sacramento area from the violence, crime and desperation found in their relationships and neighborhoods

Our AIM:

Awareness – To the community, churches and parents                                     Interaction – Youth organizations, government agencies and law enforcement Mentoring – For aimless youth of all ages in the Sacramento region

Our goal is to provide parents and guardians with alternative opportunities, helping youth to constructively realize their full potential.

We are also looking for mentors: Once a week or bi-weekly spending one on one time with a youth, listening without judgment and giving advice when needed.

For further information about how YOU can become a mentor or help us rescue youth contact: 

        Randal Broadhurst (916) 804-7980       E-Mail: randal.gapgangs@gmail.com

Risks & Challenges

We have a proven plan for helping to solve the rampant recidivism (criminal behavior that leads to re-arrest) we face in this country today. 
We spend Monday & Wednesday evenings  and Saturday mornings every week building relationships with incarcerated youth in Sacramento County. We have dozens of trained and experienced volunteers who have BIG hearts. We meet with about 100-150 boys and girls each week.
The challenge is proving to them that there is an alternative to criminal and gang behavior. The risk is that we miss some because we don't have enough volunteers and are woefully underfunded. The reality is that more teenagers will commit violent crimes and someone will be killed because we weren't able to reach them in time.

Today’s youth seek four things:

  1. Action: Words and promises are not enough – someone to listen and walk beside them 
  2. Consistency: A trustworthy advisor – a person they can count on in hard times
  3. Truth: Excuses and fabrications destroy truth – someone to empower them with biblical truths 
  4. Time: Time and attention from a caring adult – a mentor 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us as a volunteer. We have many other ways you can use your talents.

Other funding needs (besides the above event):

Books for Juvenile Hall libraries 

Shirts & hats: Mentees “Youth Group” kids after release: (“Keepin’ it 100”)

Videos/Movies: demonstrating character, integrity, honesty, work ethic, family, marriage, and many more! Donate for units inside Youth Detention Facilities.

Facilities: 

  • Help pay for hourly rental of Boys & Girls Club 
  • clubhouse of our own
  • Lord’s Gym memberships

Website development & maintenance
Trailer- small enclosed for taking kids on fun adventures

Donations:

$$ for travel:

  • To see other organizations serving youth (LA; Fresno) 
  • Federal Juvenile Justice seminars & conferences
  • State Juvenile Justice conferences
  • Pay for other experts to speak to us re: Gangs
  • training of our volunteers §  Interns for helping us with website, newsletters, administration.
G.A.P. operational volunteer expenses:
 Background checks; ID lanyards; biz cards & ID’s;
  Volunteer training;

  “G.A.P. Vol. Uniforms”—hats & shirts;

  • Youth “Keepin’ it 100” hats & shirts & hoodies

  Event fees — outreach to recruit volunteer mentors; i.e.,

  • MLK Celebration, Men’s Conferences, etc. 
PLEASE pass this site onto others. AND don't forget to add the link to your social media page! Get the word out.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!


   Randal.gapgangs@gmail.com   www.gapgangs.com

story:
De IMPERFACTION AS IT IS:
A Prague based neo-funk rock band De ImperfAction brought together a group of talented aspiring musicians from four continents. Their compositions reflect a wide range of social injustice: they speak up about growing lack of privacy on a planet; about the enormous amount of rape and murder in the world; about our hardened unholy generation; about people becoming social toys, about the losers and wanna-be ones; about disconnection and desolation of a modern man, lost and outcast.

Music IS A POWERFUL TOOL:
We believe that a talented person can make a difference in today's world saturated with violence, genocide and all sorts of human abuse. So unlike the vast majority of musicians and band, our mission is, through the blend of text and music, to raise public awareness of the social inequities, the ones, people pretend non-exist while they do: in real world, in real time.

We've just finished the song, I'll pour my music in you. Its lyrics embrace the current events in the Middle East, Ukraine and North Korea, the horrors of Jihad. Millions of people displaced, thousands tortured and slaughtered. And it wouldn't be us, De ImperfAction, if we didn't react to such an obvious humanitarian catastrophe, and shared it with you. In War, no love, which is a reverse slogan of hippies', Make love, no war! we're trying to dig into the nature and genetics of warfare. Why people need to kill each other? why so much hate? is this a part of a human nature? is there any way to change it?  


Our songs are not about. They are the tiny slices of life based on concrete facts: say, You've shot your girl is a direct reflection of the Oscar Pistorius case who killed his girlfriend on Valentine's day; Mutilated, where actual news lines slightly rhymed, deliver the tragedy of a 17-year girl, Anene Booyson, who was gang-raped and drastically murdered in South Africa. A story of a friend of ours who, for all his life, dreamed of becoming a musician but each time there something come in a way, reflected in a song Planet Wannabe.

Music is a powerful tool and if handled right it can actually make a difference. Although we don't try to do the impossible and change the world, we do try to tell you the truth, the bitter facts of our everyday life: and the making of music, speaking up about our problems and achings is one of the ways of making a difference in this world. 

The GOAL:
Our goal is to raise € 11,800 for the recording and production of a 14-song debut album "Da strange wayz ov luv" this fall, and promoting it on tour around Europe, where we could meet our fans on various stages, and carry out the message to a wider audience.

With your help we are hoping to raise € 11,800 to pay for the cost of:

  • Studio recording & mixing: € 2,000
  • Mastering: € 800
  • Physical production: € 1,500
  • Artwork and design: € 500
  • Publicity: € 2,000
  • Tour: € 5,000
  • Fees for IndieGoGo, PayPal and credit card companies: 10-15%
NB: If you don't have a PayPal account you can make donation via direct bank wire transfer. For the details please email to de.imperfaction@yahoo.com

By SUPPORTING YOU BECOME A PART OF US:
Even though we've managed to pull together all our savings and make the first music video, just like the majority of musicians we experience perpetual financial difficulties. Therefore your support means a lot to us. Not only that we could make our dream come true, record an album, and then promote it on tour. But you'd yourself become one of us, become a part of our fight.


Check our Facebook Page posts:
- Female angels and rolling heads (on ISIS ideology);
- Rock music to many means party, drugs and good time... (on human abuse in the North Korean labor camps);
- The South African journalist had recently published an open letter to Oscar Pistorius... (a comment on Jani Allan's Leter to Oscar);

Or read the songs lyrics;

Or check the live performance and interviews on our YouTube channel:
- Da strange wayz ov luv (on trust abuse in relationships; with the interview on Balcony TV); 
- TV suicide (on media inhumana); 
- The RefuFest 2014 performance in support of the immigrants rights -
and see for yourself that we do take these issues closely, which, in turn, resonate in our music.

The GRATITUDE:
In exchange for your support depending on your donation, we'd offer you a free download link to a high quality digital album, once out;
- An autographed CD and band photo;
- Skype interview and backstage access, or the linking to your Facebook page;
- A gig in your area, or an acoustic or full band show at your place;
- If we happen to have a gig in your town, we'll make sure to put your name on a Guestlist;
- A patronage and the inclusion of your name in the album' "Special Thanks" section.

And of course our greatest reward will always be the most sincere gratitude in the form of music.

                                             So come on, rock the world with us!

story:
Short Summary

Stories have paid the mortgage for nearly two decades. I am a professional storyteller, musician and vocalist. Sharing stories and songs rooted in the African  oral tradition has been my j-o-b since 1996. Now, I have an opportunity to perform in West Africa. 

The National Association of Black Storytellers Inc. (NABS) has invited me to perform at Panafest.  Additionally, I get to participate in the Inter-Continental Scholarly Exchange on the Preservation of the African Oral Tradition through Black Storytelling. Both the festival and scholarly exchange will take place in Ghana, West Africa December  1-19, 2015.

The stories and songs I perform are derived from both my personal experience as a woman of African descent, from the traditions handed down from my parents, as well as from my scholarly research. This project affords me an opportunity to go to the source of my cultural roots for the very first time and not only collect stories, but to participate in an academic discussion about African storytelling with a diverse assembly of people. 

Contributors to this project play a huge role! 

How the Money Will Be Used 

The funds will go towards travel expenses to Ghana. Airfare, hotel, food and such. Thankfully, I received a $750 grant from the Delaware Divisions of the Arts, which reduced my expenses to just $3500. 

The Impact 

How This Project Impacts Me Personally

Storytime....

This crowd funding campaign is being launched on Sept. 9 in memory of my mother, Martha L. Burwell, who was born September 9, 1936. My mommie (her special spelling), fervently believed in every dream I ever had. My dream to go to Ghana was planted by my daddy, who raised each of his seven children to love and celebrate our African heritage.

My daddy, Arthur Burwell, Jr. aka Kofi Abogyse, travelled to Ghana in 1976, when I was eleven years old. During the late 70s, the mini-series Roots, sparked many Blacks to go in search of their African ancestry. My father was far from the exception. A culturally conscious man and community activist, his reasons for going to West Africa were to deepen his knowledge of our ancestry and make meaningful connections with the African people.

My dad brought back artifacts, games and stories. The greatest treasure was the life-long relationship he developed with a young man named, Justice. My father made it possible for Justice to move to America. Justice became a part of our family. Over the years, my father, Justice and I talked about me one day going to Ghana. As a teenager, it seemed a fanciful idea.

Twenty-one years later, when my father languished in bed, his body riddled with cancer, Justice was there grieving along with our entire family. It was at my dad’s bedside I pleaded with my dad to retell the stories he told me about Ghana. I longed to once more hear the story of how he stood in the hot Ghanaian sun to barter for artifacts, which now are in my home. Stories I heard so many times as a child (which honestly bored me), now in the final moments of my dad’s life, I begged to hear; but could not because cancer had stolen his voice.

As I grieved my father’s transition over the years, those treasures from Ghana have been a great source of comfort. The spears, the statues, the photos all make me smile knowing that each item gives me a small piece of my dad.

One day I got a postcard in the mail from a friend and fellow storyteller, Auntie JoJo. The postcard depicted the Wli Waterfall in Ghana, the highest natural waterfall on the west coast of Africa. I placed that postcard on my vision board to represent a quiet promise I made to myself to one day go to Ghana and walk where my father walked.

When I got the invitation from the NABS to perform at Panafest, my daughter immediately reminded me of my dream to one day go to Ghana. Her reminder made me look at that postcard on my vision board. I really made no conscious plan to manifest this dream; but the Divine helped me realize it nonetheless. My mind held some resistance, as I still had to figure out how to cover my expenses.

My next move was to apply for an Opportunity Grant with the Delaware Division of the Arts. The maximum award was $750, which only scratched the surface of what I needed. If I got the grant, I thought, it would be another indication that this trip will come to pass.

I got the grant!

Now I am only a few thousands dollars away from the goal! 

How this Project Impacts My Career

Since 1996, I have worked as a full-time professional storyteller sharing stories and songs from the African Diaspora. This project will enable me to deepen my knowledge and understanding of the African Oral tradition and connect me with other cultural keepers throughout the African Diaspora. It is a distinguished honor to be selected to perform at Panafest.

The Panafest occurs every two years and performers must be invited to participate. The National Association of Black Storytellers (NABS) has received this invitation for the first time in its thirty-three year history. After a rigorous vetting process, NABS has subsequently only selected artists who possess high quality artistic ability, and have accomplished significant achievements in the preservation and perpetuation of the African Oral Tradition. 

What You Get

When I return from Ghana, I will hold the Sankofa Celebration, where I will perform LIVE. Contributors at Level 4 through 7 get in FREE to this ticketed event. The stories and songs I perform will include those collected in Ghana and/or inspired by my experience there. 

At the Sankofa Celebration, the video chronicling my trip will be also aired. See your name in video credits if you contribute at Level 6 or higher. Get VIP treatment at the Sankofa Celebration with a contribution at Levels 7 & 8.

Contributors at Level 8 get an exclusive house concert. You provide the space and I come perform for you and as many guests you can fit. You and your guests get to experience an intimate performance, entitled, Soul of My Stories. After the one hour performance, I will mingle, chat & chew. And you can charge admission if you so desire! 

Here are the perk details:

LEVELS and PERKS


1.  Ananse Ntontan (Creativity):  $1 Ananse the Spider Helper. Every itsy bitsy helps. My immense gratitude.

2. Akoben (Vigilance):  $5 Answered the Call. Personalize mention on social media PLUS Level 1 perk 


3.  Duafe (Beauty):  $15 Beautiful Light. Autographed picture PLUS Level 1-2 perks


4. Sankofa (Learn from the Past): $25 Ancestors Smiling. Free Admission to Sankofa Celebration^ PLUS Level 1-3 Perks

       ^Event will be held in Spring 2016 near Claymont, DE


5. Akoma (The Heart): $50 Joyful Heart. Name listed on designated page of my website PLUS Level 1-4 Perks


6. Eban (Love): $75 Loving Spirit. Name listed in the Sankofa Celebration Video PLUS Level 1-5 Perks


7.   Adinkrakene (Greatness):  $100 Abundant Giver. VIP reception at the Sankofa Celebration PLUS Level 1-6 Perks


8.  Gye Nyame (Supremacy of God):  $500 Divine Aid. House concert* PLUS Level 1-7 Perks

*Location must be within 50 miles of Claymont, DE. Concert will be scheduled in 2016.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You have many contribution options from which to choose. Each option comes with a reward. Your contribution into this project will also have the added return of knowing you played a part in the shaping of the stories I perform. 

BECOME A PART OF THE STORY!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be incorporating what I learn and experience in Ghana into the stories and songs I share at the Sankofa Celebration. Granted, I have been researching, writing and performing since 1994; and yet it can still feel like a daunting task. 

The Sankofa Celebration will occur in the Spring of 2016, which only gives me a few months to get ready.  Thankfully, I have a wonderful support team to help me make it happen. I am hopeful that as news of this campaign spreads, others will want to lend a hand to make the Sankofa Celebration happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word by sharing this campaign on social media. If you want to really be a part of the live action, help me execute the Sankofa Celebration when I return from Ghana. There are a myriad of ways you can help beyond making a financial contribution. Email me at TAHIRA@TAHIRAproductions.com for more details.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Stories have paid the mortgage for nearly two decades. I am a professional storyteller, musician and vocalist. Sharing stories and songs rooted in the African  oral tradition has been my j-o-b since 1996. Now, I have an opportunity to perform in West Africa. 
The National Association of Black Storytellers Inc. (NABS) has invited me to perform at Panafest.  Additionally, I get to participate in the Inter-Continental Scholarly Exchange on the Preservation of the African Oral Tradition through Black Storytelling. Both the festival and scholarly exchange will take place in Ghana, West Africa December  1-19, 2015.
The stories and songs I perform are derived from both my personal experience as a woman of African descent, from the traditions handed down from my parents, as well as from my scholarly research. This project affords me an opportunity to go to the source of my cultural roots for the very first time and not only collect stories, but to participate in an academic discussion about African storytelling with a diverse assembly of people. 
Contributors to this project play a huge role! 
How the Money Will Be Used 
 The funds will go towards travel expenses to Ghana. Airfare, hotel, food and such. Thankfully, I received a $750 grant from the Delaware Divisions of the Arts, which reduced my expenses to just $3500. 


The Impact 
How This Project Impacts Me Personally
Storytime....
This crowd funding campaign is being launched on Sept. 9 in memory of my mother, Martha L. Burwell, who was born September 9, 1936. My mommie (her special spelling), fervently believed in every dream I ever had. My dream to go to Ghana was planted by my daddy, who raised each of his seven children to love and celebrate our African heritage.
My daddy, Arthur Burwell, Jr. aka Kofi Abogyse, travelled to Ghana in 1976, when I was eleven years old. During the late 70s, the mini-series Roots, sparked many Blacks to go in search of their African ancestry. My father was far from the exception. A culturally conscious man and community activist, his reasons for going to West Africa were to deepen his knowledge of our ancestry and make meaningful connections with the African people.
My dad brought back artifacts, games and stories. The greatest treasure was the life-long relationship he developed with a young man named, Justice. My father made it possible for Justice to move to America. Justice became a part of our family. Over the years, my father, Justice and I talked about me one day going to Ghana. As a teenager, it seemed a fanciful idea.
Twenty-one years later, when my father languished in bed, his body riddled with cancer, Justice was there grieving along with our entire family. It was at my dad’s bedside I pleaded with my dad to retell the stories he told me about Ghana. I longed to once more hear the story of how he stood in the hot Ghanaian sun to barter for artifacts, which now are in my home. Stories I heard so many times as a child (which honestly bored me), now in the final moments of my dad’s life, I begged to hear; but could not because cancer had stolen his voice.
As I grieved my father’s transition over the years, those treasures from Ghana have been a great source of comfort. The spears, the statues, the photos all make me smile knowing that each item gives me a small piece of my dad.
One day I got a postcard in the mail from a friend and fellow storyteller, Auntie JoJo. The postcard depicted the Wli Waterfall in Ghana, the highest natural waterfall on the west coast of Africa. I placed that postcard on my vision board to represent a quiet promise I made to myself to one day go to Ghana and walk where my father walked.
When I got the invitation from the NABS to perform at Panafest, my daughter immediately reminded me of my dream to one day go to Ghana. Her reminder made me look at that postcard on my vision board. I really made no conscious plan to manifest this dream; but the Divine helped me realize it nonetheless. My mind held some resistance, as I still had to figure out how to cover my expenses.
My next move was to apply for an Opportunity Grant with the Delaware Division of the Arts. The maximum award was $750, which only scratched the surface of what I needed. If I got the grant, I thought, it would be another indication that this trip will come to pass.
I got the grant!
Now I am only a few thousands dollars away from the goal! 


How this Project Impacts My Career

This project will enable me to deepen my knowledge and understanding of the African Oral tradition and connect me with other cultural keepers throughout the African Diaspora. The National Association of Black Storytellers (NABS) has received this invitation for the first time in its thirty-three year history. After a rigorous vetting process, NABS has subsequently only selected artists who possess high quality artistic ability, and have accomplished significant achievements in the preservation and perpetuation of the African Oral Tradition.

story:
The time has come to complete the recording I started with Will Ackerman at Imaginary Road Studio back in December 2011. It has been on hold due unforeseen life challenges. With all that behind me, I am pressing on and extremely excited to get this record done and released to the world!

Creating music has been my life’s pursuit since I was 19 years old. That was the first time I picked up the guitar and got serious about being a musician. In 1982, I discovered the music of Will Ackerman through his Windham Hill Records release “Passage.” When I listened to “Passage”, the emotions I felt, inspired me to write and create instrumental guitar songs. Finally in 2004, I released “ A Place Called Home."

Around this time, Will discovered my music on MySpace and sent me a message letting me know how much he enjoy my guitar playing on “A Place Called Home.”

Imagine for a moment, the person who has inspired you to play the guitar sends you a message out of the blue and says, “I love your work!” I was on cloud nine!!!

That message sparked a friendship and soon Will and I started discussing the possibility of working together. In 2011 it became a reality. 

The title of this new work is inspired by mother, Mary Ann Verheecke… a full blood Yupik Eskimo. Shortly before she passed away, she opened up about her experiences growing up in Alaska. Her stories of the places she lived like; Sitka, AK, inspired me to write for this new record. I imagined myself drifting up the inland passage way in the the beauty she would often describe “Drifting into the Sublime.”

My father, Edward Allen Verheecke (27 year Air Force Career man, Belgian, Scotch-Irish decent) would often tell me and encourage me saying: “Ken, you were created to soar,” “You can accomplish whatever you want in life,” and “the only failure is a no try.”

His words and my mom’s stories have once again risen to the surface of my heart and life as a reminder to complete this work!


I had no idea when I first started playing the guitar that this music would mean so much to so many! I get messages and emails from all over the world noting how much this music has touched so many lives! My albums have been played while children were being born.  One family story was shared recently with me, that my music was playing while a loved one passed into eternity. 

I KNOW without any doubt this project with Will Ackerman will accomplish the same and more!

“Alone we can do so little, together we can do so much.” Helen Keller

I can’t do this alone...

Join me today! Together let’s get this record DONE and release it to the world!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

story:
“Our Eventz365”: On Demand Events & Entertainment!

Christmas is Coming Special Offer: Support our Campaign anything over £20 and recieve free tickets to a high profile Celebrity charity event with photo opportunity and free glass of bubbly on entry! Events in Cardiff and Swansea and various locations in Wales: Perfect gift for mum, wife, sister's, nan or daughter's, tickets and personalised invitation letters delivered before christmas eve! ( Our team will contact you via email once purchased for further details and name(/s) for tickets).

Hello, my name is Dane Marks and I am here to tell you about “Our Eventz365”. As you probably already know, any good company, organization or program is generally jumpstarted with an event, whether it is a dinner with a live speaker or a music concert.  There is no other way to harness the excitement and enthusiasm all in one room better than a well planned and executed event.  And that is exactly what we do. That is why I have created “Our Eventz365” and now anyone can create their very own event with ease. “Our Eventz365” is an exclusive way to plan, design and implement corporate, music and entertainment events primarily in Wales and further in the UK.  We aim to create and facilitate high profile music events, corporate events and entertainment events throughout Wales.

  

The goal of this campaign is to reach like-minded people for collaboration, raise money in exchange for early access and rewards, and we also want to spread the word.  The more people we can get using “Our Eventz365” the more functional and successful it will be.  So this campaign will give you the basics on our efforts and progress.  Beyond that we encourage you to ask us questions, donate and get involved.  We developed “Our Eventz365” for your benefit, so enjoy!  We believe we are really onto an easier way to create an impactful event with a fraction of the work and cost.

Do you ever think about holding your own music event but shudder at the cost and resources it would take to make it a reality?


Do you want to gather people together for a corporate event but are overwhelmed with the choices?

 

Are you interested in planning an event but don’t have the time to organize all the vendors?

 

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

 

The Twenty-First Century Event Planner has Arrived

 

(Our Team September 2015 RIP Dean Powell, Founder of 365 Security and Guarding 1963-2015)

Welcome to the new and improved way to hold a killer event with the click of a button with “Our Eventz365”.  Once you engage “Our Eventz365” you will have everything from the bar to the lights to the tents to hold the best event for the best talent. Having such a venue will even attract more amazing acts.  We specialize in, corporate, music and entertainment, we feel live events and festivals are our niche and we love it. We developed a well-designed mobile package to make planning your event a breeze. Our packages come packed with every last detail you need and even some you didn’t think of, and by putting them all together in this easy to order package we can get you the lowest prices that individual vendors cannot compete with. With our system you can make planning any music organized, profitable and FUN!  “Our Eventz365” is dedicated to promoting live events. We run our events with all the leading vendors and resources. One stop shopping for the best party you have ever seen!

Overview

Our popular culture reinforces the idea that holding an event with the proper equipment is hard, time consuming and sometimes not worthwhile. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Our Eventz365” event at a time! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution. As little as £100 gets an “Our Eventz365 ” life time membership plus £50 worth of tickets. An event to an individual and can change their ideas about live entertainment for the rest of his or her life.  Finding out your music can be heard the way it is meant to be heard will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

More about the Project

OurEventz365 aims to create 12 high profile festivals in 2016, raising to 20 in 2017 and 30 in 2018. We aim to create multiple local jobs including safety personnel, operational teams, security teams, catering teams, contractors and suppliers and increase revenue for local businesses. Although every event we create will not come without issues, we aim to create and source a strong and talented team for event operations to ensure that in planning and design stage, every eventually is covered. Our events will be comfortably priced and will aim to be designed so the customer is at the heart of the events, gaining both value for money, while enjoying themselves in a safe and comfortable surroundings. 

 

Word-of-mouth marketing may be the hot new trend, but when it comes to getting people to recommend a brand, nothing gets people talking up a brand like live experiences do, a new study shows. Momentum Worldwide surveyed more than 6,500 people in nine markets globally to compare the impact of 23 types of brand experiences, including watching TV commercials, visiting a brand’s social networking page and attending a branded music, sports or other event. Among the takeaways: Attending a branded live experience drives 65 percent of people to recommend the brand and 59 percent to buy it at retail afterwards.  As we move into an experience driven world, this is where we started to envision “Our Eventz365” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

We will be selling tickets to events through associated parties.

We will be allocating most resources from profit back into our other companies as we will be mainly providing the staffing operations.

We will be providing food and beverages through our own staffed food and beverage vans.

We will provide charger tents for mobiles, iPad and computer devices.

We will earn commissions off people purchasing tents, sleeping bags and festival equipment.

We will earn off VIP members and corporate members.

We will earn off advertising and sponsors.

(Our Team June 2015)


When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to hear phenomenal music in exceptional festival settings.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in this rapidly growing industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the event planning industry. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth.

 

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s low cost and completely comprehensive for your festival and event needs. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement of becoming the first mobile, multiple live event venue attending various bespoke UK sites entertaining our audience.

What’s Unique About Us:

It is also our mission to also provide food and beverage vans, we will encourage diversity in food and drink. Core brands will be at the heart of each event, but diversity in food and beverages will ensure that the customer does not get bored and will add to the experience for the next event. By facilitating charger tents and festival clothes and equipment from a supplier, we cut costs of purchase and earn off every sale, while ensuring that customers do not have to leave the event for any reason. All this will be considered during planning and customer feedback to ensure we get this right.

OurEventz365 Go Viral is a range of photo boards where customers can get a snap with a celebrity. This will be automatically posted to social media sites creating a go viral effect, reinforcing our branding. Customers will pay a premium for this.

Job Creation-- Because oureventz365 is part of the 365 facilities management chain, we aim to create multiple jobs for our employees while ensuring the very best in entertainment to our customers. By doing this, we ensure that we protect stakeholders investments, bring higher revenue to local businesses in Wales, provide multiple platforms for service providers. We aim to bring fun to wales for the local customers and provide opportunities for visitors to experience what we have to offer.

Company Information:

“Our Eventz365” is based Wales and is the only exclusive event planning package, offering everything from live entertainment to full music festival with a focus on sales and market growth. The ethos of “Our Eventz365” also involves providing the platform and showcasing everything in the cultural arts of audio, visual, dance and performance live in the love of “Our Eventz365” in one space. In addition to the world class and award winning artists and performers, some of whom will be exclusive of all genres and formats, “Our Eventz365” will also strive to seek and showcase upcoming and gifted talents in the world of music culture and in doing so deliver an experience that can be rivaled by no other - truly authentic and immersive.

For us to bring the “Our Eventz365” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of the “Our Eventz365”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.

We will also be using the funding to:

Expand the possibilities for the usage for UK as well as international solutions of the “Our Eventz365”

Further customize the first version of the “Our Eventz365”’s platform

Create additional products and services that will compliment “Our Eventz365”

The “Our Eventz365” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about £95000 amount in order to break “Our Eventz365” onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up.

 

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Our Eventz365” family.

 

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

 

Contributions...

 

Your generosity and support could make all the difference in the fruition of “Our Eventz365”. 

 

It would be great to have 95 people to contribute £1,000. But in reality, 20000 people contributing £5 would work too.  Of course you may contribute more.  We will be eternally grateful!  Please share this with anyone you think would be willing to help. 

 

Old school?  No Problem!

 

For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via email: info@oureventz365.com and I will provide you with a mailing address to send check or money order to.  I will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like.

 

 

Here's the link to the Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/OurEventz365-101651006...

 

 

Please like and share it.  Feel free to leave a message also.

 

 

If you wish to contact us:

 

Website: www.oureventz365.com

 

Our Social Media Connections:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/OurEvents365

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/OurEventz365-101651006...

 

 

Contact Information

Name: Dane Marks

Phone Number: 0800 689 0668

E Mail: dane.marks@oureventz365.com


 

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at info@oureventz365.com
