We developed a well-designed mobile package to make planning your event a breeze. Our packages come packed with every last detail you need and even some you didn’t think of, and by putting them all together in this easy to order package we can get you the lowest prices that individual vendors cannot compete with. With our system you can make planning any music organized, profitable and FUN!  “Our Eventz365” is dedicated to promoting live events. We run our events with all the leading vendors and resources. One stop shopping for the best party you have ever seen!OverviewOur popular culture reinforces the idea that holding an event with the proper equipment is hard, time consuming and sometimes not worthwhile. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Our Eventz365” event at a time! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution. As little as £100 gets an “Our Eventz365 ” life time membership plus £50 worth of tickets. An event to an individual and can change their ideas about live entertainment for the rest of his or her life.  Finding out your music can be heard the way it is meant to be heard will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!More about the ProjectOurEventz365 aims to create 12 high profile festivals in 2016, raising to 20 in 2017 and 30 in 2018. We aim to create multiple local jobs including safety personnel, operational teams, security teams, catering teams, contractors and suppliers and increase revenue for local businesses. Although every event we create will not come without issues, we aim to create and source a strong and talented team for event operations to ensure that in planning and design stage, every eventually is covered. Our events will be comfortably priced and will aim to be designed so the customer is at the heart of the events, gaining both value for money, while enjoying themselves in a safe and comfortable surroundings.  Word-of-mouth marketing may be the hot new trend, but when it comes to getting people to recommend a brand, nothing gets people talking up a brand like live experiences do, a new study shows. Momentum Worldwide surveyed more than 6,500 people in nine markets globally to compare the impact of 23 types of brand experiences, including watching TV commercials, visiting a brand’s social networking page and attending a branded music, sports or other event. Among the takeaways: Attending a branded live experience drives 65 percent of people to recommend the brand and 59 percent to buy it at retail afterwards.  As we move into an experience driven world, this is where we started to envision “Our Eventz365” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:We will be selling tickets to events through associated parties.We will be allocating most resources from profit back into our other companies as we will be mainly providing the staffing operations.We will be providing food and beverages through our own staffed food and beverage vans.We will provide charger tents for mobiles, iPad and computer devices.We will earn commissions off people purchasing tents, sleeping bags and festival equipment.We will earn off VIP members and corporate members.We will earn off advertising and sponsors.(Our Team June 2015)When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to hear phenomenal music in exceptional festival settings.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in this rapidly growing industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the event planning industry. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth. Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s low cost and completely comprehensive for your festival and event needs. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement of becoming the first mobile, multiple live event venue attending various bespoke UK sites entertaining our audience.What’s Unique About Us:It is also our mission to also provide food and beverage vans, we will encourage diversity in food and drink. Core brands will be at the heart of each event, but diversity in food and beverages will ensure that the customer does not get bored and will add to the experience for the next event. By facilitating charger tents and festival clothes and equipment from a supplier, we cut costs of purchase and earn off every sale, while ensuring that customers do not have to leave the event for any reason. All this will be considered during planning and customer feedback to ensure we get this right.OurEventz365 Go Viral is a range of photo boards where customers can get a snap with a celebrity. This will be automatically posted to social media sites creating a go viral effect, reinforcing our branding. Customers will pay a premium for this.Job Creation-- Because oureventz365 is part of the 365 facilities management chain, we aim to create multiple jobs for our employees while ensuring the very best in entertainment to our customers. By doing this, we ensure that we protect stakeholders investments, bring higher revenue to local businesses in Wales, provide multiple platforms for service providers. We aim to bring fun to wales for the local customers and provide opportunities for visitors to experience what we have to offer.Company Information:“Our Eventz365” is based Wales and is the only exclusive event planning package, offering everything from live entertainment to full music festival with a focus on sales and market growth. The ethos of “Our Eventz365” also involves providing the platform and showcasing everything in the cultural arts of audio, visual, dance and performance live in the love of “Our Eventz365” in one space. In addition to the world class and award winning artists and performers, some of whom will be exclusive of all genres and formats, “Our Eventz365” will also strive to seek and showcase upcoming and gifted talents in the world of music culture and in doing so deliver an experience that can be rivaled by no other - truly authentic and immersive.For us to bring the “Our Eventz365” to life, we need your support!Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of the “Our Eventz365”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.We will also be using the funding to:Expand the possibilities for the usage for UK as well as international solutions of the “Our Eventz365”Further customize the first version of the “Our Eventz365”’s platformCreate additional products and services that will compliment “Our Eventz365”The “Our Eventz365” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!How We'll Use the FundsWe need about £95000 amount in order to break “Our Eventz365” onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up. We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Our Eventz365” family. If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word! Contributions... Your generosity and support could make all the difference in the fruition of “Our Eventz365”.  It would be great to have 95 people to contribute £1,000. But in reality, 20000 people contributing £5 would work too.  Of course you may contribute more.  We will be eternally grateful!  Please share this with anyone you think would be willing to help.  Old school?  No Problem! For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via email: info@oureventz365.com and I will provide you with a mailing address to send check or money order to.  I will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like.  Here's the link to the Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/OurEventz365-101651006...  Please like and share it.  Feel free to leave a message also.  If you wish to contact us: Website: www.oureventz365.com Our Social Media Connections:Twitter: https://twitter.com/OurEvents365Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/OurEventz365-101651006...  Contact InformationName: Dane MarksPhone Number: 0800 689 0668E Mail: dane.marks@oureventz365.com If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at info@oureventz365.com

story:
Hi everybody! My name is Liana Malva, I’m a singer and songwriter from Venezuela, I grew up in an authentic family of artists in one of the most exotic places of the world, El Pauji, La Gran Sabana, Venezuela.

I’ve been writing my own music since I was 11 years old and I have been working in a personal project that started three years ago along with my band. I make pop music with strong Black Music influences, and mixing different genres is not only one of the things I love the most about music, but it also defines me as an artist. Singing and writing music are my biggest skills in life, and I can’t nor do I want to ever stop doing it. I am always writing music and I dream of taking my project to the next level. I want to record my first album to share all of this energy through good music.

My country is currently going through a very complicated economic situation and the financial support to artists is practically inexistent. There are no record labels investing in music, and in general it is difficult to count on entities to support these kind of projects. This is the reason why I decided to work on an independent production, with the ad honorem support of an amazing group of professionals to be able to turn this dream into a reality and take my music to an international field, which in addition, raises the name and talent of my country. The possibility of gathering the funds through a crowdfunding not only allows to manage the project but it also gives us the possibility to share it closely with everyone, with you.

There are two big pictures. If I didn’t make it to the goal, I equally compromise to give the perks to all those who support me, in addition to ensuring that the funds will be used to record independent singles and/or to cover a national tour.

If there is something sure about this whole thing, is that I won’t stop until I make it!

The other option and ideal big picture is that if we complete the amount, we will also record the videoclip of the first single of that first album, and this would only be possible with your participation and help.

Life with good music is a celebration, so I invite you to be a part of this party!

I thank you in advance, because with your interest in the project you will make art, music and the new industry grow besides from making a lot of people happy and being a part of the birth of an artist.

Liana Malva's Bugdet:
this money will be used as follows:
to finish Liana Malva's Debut Album:
$2.000 Musical Instruments
$1.000 Musical  Production
$2.000 Recording + Session Musicians
$3.000 Mixing and Mastering
$3.000 First videoclip
$3.000 Marketing/Promotional tour
$1.000 Photoshoot/Branding

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell everyone about the project!
  • Share on social networks: Twitter, Facebook and Instagram!

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
About the 'Oh My...' music video

Hello! My name is Michael Pickard. I have a musical project called Bodhi's Wish with my bandmate Sean Tetarian and we are making our first music video for the track titled "Oh My..." off our upcoming EP. My good friend and New York based artist Tim Ballard will be doing the animation.  He has done fantastic work which you can see below. His background includes working on documentaries and music videos.

A little bit about the animation story. The narrative follows a lonely wanderer who we meet lost in a wasteland. In his journey he discovers new worlds and is helped by mysterious beings to bring life back to the dead land with dreams. It is about rebirth and rediscovering wonder, seeing magic and beauty in the world despite everything. It is about imagination and hope and dreaming new things for ourselves.

Tim Ballard's animation reel: http://timballardcreations.com/ANIMATION-REEL-2016

Tim Ballard's website: http://timballardcreations.com/

Bodhi's Wish "Oh My" track: https://soundcloud.com/user1299745/oh-my

Michael Pickard's Website: http://www.michaelpickard.net

What we need and what you get

We are asking for $2,500.00 - the estimated minimum cost for the project.  As you all probably know, animation is a very time consuming endeavor. The funds will also be paying for materials, inks, paint, paper, pens, brushes, and time away from work to focus solely on the animation. This will allow Tim to put the time and energy into the animation that we want in order to fully realize the project's vision.
REWARDS
For all of you who donate $10.00, you will receive a digital download of the Bodhi's Wish track "Oh My". For anyone who wants to donate above and beyond, we have a list of premium rewards that you can see on the right hand side that include shirts from my t-shirt line called Twizland, Originally drawn personalized thank you cards from Tim, as well as your name in the credits and Producer credits. 
$25 Bodhi's Wish EP 'Lost and Found'


$85 8x10 Matted Print of Album cover artwork 


$100 TwizLand T-shirt 

$500 Original still from 'Oh My' animation 



The Impact

This project is really more than a music video. It's an animation, story and visual art project. I want to share this creation with as many people as possible. That is what inspires me - to share the art. It is also going to be a great way for us (Bodhi's Wish) to share the music with everyone and reach a wider audience. 

And simply put, by donating you are also supporting artists to make the work they love while also helping to put a roof over the ol' head.

Your donations really are going to be the forces that bring this bad boy to life, and I genuinely love this platform for that reason. You really are connected to it!

Risks & Challenges

If for any reason we don't reach our fundraising goal, I want to reassure you that we will still be making the music video and our artistic vision will not be compromised. Unfortunately, that would mean that the music video would take longer to produce and wouldn't come out simultaneously with the album, so it's important we get those funds! We only have two weeks to raise our goal amount, but I am confident that with hard work and sharing the music and campaign with as many people as possible, we will meet our fundraising goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts and no amount is too small. But if you can't donate and you still feel inspired to help support the project, please share the campaign! Sharing is one of the best ways to help. I know some can be hesitant to repost and see it as a nuisance at times, but if people connect with this project  and are inspired by it, they will want to support it. 

Thank you and can't wait to show you the finished music video!

story:
Classic amp design at an affordable price.

The JTM45 is a single-channel, all tube, amplifier head with no master volume control:

  • This project is being put together by Jet City Amplification (JCA).
  • We've been building an selling high-quality import amps at super reasonable prices for the past 7 years, in several countries around the world.
  • We are putting together this factory-direct group purchase to offer a high value project at the best possible price by eliminating all the overheads and layers which typically drive prices higher.

This is a simple group buy, not funding development.

  • We are not funding to realize the project - we're just trying to make it more efficient. We can deliver whether we sell just one or many. The goal is set at $10,000 as doing about a dozen amps minimum will justify the effort.
  • The base model will be very simple, hand-wired in China, and delivered to us here in Seattle for distribution to all the participants.
  • The alternate / upgraded amps will be sent to Mark Marshall of Rising Force Amplification in the Chicago area, modded by hand to your choice of specification, and then sent on to you.  Mark Marshall, aka Mark Sedlock, (Marshall was chosen as a stage name back in the 90's) has been building/modding tube amplifiers & effects pedals for over 25 years. His modded amplifiers and mod tutorials are in all U.S. states & over 30 countries. Mark and JCA began affiliation 2 years ago with the Brown Bear & the slightly darker Black Bear mods, and strive to give each individual customer service and satisfaction in their Jet City product.
  • Your purchase will include a 90 day warranty for parts and labor.


Risks & Challenges

The risk here is super low. The project is DONE and ready to ship within three weeks of our purchase. It's only a matter of how many we do, according to the participation here.

We've been working with various suppliers in China for many years. We've not purchased from this one yet, but, I've been there personally and seen their operation.

story:
Each year, X.ado (Dartmouth's Christian Acappella Group) goes on a 10 day tour to a major city in the country, and this year we're going to.... SEATTLE! We're so excited to spread the love of Christ in this beautiful, New Age, and much loved city!

This is where you come in. Because Seattle is so much farther than our usual tour destinations, travel expenses are pretty high for our members. We have a great line-up of shows at homeless shelters, low-income schools, streets, churches, a prison, and other venues in the city, but since we perform for the joy of others around us and don't charge, we rely on the generosity of the greater X.ado family (that's you!) for support. Anything you have to offer would be greatly appreciated, whether it's a couple of dollars, a larger donation, or prayers. Absolutely all funds will go directly towards subsidizing our travel and food expenses.

Thank you so much for visiting our campaign page, and feel free to reach out to us at xado@dartmouth.edu or check our our Facebook & YouTube for more information (links provided below). Lastly, we would be truly honored if you could pray for the safety and success of our mission in Seattle.

Thank you so much, and have a blessed Fall and Holiday Season!

X.love,

X.ado

story:
Short Summary

    I'm Rachael Warfield, and I'm a singer- songwriter/pianist from Jacksonville, Fl. I was recently selected out of thousands of artists, to perform at 2016's Canadian Music Week, the largest festival and showcasing event in Canada, with over 3,000 different music industry executives and talent scouts from over 40 different countries. This is an incredible opportunity to network and create partnerships with dynamic music industry leaders, and if I can get my band and I to Canada, we will be able to meet these industry leaders and work to create dynamic partnerships.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $15,000 to send my band and I to Canada for the 7 day festival and showcasing event. In return, every contributor will be given free copies of two of my singles from my upcoming Debut Album, as well as online access to the band and I's live streaming performance in Canada.   Even if we don't reach our entire goal, all of the funds will still go towards the goal of getting us to Canada.

The Impact

This showcasing event could lead to the opportunity of landing a deal with an international booking agent, allowing my band and I to tour all over the world. This could also lead to several sponsorships, endorsements, and even a distribution deal or potential record deal.

Risks & Challenges

Because we are a five piece band, we will be flying and needing several hotel rooms for our seven day stay in Toronto, Canada.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you could please promote and share this campaign with your family and friends, my band and I would greatly appreciate it :)

story:
Why A Song A Day matters

No robot will ever be able to replace the music-obsessed friend saying “hey, I think you’ll really dig this track.” With the rise of so many music discovery resources, tools, and platforms, real, genuine and personalized music recommendations are hard to come by. 

Even as a music lover, you're too busy to sort through all of the resources available today -- the sheer volume of options can be overwhelming. Algorithms are great, but they can get repetitive and rarely help you discover emerging or lesser-known artists. 

We’re your music-obsessed friend sharing great songs and nerding out about music for you! We’re here to help you discover artists who will never get radio play or be featured on the front page of Spotify. We’re here to broaden your horizons and make you smile.

Meet our music-obsessed curators

We’re 44 (and growing) passionate music lovers spread across the globe. We’re artists, musicians, entrepreneurs, techsters, marketers, students, moms, dads and writers. The one thing we share in common is our love for music and passion for finding incredible artists and sharing them with others. We’ve been doing this for the majority of our lives and are beyond excited to have a captive audience. 

With more than 440 people who have asked to be a curator, we're anxious to grow and scale this community to be something even more truly special than it already is.

Here’s a glimpse at who our curators are today:

How you can keep A Song A Day alive: why we need you

We're currently sending: 

To send these, our current process is insanely manual:

  • A listener signs up; we listen to their favorite bands and learn about their interests
  • They're matched with a curator who listens to their preferences and selects songs
  • The curator inputs links, song data, and notes into Google sheets
  • Each email campaign is manually updated and scheduled 
  • Listeners respond to the email with feedback, which is forwarded to their curator who reflect changes in their selections or reply to have a conversation about it
  • Not into your picks? Totally cool, we work with you to find a curator who’s a better fit

The emails sent look something like this: 

The future of A Song A Day

We're stoked to connect people over music, and we want to bring personalized music recommendations to everyone looking for a simple solution for discovering great music. However, we need to improve our process in order to grow our community of curators and listeners, and to deliver more personalized song picks. We need your help to make it happen.

Improvements to be made

We're asking for your support to help fund the development of a technical product that will allow us to offer a better musical experience by streamlining the song --> email --> listener --> feedback process. It will also allow us to add some of the basic but important features our listeners have been asking for, such as:

In the future: we’d like to add:

  • Choose your delivery time
  • A native player
  • Our own themed playlists
  • Special guest / influencer curators
  • Premium content
  • And so, so much more. 

**No matter how technological we get, all songs will always be hand-picked - and for now, every member will also be hand-matched to a curator.**

Your support will also help cover some of the overhead costs for running the project, including Mailchimp, hosting, databases, legal costs, etc. And the rewards of course. :) 

Without the funding, we’ll likely have to scale back until we find another solution. In the long run, I’d love to find a technical partner who wants to build and grow A Song A Day with me. If you know of anyone who would be interested, holler at me!

How to get involved

Sign up to receive your personalized, hand-picked songs or apply to become a curator. 

How it all started

People have always asked me how I discover new music and I've happily given away my secrets, until one day I realized that few people were willing to make music discovery a routine like I had. They just wanted to know what they should listen to. With that, I decided to send my friends a song a day. 

After buying the URL, creating a simple Squarespace, sending it to a few friends, and sleeping for a few hours, I tweeted it. Three hours later, it was trending on ProductHunt with 500 subscribers.

It turns out that my friends aren’t the only ones who want and need new music. With a ton of community support, the kindness of strangers, and unexpected Product Hunt success, it grew into a real and engaged community.

What listeners are saying

Thank you!!

Thank you so much for your support. This project represents everything I am passionate about and has been one of the best things to happen to me personally and professionally. I hope that it can continue to be successful so we can share the joy of music with the world! :)

Risks and challenges

We may experience a high-volume of sign ups that will cause us to reinstate a waitlist as we build the product that will do away with the waitlist for good.

With building any technical product, setbacks happen. Although we hope for smooth sailing, sometimes glitches are out of our control. We'll be sure to communicate the build-out of the product as it progresses!

story:
The Clark Atlanta University Alumni Association (CAUAA) Chicagoland Chapter is on a mission. We would love to bring the CAU Philharmonic Society to perform in Chicago, but we need your help. We need to fund the student’s trip if they are to come to perform in our illustrious city. The total cost to make this happen is $5000. This includes their travel by bus, hotel stay and one meal each.

Please help us fund their performance by donating at any level. You won’t regret it. Their performance will be outstanding and guaranteed to feed your spirit. BTW, Your donations are 100% tax deductible!

story:
About On Vinyl Music

On Vinyl Music is a music and art collective that operates as an online magazine and facilitates live events in efforts to unify the global and local music community while sustaining a culture of divergence. 

Our Magazine

Our online magazine offers the latest in local Austin music news and events including:
  •  features on live music and comedy performances and venue happenings
  •  exclusive interviews with local artists
  •  curated staff playlists
  •  album reviews and recommendations
  •  consistent and fresh material with content posted at least once daily.

                       

Our Events

Along with our up-to date content, On Vinyl Music also hosts live events to showcase talented local artists. On Vinyl has hosted three incredibly successful events that include our On Vinyl Boat Party, DJ Expo, and Electoral College Party.  Each event:
  •  featured prominent local artists such as Interrobang, Charles Mxxn, Payton Long, Sons of Santos, and The Real Hands
  •  drew crowds of 300-400 people
  •  raised substantial revenue for the participating venues

            

Our Collective

On Vinyl Music also maintains an artist collective in order to provide local Austin musicians with an outlet for expression and promotion. On Vinyl supports these local artists through:
  •  promotion and media coverage through our site as well as affiliated social media sites
  • networking and booking opportunities
  • assistance in artists' content creation. 

Current Presence

On Vinyl Music already has a prominent online presence across our various social media outlets including our site, Facebook, and Twitter. 
Facebook: Organic Post reach is approximately 2,000 people per week with highest reach levels between 4,000-5,000 people
Twitter: 690 organic impressions per day with 19,000 total organic impressions monthly, 606 followers
Our Site: 5,300 page views per month with site visits being 64.5% new users to the site

Future Goals

Our ultimate end-goal for On Vinyl music include expansion to cities throughout the United States. This expansion will start in other Texas cities like Denton and Houston and eventually to out of state cities such as Los Angeles or Chicago to shed light on local music across the nation.

What We Need & What You Get

We are separating our crowdfunding campaign into three phases:

  • Phase 1: $5,220 - Events
  • Phase 2: $13,500 - A/V Equipment
  • Phase 3: $5,650 - Writer's Salaries

For Phase 1, we're seeking funding of $5,220 which will be used to cover expenses and overhead for our events and cover items such as:

  • rental of backline or necessary A/V equipment
  • compensation for our performing artists
  • event supplies
  • events promotions and marketing overhead

  • 10% of our proceeds will be donated to AustinMusicPeople (AMP)              

 Austin Music People is focused on making  the economic development of the Austin live music industry a priority for political, civic, and cultural leaders, and to connecting and empowering Austin’s live music community by providing powerful advocacy tools, participating in policy development, and representing live music interests in public and private forums. These objectives are fulfilled through advocacy directed towards development initiatives, civic engagement of music industry and community stakeholders, and industry research.

In exchange for contributions made, On Vinyl Music is offering exciting perks such as one of  kind promotional merchandise, features on our webpage, passes to our annual boat party, and passes to Fun Fun Fun Fest and ACL Music Festival.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute at this time, you can still help On Vinyl Music by sharing our campaign with others who might be interested in donating!

story:
Hi! We are Zeytin, a Reggae/Rock band from Istanbul, Turkey. Zeytin means olive in Turkish. Since we got together in 2014, we’ve been  looking to spread positive vibes wherever we go. We're hoping to make our debut album with YOUR help! We have recorded 2 songs last summer and this is what we sound like:

https://soundcloud.com/zeytinmusic/sabir
https://soundcloud.com/zeytinmusic/nerdeyim

 

 

We have many more songs  ready and lined up for when we’ll be back in the studio; with your support we will be able to record and release our debut album and share it in different formats across the universe and maybe even produce our first animated video clip!

 

 

So please, make our day (and album!) by having a pick between the nice little presents we have prepared for you ! =)

If you can’t back the project, but still would like to share the love, helping us in promoting the project online would be hugely appreciated. <3

Many thanks and love to all!

 

-------

 

Selam dünyalı, biz Zeytin! 2014 yılında Istanbul'da kurulan bir Reggae/Rock grubuyuz. Müzik yapmaktaki amacımız, gittiğimiz her yere poizitif dalgalar yaymak. Senin de desteğinle ilk albümümüzü hayata geçirmek istiyoruz. Geçen yaz iki şarkı kaydettik ve ortaya çıkan sonuç bu oldu:

https://soundcloud.com/zeytinmusic/sabir
https://soundcloud.com/zeytinmusic/nerdeyim

 

 

Bu geçen sürede hazırladığımız yeni şarkılar ile birlikte ilk albümümüzü kaydedip evrenin her köşesine farklı formatlarda yaymak istiyoruz, sonrasında da ilk animasyon klibimiz için kolları sıvamayı hedefliyoruz.

 

 

Sen de günümüzü (ve albümümüzü!) güzelleştirmek istersen, senin için hazırladığımız sürprizlerden bir tane seçebilirsin. Kendine uygun bir sürpriz bulamayıp, yine de" çorbada benim de tuzum bulunsun" dersen, bu sayfayı sosyal medyada paylaşabilirsin, çok seviniriz. 

Çok teşekkürler ve sevgiler!

story:
Short Summary

Hey Fans,

G.O.A.T. here! By the way, that's short for "The God of all Texas". You see, me and your M.O.M. ("Masters of Menace") are quite ready to become the next group of guys you don't want to take home to.....uh....your Mom!

After putting out a video on Youtube that went wildly viral, (4 million + views) we were featured on Tosh.O (Season 5 Ep. 502) on Comedy Central. Since then, we've had requests to play in far away places and I've come up with some really bitchin' ideas for merchandising to sell when we take this dirty show on the road!

The campaign is going for 60 days, so give Pervert Jesus as much money as you can so we can spread the filth. We are not a signed band so all of our funding for merchandise, touring and even instruments, we hope, will come from our thousands of fans!

There are BIG things in the works here. I just got back from Pennsylvania last weekend. I did a solo show for some fans and they expressed to me that they'd love to have the whole band come back next year. We don't want to disappoint so we are going to book a tour and kick it off in Austin during SXSW!

There are a "buttload" of things that need to get done to get it all together. First off is getting my likeness made into a Bobblehead doll! (With a Bobblecock too!) We need to get some music recorded also to sell to all the awe-struck people we perform for who might just want to take the G.O.A.T. along in the car or put me on the iPod. Plus, stickers, Glow in the dark crabs (The pubic kind) and semen samples too. Well, maybe.


We're asking for at least $5000 to get the Merchandising and the tour funded.  (We'll take more thought if that happens!) The Bobblehead investment alone could exceed $2000. We'd like to have all the other stuff done as well. The donations will also go to your basic road show merchandise like stickers, T-shirts and other G.OA.T. and your M.O.M. nick knacks.


We'll offer some great incentives to donate. 

  • $15 will get you an autographed copy of G.OA.T. and your M.O.M.'s live album.
  • $25 donation will get you a pre-sale reservation of the Bobblehead Doll! they're going to go fast, thats for sure.
  • $30 Gets you an official G.O.A.T. and your M.O.M. DP T shirt.
  • $100 gets you all three of the above offered items.
  • $200 gets you V.I.P. all access passes (you +1) to any G.O.A.T. and you M.O.M. show to be used one time when ever you wish.
  • $1000 Gets you the band coming to your town for a show anywhere in the continental U.S.
  • $2000 Gets you the band playing live in your town anywhere in Canada or Mexico.
  • $4000 will get the band playing in your town anywhere in Europe.
  • $5000 will get the band anywhere in the world except for Australia.
  • $7000 What the hell, we'll play Australia.
    •  
 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, butt, that doesn't mean they can't help:

 
  • We're always looking for street teams in cities that we are coming through. Time is money so feel free to donate some time if you want to help and can't give us money.
  • Watch the videos on the G.O.A.T. and your M.O.M. Youtube channel as much as you can handle because we'll get paid through their advertising program if the videos get a lot of views.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
New Zealand born, Nashville based.

We are Tattletale Saints: Cy Winstanley on guitar/vocals and Vanessa McGowan on bass/vocals. 

In January 2014 we won the New Zealand Music Award for Folk Album of the Year for our debut album How Red Is the Blood, and have been living and touring out of Nashville Tennessee since March 2014.

Nashville is an inspiring place to live and the last year and a half have seen an evolution of the band from acoustic duo into electric trio with drums, electric guitar and upright bass. We are incredibly excited to get into the studio in November and release these new songs, and we'd love you to be involved in making that happen.


The Plan

We have a swag of new songs we're really proud of and have created a team of wonderful, talented people to help us make this album. 

The primary people involved in the creative process will be Josh Kaler, who is producing and engineering the album, and Zoltan Tobak who is playing drums.

A strong friendship with Josh was solidified over many a late night beer, and working together on this album is something we're very excited about. Cy first met Josh on a co-bill tour playing guitar for Nashville singer Andrew Combs while Josh was playing guitar for Amanda Shires. Vanessa's first gig with Josh was filling in with his Hawaiian band at a pool party, the perfect introduction to this talented and super creative musical nutter. 

We met Zoltan Tobak through our individual work in Nashville playing with other bands, and the first time we jammed with him in Tattletale Saints we knew we'd stumbled upon something great. His musical instincts are so in line with what we've been hearing for these new songs and his drumming is having a big influence on the new sound of the band. We're very happy to have him on board for this album.

Budget 

Recording/mixing/mastering/sideman fees $8000

Additional studio costs (Bomb Shelter drum tracking) $1000

Publicity $3000

Pressing USA $1500

Pressing NZ $1500

Album art/design $1000

Album release content (videos) $1500

Merch/perks $1500

$1000 Indiegogo fees

Other Ways You Can Help

We sincerely appreciate your help with this project, whether you can afford to become a Gold Supporter or if you're just able to help us by spreading awareness of the campaign to your family and friends.

You're our team and we sincerely appreciate you all!
story_txt:
New Zealand born, Nashville based. We are Tattletale Saints: Cy Winstanley on guitar/vocals and Vanessa McGowan on bass/vocals. 
In January 2014 we won the New Zealand Music Award for Folk Album of the Year for our debut album How Red Is the Blood, and have been living and touring out of Nashville Tennessee since March 2014.
Nashville is an inspiring place to live and the last year and a half have seen an evolution of the band from acoustic duo into electric trio with drums, electric guitar and upright bass. We are incredibly excited to get into the studio in November and release these new songs, and we'd love you to be involved in making that happen.


   The Plan We have a swag of new songs we're really proud of and have created a team of wonderful, talented people to help us make this album. 
The primary people involved in the creative process will be Josh Kaler, who is producing and engineering the album, and Zoltan Tobak who is playing drums.
A strong friendship with Josh was solidified over many a late night beer, and working together on this album is something we're very excited about. Cy first met Josh on a co-bill tour playing guitar for Nashville singer Andrew Combs while Josh was playing guitar for Amanda Shires. Vanessa's first gig with Josh was filling in with his Hawaiian band at a pool party, the perfect introduction to this talented and super creative musical nutter. 
We met Zoltan Tobak through our individual work in Nashville playing with other bands, and the first time we jammed with him in Tattletale Saints we knew we'd stumbled upon something great. His musical instincts are so in line with what we've been hearing for these new songs and his drumming is having a big influence on the new sound of the band. We're very happy to have him on board for this album.
    
Budget 

 Recording/mixing/mastering/sideman fees $8000
Additional studio costs (Bomb Shelter drum tracking) $1000
Publicity $3000
Pressing USA $1500
Pressing NZ $1500
Album art/design $1000
Album release content (videos) $1500
Merch/perks $1500
$1000 Indiegogo fees
    Other Ways You Can Help We sincerely appreciate your help with this project, whether you can afford to become a Gold Supporter or if you're just able to help us by spreading awareness of the campaign to your family and friends.
You're our team and we sincerely appreciate you all!

story:
We call ourselves Ainesis Latreia. We love Christian songs yet nowadays good ones like old hymns are getting rare. We are creating new hymns so that we can learn the bible by heart and sing new songs of praise and worship.

Our first album will be launched from May 2016 to December 2016. The album contains eight songs and each month one song will be uploaded to the website. Everyone can download them for free.  All of the songs are direct quotation of the TNIV Bible.

To maintain the website, to compose/arrange and to record/mix/master/duplicate the songs, funds are required. That's why we need you to support us.

Why will this project be important to us? We are promoting praise and worship through free new beautiful songs with direct Bible quotation. Music has been an integral part of the praise and worship since thousands of years ago. May the songs will not just be the media to deliver praise to our God but also to grow our faith so that we will be able to do things by His Law and worship Him with our life. This project will affect my life, may be yours and may be so many others. May this be a good offering to our dear Lord.

Do you have the calling to make new Praise and Worship songs free?

To find out more, you can  visit us at www.ainesis-latreia.com or contact us at ainesis.latreia@gmail.com.

story:
Hello dear fans.  HEAD launched our full length "concept" album on Feb 20th and we would love your support.  We are a rock band from Vancouver Canada.  We are a 5 piece band that includes; Lyric- vocals, Stone - keys, oD - guitar, The Phantom - bass and Styxx - drums. 


We recorded an EP last year which stirred up interest... definitely got us noticed.  We had some great reviews on the 1st 6 songs.  Last July, we went back into The Warehouse and recorded the rest of the album. Everything fell into place, the writing, the arrangements, the production, everything came together to create a musical journey called "Afraid to Sleep".


"Afraid to Sleep" is a concept album about a woman named Alberta. There are 17 tracks on this album that will take the listener on a myriad of dark emotions through her life.  Here's a sneak preview on what the story line will be.


You could’ve been her. The nightmares that are some people’s lives are only a small twist of fate away from our own. You could’ve been her; maybe if you’d turned left instead of right. If you’d accepted that ride from someone a few years back. If you’d taken that offer... slept overnight... walked home... instead of the path you did choose...You could’ve been her... she could’ve been you…


You may know (if you have other friends that are artists), how hard it is to raise funds for a project like this as an indie artist.

To give you a little insight on the band ...


HEAD was borne of the twisted psyches of misfits and outcasts. Our collective histories hint at the slightly skewed nature of the music.


HEAD is dark, but highly-charged. HEAD is controversial and edgy. HEAD is a Vancouver band and it's what might happen if you mixed a little Tea Party with Garbage and Nine Inch Nails. Coquettish vocals; electro-slash guitars; mood altering keyboards; intoxicating rhythms laced with dark, erotic lyrics.
HEAD is rock. A little industrial, sexually moody, heavy, but melodic. 
You can listen to our EP at www.headmusic.ca/listen

www.headmusic.ca

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $7,500.00

We really appreciate your support. Your contribution will go towards paying our recording costs, mastering, manufacturing and promotion for the album.  There are many more costs to follow but this will give us a good start on paying for the project.

We have come up with some fun perks ... 

  • 20.00 you get a signed cd and postcard.

  • 40.00 you get all of the above PLUS a HEAD tee shirt and a shout out on our social media

  • 50.00 you get all of the above PLUS a signed photo.

  • 100.00 you get all of the above PLUS 2 tickets to our CD release party Feb 20th at the Anza Club in Vancouver.

  • 200.00 you get all of the above PLUS - back stage all access with pre-show access.

  • 500.00 you get all of the above PLUS - lifetime VIP pass for all concerts and you get to be in the next HEAD video.

  • 750.00 you get all of the above PLUS - you get a song written by HEAD for you - the story of your life. You'll get to sit down with Lyric and tell your story and she will write the lyrics and the band will put the song together.

  • 1,000.00 you get all the above PLUS - you get to come to our next recording session and hang with us, plus you get a one on one songwriting lesson with Lyric.

Risks & Challenges
It's funny they have this subtitle here...risks and challenges.  Life is all about that isn't it.  We do this because we love it.  We love HEAD. People are taking notice of HEAD and liking what they hear.  We can't stop writing, it keeps pouring out.  So here we are and here you are and thank you for coming along this journey with us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight and if you can't support with funds, we would love if you can join our street team and help promote us.  Share this page.  Share our social media pages.  Help spread the word.  Come out to shows and support live music.  Here are our links to help share. 
http://www.headmusic.ca
https://www.facebook.com/The.band.HEAD
https://twitter.com/headmusic_band
http://www.reverbnation.com/head_music
https://soundcloud.com/head_music
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgjf7z0WiitWF-...

story:
Promo video EPK
On the new Album "A Big Funky Family" NAPALMA connected artists and producers from different parts of the world creating a big melting pot of new influences, new sounds and spices.
 

NAPALMA is a electronic and percussive music group that have performed over eight hundred concerts in seventeen countries.  NAPALMA started in 2004 in Vitória, Brazil blending brazilian musicians and a mozambican singer. The international career kicked off in 2005 and has never stoped,

No novo album "A Big Funky Family" o NAPALMA conectou artistas e produtores de diferentes partes do mundo criando um caldeirão de influências, sons e temperos.

NAPALMA é um grupo de música eletronica + percussão que já apresentou em mais de 800 concertos em dezessete países. NAPALMA começou em 2004 em Vitória, Brasil misturando músicos brasileiros com um vocalista moçambicano. A carreira internacional foi impulsionada em 2005, não parando mais.


Napalma at Montreux Jazz Festival - Switzerland - Suiça

NAPALMA is asking for your IMPORTANT support to launch this project, then we will keep on working for the next year and a half touring, promoting, launching singles and videos.

With your support NAPALMA can cover the costs with production:

Recordings and Productions have been done in many countries and different studios. 
CD printing (6 panel Digipack . 139,5mm x 125,5mm x 7,5mm)
Promoting (Posters for Album / Tour).

O NAPALMA está pedindo sua IMPORTANTE ajuda para lançar o novo album e nós seguiremos trabalhando por um ano e meio fazendo Tours, promoções, lançando singles, remixes, videos.

Com o seu apoio o NAPALMA pode cobrir os custos com produção: 

As gravações e produções foram feitas em diferentes estúdios e países. 
Duplicação do CD (Digipack . 139,5mm x 125,5mm x 7,5mm)
Promoção (Posters para o Album / Tour).



Videoclip "Onde há Light"

The Impact - O Impacto

NAPALMA is bringing a multicultural and original album with a big list of collaborations from different countries. We expect to reach  a wide market for promotion and tours.

Music Collaborations creates much more than songs, it can raise a potential expansion and new exposure for all parts involved, with each artist "introducing" the other artist to its world.

NAPALMA está trazendo um album original e multicultural com uma grande lista de colaborações de diferentes países. Esperamos atingir um mercado extenso para promoções e turnês.

Colaborações musicais geram mais do que canções, criando uma potencial expansão e alcance para todas as partes envolvidas, com cada artista apresentando o outro para seu universo.


NAPALMA at Antilliaansefesteen - Belgium
 

Other Ways You Can Help - Outras formas de Ajudar

If you’re not able to help us by making a financial contribution, we
completely understand and we still love you!
Help us by sharing this campaign on Facebook or Twitter, by sending it
through email to your contacts or by telling your friends about it -
it helps more than you could imagine. Spread the word:

-Use the indie-gogo 'share' tools above for your Facebook and Twitter.
-Like and share our Facebook Page: NAPALMA music
-Visit our Youtube Chanel: NAPALMA TUBE
-Follow us on Twitter: NAPALMA_music
-Check our sound on Soundcloud: NAPALMA_music
-Look at our website: www.napalma.com.br
-Support us live

Se voce não é capaz de nos ajudar fazendo uma contribuição financeira nós entendemos completamente e ainda te amamos!
Ajudes nos compartilhando essa campanha no Facebook ou Twitter, enviando por email para seus contatos ou falando aos seus amigos - vai ajudar muito mais do que voce pode imaginar:

-Use as ferramentas para "compartilhar" acima que o indie-gogo oferece para Facebook and Twitter.
-Curta e compartilhe a campanha no Facebook: NAPALMA music
-Visite nosso canal de videos no Youtube: NAPALMA TUBE
-Siga nos no Twitter: NAPALMA_music
-Ouça no Soundcloud: NAPALMA_music
-Conheça o website: www.napalma.com.br
-Nos apoie ao Vivo.

OBRIGADO - MERCI - MUCHAS GRACIAS - DANKE - SHOKRAN - THANKS!!!

story:
The Story

People have been telling me for ages that I needed to record an album. Songwriting has been such a journey for me - it took a while, but this year I was able to craft some songs that I'm very proud of! Happily, the stars aligned and I, along with some of my closest friends, recorded those songs on Nov. 13th!

Now, all that is left is the post-production phase of this project. What does that entail? Glad you asked! Here's the rest of the process, in step by step detail:

1. Pay for studio time in order to overdub our flubs - There aren't that many mistakes, but no one is perfect. It was a live recording and there are a few spots that need to be fixed.
2.  Pay for graphic design work - I've already contracted with an amazing designer who is at this moment perfecting some amazing album art. I can't wait for you all to see it!
3. Pay for licensing and CD production! This is a super exciting one because once we get to number 3, we are SO CLOSE to having the final product in our hands.

See! It's really not that far from complete. I decided (with some help from my friends) that the best way to go about raising the rest of the money needed is to start selling pre-orders! So that's what this page is for.

What I Need & What You Get in Return

Here's the long and short of it: making an album is expensive!! In order to finish this album, I need your support. But, don't despair!! You will get some amazing perks in return for your financial sponsorship.

  • The entire amount needed to finish out this project is $3,500. That's not very much! Together, we can do it!
  • My perks are so fun: a private, online lesson with me (either voice or piano), signed CD's, other cool swag... I'm very excited to share these amazing incentives with you!!
  • If my total goal isn't met, EVERY.SINGLE.CENT that comes in during this campaign will still go towards finishing this project. I will do as much as I can - even if it means ordering fewer CD's in my initial order. I will still make everything available to you in the form of digital downloads. I'm committed to getting this thing FINISHED!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially right now, you can still help get the word out! Here are a few ways you can do that:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this Indiegogo page!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Tell your family and friends to check out my page!
  • Don't forget to PRAY FOR US!!! Keep us covered - this process is a "long-haul" type of thing.

story:
The What

I am raising scholarship money for women to attend an extended weekend retreat: Making Peace with Your Inner Critic, July 8-11, 2016.

I have a critical voice inside my head that can sometimes be a real beast. It's been there for as long as I can remember and was probably a coping mechanism I developed growing up in my family's particular brand of dysfunction. 

Most women I know struggle with the same critical voice. The critical voice of Not Enough. Not thin enough, pretty enough, smart enough, successful enough, etc. I don’t know anyone who hasn’t struggled with the harsh voice of the inner critic.

The thing is, many women do not have the financial means to attend the weekend, but would really benefit from it. In 2014 I was able to raise more than $1,700 of scholarship money on Indiegogo with your help. Because many of you contributed in both large and small ways, several women were able to attend that 2014 weekend who would not have been able to if not for your support. It was a tremendous, healing gift to them. Here is just one woman’s account of the difference you can make in a person’s life:

"The weekend had a profound influence on my life in two ways. First it gave me clarity, by quelling the fears and becoming aware of my unhealthy belief systems, I came to understand, know, and BELIEVE IN what I needed to do for myself. Second, it gave me the tools and strategy with which to take critical tangible steps towards embracing the bountiful and joyous life that my 2 young children and I deserve, NOW - not later! And lastly, truthfully, I could not have done it without scholarship money provided by some anonymous donor, to whom I am eternally grateful."

There are so many women out there who struggle with the harsh voice of the inner critic. It robs them of their joy and a life filled with passion and vitality. This retreat begins the process of healing that wound. 

This weekend retreat creates a safe place for women to bring ALL of who they are, the beautiful and the not-beautiful aspects of self. Here women will explore, discover, connect, create, and heal. Together. 

During this healing retreat, women:

  • Gain insight around what to do with the demons of comparison, scarcity, and shame, and why not caring what other people think is its own kind of hustle.

  • Understand why stronger armor is not the answer and how "armoring-up" can actually get in the way of what you want.

  • Learn concrete actions/behaviors that you can practice for continued positive results.

  • Explore what it means to show up and be seen.

  • Become the person who believes in herself and shows up for herself with courage and compassion.

Retreat website link: http://www.sagesoulsisters.com/#!2016-retreat/zd8o8

What Participants Say:

"My time spent in retreat contributed in a meaningful way to my ongoing personal growth and transformation.Since attending the retreat, I have strengthened my voice as a powerful female artist, creating work that pursues social justice and equity for marginalized individuals.As a woman who constantly cares for the needs of others, it was critical that I take the time to care for myself, and the Sage Soul Sisters Retreat was exactly what I needed to recharge and grow." ~A. Marten

"I am very grateful for the opportunity provided to experience some ground-breaking healing.  I feel like my life is moving forward in a very positive way, and it's the peace I feel that urges me forward." L. Whidby

"The retreat really offered an opportunity to be seen and heard with no judgment amongst beautiful and empowering souls, all of whom were seeking to manifest and create a deepened understanding of self and their relationships. I left feeling rejuvenated and really appreciative of the experience all round." G. Polak

"I was able to express a rare and heartfelt playfulness!  I also experienced the joy of finally accepting and loving my physical body." L. Greiss

What We Need & What You Get

I have kept the prices as low as I possibly can to make this retreat available for more women. Even so, there are many women who really need this, but do not have the financial means to participate. I truly believe in this kind of exploration, connection,  and sharing. I believe in it passionately, because I have seen the healing and profound change it can make in a woman's life. 

In 2014, I raised just over $1,700 with Indiegogo for another women's retreat called Women's Body Wisdom; Honoring Our Bodies as an Exquisite Resource. It was an extraordinary weekend. This year I am asking for the same. I believe with your help, we can reach that goal again.

Money raised will be divided into scholarships for women in need. Your contributions help with registration cost and travel expenses. For many, this can be a life-changing experience. Please show your support with a financial contribution to help us reach our goal. Any and all contributions are appreciated and help us move closer to our goal. Please share on your social media pages so we can get the word out there.

You can make a significant difference in a woman’s life.

Please check out our donation perks!

______________________________________________________________________

Cost Breakdown Comparison

To give you an idea of what a weekend getaway costs in this area, I did a little online research on cost of accommodations, meals, and creative workshops costs and fees. I wanted to compare what it would cost if you took a weekend getaway on your own and combined it with the individual workshops. The breakdown is below:

I took the cost of 10 different hotels in Asheville, NC and got an average rate of approximately $85 per night for a hotel X 3 nights = $255

Restaurants ranging from $-$$

$ Restaurant:    Breakfast about $15 includes tip

                        Lunch (same as breakfast)

$$ Restaurant:  Dinner $35 includes tip

3 dinners = $105, 3 breakfast = $45, 2 lunch = $45 = $195 total meals

Art workshop average workshop fee $99 + materials fee $25 = $124

Exploration and self-discovery workshop fee (7 sessions) $200 + $25 materials fee = $225

So here is what that came to:

$225 accommodations (3 nights)

$195 (8 meals)

$124 Art workshop (2 ½ hour session)

$225 Primary workshop (7 sessions)

______________________________________

$769 Total for a comparable weekend in the Asheville, NC area.

$610 for the entire weekend (all-inclusive) Making Peace with Your Inner Critic 

The Venue 

The retreat will be held at Bend of Ivy Lodge just outside of Asheville, NC. Bend of ivy is a beautiful, tranquil place where a woman can have solitude and time to tend to herself. Unlike large conference centers, Bend of Ivy is cocooned on private property in the Blue Ridge Mountains. There are 63 acres to explore of trails, rivers, ponds, a labyrinth, and zen-like sitting areas. All meals, accommodations, art materials and workshop supplies are included in the registration price. Check out more at www.bendofivylodge.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on your social media pages!
  • Tell you co-workers.
  • Send out an e-mail blast.
  • Talk it up in person.


Who Am I?

That's me. I love this pic. People often comment on it. What most don't know is that this pic was taken the day my mom died. I was in Miami with my four sisters and my brother. We had gathered to send her off. She had leukemia, and we knew this was the final goodbye for all of us. In the photograph my face holds all the joy of a life celebrated and grief for the woman I will always miss. I share this because my mother is a big reason I do women's soul work. In a way, this work is my tribute to her and her crazy, unabashed, creative self. She had a brutal inner critic, and I mean brutal. I don't think that even on her death bed she had any idea of her own worth and value. She had her faults, no argument. But she was also creative, fun-loving, rebellious, wildly expressive, a passionate rule-breaker, a feminist, and a big dog lover. She loved people, too. All kinds.  
Inspired by the women who have gone before me, including my banner carrying (literally) feminist mother and aunt, I design and facilitate creative workshops, retreats, and ritual celebrations for women. I, like my mother before me, have struggled with knowing my own worth and value, with knowing how to respond to myself with compassion and tenderness. It grieves me that so many women wrestle with this same thing. My goal is to love myself fiercely, and to inspire other women to do the same. It is my mission to create an emotionally safe space for women to bring all of who they are, both the beautiful and the not-beautiful aspects of self. In this safe space, a woman can reconnect with her body as an exquisite resource rather than a source of shame. Our body houses our instinct and intuition, our voice, our true north. 

It is a vision of mine to have a healing retreat center where I can combine my passion for women's soul work with creative expression. At present, I teach elementary art in the public school system and I live with my soulmate and husband, Michael Harper, and our two dogs.

Please visit my website www.sagesoulsisters.com
story_txt:
The What 

I am raising scholarship money for women to attend an extended weekend retreat: Making Peace with Your Inner Critic, July 8-11, 2016.
I have a critical voice inside my head that
can sometimes be a real beast. It's been there for as long as I can remember
and was probably a coping mechanism I developed growing up in my family's
particular brand of dysfunction. 
Most women I know struggle with the same
critical voice. The critical voice of Not Enough. Not thin enough, pretty enough, smart enough, successful enough, etc. I
don’t know anyone who hasn’t struggled with the harsh voice of the inner
critic.


The thing is, many women do not have the financial means to
attend the weekend, but would really benefit from it. In 2014 I was able to
raise more than $1,700 of scholarship money on Indiegogo with your help. Because
many of you contributed in both large and small ways, several women were able
to attend that 2014 weekend who would not have been able to if not for your
support. It was a tremendous, healing gift to them. Here is just one woman’s
account of the difference you can make in a person’s life:
"The
weekend had a profound influence on my life in two ways. First it gave me
clarity, by quelling the fears and becoming aware of my unhealthy belief
systems, I came to understand, know, and BELIEVE IN what I needed to do for
myself. Second, it gave me the tools and strategy with which to take critical
tangible steps towards embracing the bountiful and joyous life that my 2 young
children and I deserve, NOW - not later! And lastly, truthfully, I could not
have done it without scholarship money provided by some anonymous donor, to
whom I am eternally grateful."
There are so many women out
there who struggle with the harsh voice of the inner critic. It robs them of
their joy and a life filled with passion and vitality. This retreat begins the
process of healing that wound. 
This weekend retreat creates a safe place for women to bring ALL of who
they are, the beautiful and the not-beautiful aspects of self. Here women will
explore, discover, connect, create, and heal. Together. 

During this healing retreat, women:
Gain insight around what to do with the demons of comparison, scarcity, and shame, and why not caring what other people think is its own kind of hustle.
Understand why stronger armor is not the answer and how "armoring-up" can actually get in the way of what you want.
Learn concrete actions/behaviors that you can practice for continued positive results.
Explore what it means to show up and be seen.
Become the person who believes in herself and shows up for herself with courage and compassion.
Retreat website link: http://www.sagesoulsisters.com/#!2016-retreat/zd8o8

What Participants Say:
"My time spent in retreat contributed in a meaningful way to my ongoing personal growth and transformation.Since attending the retreat, I have strengthened my voice as a powerful female artist, creating work that pursues social justice and equity for marginalized individuals.As a woman who constantly cares for the needs of others, it was critical that I take the time to care for myself, and the Sage Soul Sisters Retreat was exactly what I needed to recharge and grow." ~A. Marten
"I am very grateful for the opportunity provided to experience some ground-breaking healing.  I feel like my life is moving forward in a very positive way, and it's the peace I feel that urges me forward." L. Whidby

"The retreat really offered an opportunity to be seen and
heard with no judgment amongst beautiful and empowering souls, all of whom were seeking to manifest
and create a deepened understanding of self and their relationships. I left
feeling rejuvenated and really appreciative of the experience all round." G. Polak
"I was able to express a rare and heartfelt playfulness!  I also experienced the joy of finally accepting and loving my physical body." L. Greiss

possibly can to make this retreat available for more women. Even so, there are many women who really need this, but do not have the financial means to participate.
