story:
Who We Are

My name is Kareem Clarke and alongside my friend and colleague, Ian Cahill, we are excited to announce the launch of our record label, Digital Den Records. We have joined forces to create a collective of young professional musicians, artists, DJs, and producers who are truly passionate about music.

 

Our Story

Our journey begins in Valencia, Spain where we met while working towards earning our Master's degrees from Berklee College of Music. As soon as we met, there was a special bond over DJ-ing, Producing, and our LOVE for House music. During this time we met many talented artists, many of whom have inspired us to create this label and who will be featured on releases by Digital Den Records. 

 

Mission Statement

Digital Den Records is a home for eclectic house and electronic music made by progressive and musically-versed DJ's, musicians, & producers. As a label, our mission is to share the music from our expanding network of culturally and artistically diverse peers with the world. 

 

Why Support Us? 

Digital Den Records will be a trusted label that provides a growing cohort of producers a chance to have their music heard. We are musicians and producers ourselves and we know how hard it is to get your music out there and heard. With your help, we will create that stage for ourselves and so many others. We will be a breeding ground for raw talent to get a chance to grow artistically and worry about their music more than anything else. With your support, we can support so many music dreams. 

 

What we need

  • As in starting up any business, there are many up front costs that need to be covered in order to get the ball rolling. Hence, we are launching this Indiegogo campaign in order to raise funds to get the team off the ground and running. 
  • Our financial goal during this campaign is of $10,000 to bring this dream to life, share our music to the world, and cover costs of starting the label.
  • 25% goes to Vinyl pressing. This is a gift for our team and our supporters, we will not make any profit off of this.
  • 10% will be used for mixing, mastering, promotion and distribution of the debut EP, "Welcome to the Den".
  • 50% is needed for Digital Distribution, Promotion & Marketing. We need all the help and exposure we can get in order for people to get to know us and to be able to release our music on the different digital platforms.
  • 15% is for the Label Branding, Web Design, and Logo Design.
  • We'd love to have you be a part of the process!

 

What You Get

As a special thank you present to all of you who support us, the campaign, and our dream, we have a few perks lined up:

 

  • Den Backers will receive a Digital download of the label's Debut Compilation, "Welcome to the Den" before the official release dates. TBA.
  • Den Delegates will receive Digital downloads of "Welcome to the Den" and the next three (3) releases on the label before the official release dates. TBA.
  • Den Advocates will receive Digital downloads of "Welcome to the Den", the next three (3) releases, and a Limited Edition Vinyl pressed copy of the Debut Compilation. (Once we receive the Vinyl pressings we will notify supporters and ship the product. This product will not be for sale otherwise.)
  • Den VIPs will receive Digital downloads of "Welcome to the Den", the next Full year worth of releases, and two (2) Limited Edition Vinyl pressed copies of the Debut Compilation.
  • Enter the Den: Golden Package includes Digital downloads of "Welcome to the Den", the next Full year worth of releases, five (5) Limited Edition Vinyl pressed copies of the Debut Compilation, and a Private Party with DJ sets from Digital Den Artists *

    (*Set must be in CA, MA, NY or PR. Contributor must provide the space. Not every artist can perform in every city)

Other Ways To Help!

  • Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc... Share the campaign on different Social Media platforms
  • Follow Us on Social Media
  • Listen to our Music on Soundcloud
  • Tell a friend
  • Send us Feedback
  • Join our newsletter

Meet The Team

Kareem Clarke aka Tony Clarke (CEO & Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/tonyclarketunes

 

Ian Cahill (Creative Director & Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/iancahillmusic

 

Tryangle Man (Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/tryangleman

 

DJANK YUCCA (Label Artists)

https://soundcloud.com/djankyucca


Decatree (Label Artists)

https://soundcloud.com/decatree
 

Rob Cooper (Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/robcopper


fat. (Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/funasstechno


Techno Ted (Label Artist)

https://soundcloud.com/the-istari

 

To Conclude

This is just the beginning of a truly amazing journey. We have invested many minutes, hours, days, and years of lives to our music, our studies, and this label in order to advance our skills, pallet, and knowledge. We would like to thank you for joining us as we bring our dream to life and our music to world!

Best,

Kareem Clarke, Ian Cahill 

&

 the rest of the Digital Den Records Team

 

contact us:

digitaldenrecs@gmail.com

tonyclarketunes@gmail.com 

iancahillmusic@gmail.com

follow us:

facebook.com/digitaldenrecs

soundcloud.com/digital-den-records

twitter: @digitaldenrecs

facebook.com/tonyclarketunes

facebook.com/iancahillmusic

story:
• Who I am

I am Nada Kolundzija, a Belgrade-based pianist. I was always attracted to contemporary music.  I followed from one clue to the next, compelled to the chase in a gloriously never-ending process. I have passion and love for my exciting, beautiful and endless work. I am exploring, performing and promoting classical contemporary music over a career spanning more than four decades. I have performed more than 1000 concerts at 3 continents in 28 countries. I am a recipient of national and international awards and recognitions for artistic achievement in contemporary music and my name appears in Oxford’s Book of Successful People of Serbia.

Here is my biography:

http://www.nadakolundzija.info/biography.html

Feel free to contact me for any information at e-mail:  nada.k@mts.rs

  •  My Little Anthology of Piano Music “breathing in/breathing out“ (1914–2014), a box set of three compact discs and an accompanying catalog

Project will be published till the end of March 2017. 
Record label is VERTICAL JAZZ
Print run: 500

  • ABOUT MUSIC


The upcoming set, with more than 3 hours of contemporary music is a rich collection of work by twenty-five composers, eight Serbian and seventeen international. Three CDs  cover a century of music history from 1914 to 2014. Music is variety of genre range from avant-garde and experimental music through minimalism and post-minimalism; from mysticism to jazz and film music. The acoustic soundscape encounters piano, toy piano, music box, soundtracks, computer software and vocal narrative.

Between May and August 2014, I played a series of three concerts under the joint title “My Little Concert Anthology of Piano Music.” This project was nominated for the Belgrade City Award. Collection was conceived around compositions that I had previously played or wanted to play; and then, in the process of searching for something new, it turned into three programs that I decided to record.

The program for the triple CD likewise changed from the beginning to the end of the recording sessions. It gradually grew larger as I “unearthed” wonderful compositions new to me, and as well as by adding some works that I had recorded previously. Thereby, the selection became all the more expansive and richer.

List of composers: Аrvo Pärt, Louis Andriessen, Philip Glass, Katarina Miljković, Scott Pender, Lola Perrin,  Ivana Stefanović, David Lang, Vuk Kulenović, Toby Тwining, Miroslav Savić, Jacob Ter Veldhuis, Galen H.Brown, Yannis Kyriakides, William Duckworth, Miloš Raičković, Anton Batagov, Dusan Bogdanović, Miodrag Lazarov Pashu, Meredith Моnk, Gurdjieff / de Hartman, Conlon Nancarrow, John Cage, Jasna Velickovic and Erik Satie.

  • ABOUT CATALOG

The CD set is further accompanied by Serbian/English catalogue with about 100 pages, edited by musicologist Ivana Miladinović Prica. Wishing to “gather together” these wonderful composers, I thought that my idea would not be fully complete without a consideration of their thoughts alongside their music. And also to hear from some of our leading musical experts who could bring the circle of composers into an artistic-conceptual context. This is how the work on the accompanying catalogue began. I am very happy about that.

    • ABOUT SUBTITLE:  "breathing in/breathing out"

    I took the subtitle of the anthology “breathing in/breathing out“ from the eponymous film. At that point of my life breathing was very important to me. Important in meditation, inseparable from life itself, but also from music. And so, by inhaling and exhaling, I brought to life the  musical scores that can now choose their own paths. Breathing is the essence of our life. It`s essence of music.

    • LIST OF COMPOSITIONS:

    CD I
    1. Milos Raickovich
    Nadja’s Kolo (In memoriam Nadja Tesich) for piano
    Waiting for C-A-G-E  for piano and toy piano

    2. John Cage
    Sonata III  from Sonatas & Interludes for prepared piano

    3. Yannis Kyriakides
    Fofi & Michalis  for music box

    4. Arvo Pärt
    Für Alina 
    V    ariations for the Healing of Arinushka      

    5. David Lang
    Wed (in memory of Kate Ericson) from collection Memory pieces
    Gravity for piano 4 hands
    Nada Kolundzija & Katarina Radovanovic

    6. Dusan Bogdanovic
    A Little Prayer

    7. George I. Gurdjieff / Thomas de Hartmann
    Meditation 
    Holy Affirming – Holy Denying – Holy Reconciling
    Prayer and Despair
    Religious Ceremony

    8. Galen H. Brown
    God is a Killer for piano and tape

    9. Arvo Pärt
    Für Anna Maria

    CD II                     

    1. Louis Andriessen
    Deuxieme chorale for hand-operated music box

    2. Ivana Stefanovic
    Dungeon

    3. Erik Satie
    Le Tango Perpetual from album Sports et divertissements
    Narrator: Scott Fielding

    4. William Duckworth
    Tango Voices

    5. Scott Pender
    TANGO: Ms. Jackson Dances for the People

    6. Toby Twining
    Nightmare Rag  for piano and toy piano
    Satie Blues for piano and toy piano

    7. Anton Batagov
    Waltz
    e-moll      

    8. Meridith Monk
    Railroad (Travel Song)
    Paris

    9. Lola Perrin
    Piano Suite I – Early One Sunday Morning

    10. Philip Glass
    Etude No. 1, No. 5, and No. 6

    11. Miodrag Lazarov Pashu
    Waltz
     

    CD III

    1. Jacob ter Veldhuis (Jacob TV)
    The Body of Your Dreams for piano and boombox (soundtracks)

    2. Miroslav Misa Savic
    For Nada for piano and computer

    3. Katarina Milјkovic
    Forest Four for piano and electronic

    4. Vuk Kulenovic
    God with the Moon on his Hair (One Appearance of God Shiva) for prepared piano

    5. Conlon Nancarrow
    Canon for Ursula A
    Canon for Ursula C   

    6. Jasna Velickovic 
    Sputnik     for two quarter-tone apart pianos
    Nada Kolundzija & Deborah Richards

    7. John Cage
    Sonata XIII  from Sonatas & Interludes for prepared piano             

     

     

    • Project is supported by:

    - SOKOJ - Serbian Music Authors' Organization
    - PI - Organization for Collective Administration of Performers' Rights
    - Belgrade City Hall

     

    • WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

    Uncovered expenses – USD 2.700,00

    - Catalogs and packages
    (Design, layout, prepress, printing)                           USD 2.100,00
    - Tuner                                                                              USD    340,00
    - Licenses for recordings                                             USD     260,00

    • Expenses covered by sponsors –  USD - 4.075,00

    - Sound engineer (recordings, editing, mastering)
    - Translation
    - Lecturer
    - Printing (1500 CDs)  

    • Extra Costs:

    - IndieGoGo's platform fees  (5% of total)
    - Payment processing fees (~3% of total)
story_txt:
Who I am
I am Nada Kolundzija, a Belgrade-based pianist. I was always attracted to contemporary music.  I followed from one clue to the next, compelled to the chase in a gloriously never-ending process. I have passion and love for my exciting, beautiful and endless work. I am exploring, performing and promoting classical contemporary music over a career spanning more than four decades. I have performed more than 1000 concerts at 3 continents in 28 countries. I am a recipient of national and international awards and recognitions for artistic achievement in contemporary music and my name appears in Oxford’s Book of Successful People of Serbia.
Here is my biography:http://www.nadakolundzija.info/biography.html
Feel free to contact me for any information at e-mail:  nada.k@mts.rs
 My Little Anthology of Piano Music “breathing in/breathing out“ (1914–2014), a box set of three compact discs and an accompanying catalog

Project will be published till the end of March 2017. Record label is VERTICAL JAZZPrint run: 500
ABOUT MUSIC
The upcoming set, with more than 3 hours of contemporary music is a rich collection of work by twenty-five composers, eight Serbian and seventeen international. Three CDs  cover a century of music history from 1914 to 2014. Music is variety of genre range from avant-garde and experimental music through minimalism and post-minimalism; from mysticism to jazz and film music. The acoustic soundscape encounters piano, toy piano, music box, soundtracks, computer software and vocal narrative.Between May and August 2014, I played a series of three concerts under the joint title “My Little Concert Anthology of Piano Music.” This project was nominated for the Belgrade City Award. Collection was conceived around compositions that I had previously played or wanted to play; and then, in the process of searching for something new, it turned into three programs that I decided to record.
The program for the triple CD likewise changed from the beginning to the end of the recording sessions. It gradually grew larger as I “unearthed” wonderful compositions new to me, and as well as by adding some works that I had recorded previously. Thereby, the selection became all the more expansive and richer.
List of composers: Аrvo Pärt, Louis Andriessen, Philip Glass, Katarina Miljković, Scott Pender, Lola Perrin,  Ivana Stefanović, David Lang, Vuk Kulenović, Toby Тwining, Miroslav Savić, Jacob Ter Veldhuis, Galen H.Brown, Yannis Kyriakides,  William Duckworth, Miloš Raičković, Anton Batagov, Dusan Bogdanović, Miodrag Lazarov Pashu, Meredith Моnk, Gurdjieff / de Hartman, Conlon Nancarrow, John Cage, Jasna Velickovic and Erik Satie.
ABOUT CATALOG
The CD set is further accompanied by Serbian/English catalogue with about 100 pages, edited by musicologist Ivana Miladinović Prica. Wishing to “gather together” these wonderful composers, I thought that my idea would not be fully complete without a consideration of their thoughts alongside their music. And also to hear from some of our leading musical experts who could bring the circle of composers into an artistic-conceptual context. This is how the work on the accompanying catalogue began. I am very happy about that. 

ABOUT SUBTITLE:  "breathing in/breathing out" 
I took the subtitle of the anthology “breathing in/breathing out“ from the eponymous film. At that point of my life breathing was very important to me. Important in meditation, inseparable from life itself, but also from music. And so, by inhaling and exhaling, I brought to life the  musical scores that can now choose their own paths. Breathing is the essence of our life. It`s essence of music.
LIST OF COMPOSITIONS:
CD I1. Milos RaickovichNadja’s Kolo (In memoriam Nadja Tesich) for pianoWaiting for C-A-G-E  for piano and toy piano
2. John CageSonata III  from Sonatas & Interludes for prepared piano
3. Yannis KyriakidesFofi & Michalis  for music box
4. Arvo PärtFür Alina Variations for the Healing of Arinushka      
5. David LangWed (in memory of Kate Ericson) from collection Memory piecesGravity for piano 4 handsNada Kolundzija & Katarina Radovanovic
6. Dusan BogdanovicA Little Prayer
7. George I. Gurdjieff / Thomas de HartmannMeditation Holy Affirming – Holy Denying – Holy ReconcilingPrayer and DespairReligious Ceremony
8. Galen H. BrownGod is a Killer for piano and tape
9. Arvo PärtFür Anna Maria
CD II                     
1. Louis AndriessenDeuxieme chorale for hand-operated music box
2. Ivana StefanovicDungeon
3. Erik SatieLe Tango Perpetual from album Sports et divertissementsNarrator: Scott Fielding
4. William DuckworthTango Voices
5. Scott PenderTANGO: Ms. Jackson Dances for the People
6. Toby TwiningNightmare Rag  for piano and toy pianoSatie Blues for piano and toy piano
7. Anton BatagovWaltze-moll  
8. Meridith MonkRailroad (Travel Song)Paris
9. Lola PerrinPiano Suite I – Early One Sunday Morning
10. Philip GlassEtude No. 1, No. 5, and No. 6
11. Miodrag Lazarov PashuWaltz  
CD III
1. Jacob ter Veldhuis (Jacob TV)The Body of Your Dreams for piano and boombox (soundtracks)
2. Miroslav Misa SavicFor Nada for piano and computer
3. Katarina MilјkovicForest Four for piano and electronic 
4. Vuk KulenovicGod with the Moon on his Hair (One Appearance of God Shiva) for prepared piano
5. Conlon NancarrowCanon for Ursula ACanon for Ursula C   
6. Jasna Velickovic Sputnik for two quarter-tone apart pianosNada Kolundzija & Deborah Richards
7. John CageSonata XIII  from Sonatas & Interludes for prepared piano              
 
 
Project is supported by:
- SOKOJ - Serbian Music Authors' Organization- PI - Organization for Collective Administration of Performers' Rights- Belgrade City Hall
 
WHERE THE MONEY GOES:
Uncovered expenses – USD 2.700,00 
- Catalogs and packages(Design, layout, prepress, printing)                           USD 2.100,00- Tuner                                                                              USD    340,00- Licenses for recordings                                             USD     260,00
Expenses covered by sponsors –  USD - 4.075,00
- Sound engineer (recordings, editing, mastering)- Translation- Lecturer- Printing (1500 CDs)  
Extra Costs: 
- IndieGoGo's platform fees  (5% of total)- Payment processing fees (~3% of total)

story:
STOP!

Before you read any further, please understand that the "back it" button is interpreted by indiegogo as a donation; you must click on the perk to receive the items listed! Thank you!

Hello!

A little bit about myself: I grew up in Wyomissing, PA. Yes, Taylor Swift also grew up there, and no, I do not write country music. I'm currently studying vocal jazz at the Frost School of Music in Miami, and have a background in classical, theatre, and pop. I play the piano. Dogs are very important to me!!! Lately, my favorite thing to eat has been roasted mushrooms (seriously. slice em, toss em with olive oil, salt, pepper, and some herbs, and throw em in the oven on a shallow pan for 30-45 minutes. It's a magical thing). 

Ok, so let's get down to it. About the project: We'll be recording 5 original tracks (and one bonus acoustic demo) of mine. We are hoping to incorporate some horn, string, and wind arrangements, too. A lot of people are going to put a lot of time and heart into this, and I want to make sure that they are treated accordingly!! I would love to pay out of pocket, but I'm just a wee college student with a thin wallet. I also want to give the opportunity to those interested to pre-order the EP!

I am already blown away by the response of those who have heard my music. It's a real honor to perform in front of such receptive audiences. Thank you in advance to all those who will continue to support me through this campaign and otherwise! You are all so great!!

Serious words:

Money matters:

  • I want to raise $1200. That seems like a decent amount, I know. But here is where it'll go...
    • Colin McKinley! This man is going to handle all of the production aspects. He will push buttons! He will place microphones! He will do lots of things that I vaguely understand! Colin has already put in so many hours discussing plans, attending rehearsals, and recording scratch audio for me. He's an angel.
    • The band! The musicians will put in time. They will skip dinner on occasion and play beautifully always. They deserve some love.
    • All additional money raised will go toward the horn, string, and wind arrangements, and production costs of physical CDs and such. If I somehow raise way over what I ask for, I'll put that money into marketing. But that's just if I happen to raise enough to make that happen!
  • Contributing to this campaign will reap exciting rewards like:
    • hearing my voice sing words
    • special early downloads of a track or two
    • a song written for you?? possibly
    • a private concert??? maybe
    • a personal thank you note???? definitely
  • If I don't quite reach the goal I set, all of the money will still go to Colin and the musicians, and I'll pay the rest of what I owe them out of pocket.

Challenge Accepted

There's the possibility that I don't raise much money. I get it, crowd funding is annoying. In this case, it's a necessary evil. But I really do appreciate whatever support you could offer. If you contribute, bless your soul. I love you! If you don't, but you share the campaign, or think a nice thought like "I hope she gets enough bread to feed her band and keep a smile on her face," bless you as well! I love you, too! If you scroll past this and think, "that's annoying, please refrain," I can't blame you, but that makes me sad.

Basically, I can't wait to get moving on this EP, and hope you'll join me for the ride!

Updates will most frequently be found on my Instagram @raeistheway, and I'll also keep content on my website: www.raemusic.co. Thanks everyone!

story:
[English Below]

[Prenez le temps de découvrir l'espace, les projets et les gens qui les font vivre à travers la vidéo promotionnelle]

Pour une toiture sans fuite


Le Récif se situe dans le village de Rivière-Trois-Pistoles dans le Bas-Saint-Laurent sur le bord du fleuve. Environ douze personnes y vivent de façon permanente. Cet espace comprend plusieurs ateliers tels qu'un atelier de bois, un atelier de montage vidéo et de retouche photo, une chambre noire, une salle de théâtre/projection, un atelier de couture, un atelier vélos et une salle de jam. Il comprend aussi une scène, une serre, des jardins et une cuisine collective. Nous avons plusieurs définitions pour cet endroit tel qu’une école libre, un centre d’éducation populaire, des résidences pour militant-es et artistes ainsi qu’un espace d’exploration de la vie militante et collective.
Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour financer le renouvellement de notre toiture et le changement de chauffage à l'huile pour un Rocket Stove dans une visée d'être plus écologique et plus économique. Les dépenses reliées à une maison sont assez élevées et constantes. Nous tenons à garder cet espace d'ateliers et de partage de savoir disponible aux gens qui y passent.
Nous avons besoin d'environ 13 000$ pour réaliser ces rénovations. Nous avons déjà collecté 2 000$ avec certains financements tels que des spectacles et la vente de certains meubles. Nous faisons appel à votre aide pour le 11 000$ manquant. 

 L'espace auquel vous contribuez:

  • Un espace qui soutient l’éducation populaire et la retransmet dans d’autres milieux engagés.
  • Un espace qui crée des liens entre les militantEs des milieux ruraux avec les militantEs des milieux urbains.
  • Un espace qui fait des liens avec les luttes sociales et environnementales.
  • Un espace de ressourcement pour explorer son bien-être et le bien-être collectif. La maison se situe dans un endroit magnifique du Québec, ce qui permet aux particpantEs de profiter de la nature et contribue à avoir un mode de vie plus reposé et plus concentré sur leur développement personnel.
  • Un lieu d’échange et d’exploration sur les possibilités de vivre des modes de vie alternative et soutenable dans le long terme.
  • Un espace qui s’inscrit dans la vie communautaire de la région.

L'impact:

Nous voulons continuer d'offrir cet espace d'ateliers gratuits et le partage des savoirs qui s'en dégage. Nous tenons aussi à continuer d'offrir des événements à contribution volontaire tel que l'école d'été, la cueillette des savoirs, que nous organisons pour le mois de juillet 2016. 

Pour plus d'informations: 

  http://www.lacueillettedessavoirs.com

Vos contributions nous aiderons à maintenir cet espace. 

Merci pour votre aide!

Nous vous encourageons aussi à diffuser la campagne dans vos réseaux sociaux. Pour nous aider à atteindre nos objectifs.


Il y aura des mises à jour tout au long de la campagne Indiegogo.

Vous pouvez nous écrire à cette adresse courriel: aubergedelagreve@gmail.com

Sur Facebook: https://fr-ca.facebook.com/AubergeDeLaGreve/

Sur notre site: https://aubergedelagreve.wordpress.com/a-propos/ 

 

[Take a minute to discover the workspace, the projects and the people who make them alive through the promotional video.]

For a roof without a leak


Le Récif is located at Rivière-Trois-Pistoles, a village in the Bas-Saint-Laurent region on the coast of the Saint Lawrence River. Around twelve people live here permanently. The space comprises many workshops, including a wood workshop, a video and photo editing room, a darkroom, a theater and projection room, a sewing room, a bike workshop and a music room. It also include a stage, a greenhouse, gardens and a collective kitchen. We define this place in many ways; as a free school, a popular education center and a residence for militants and artists as well as a place for exploration of militant and collective life.

We need your help to finance our new roof and change the oil heating system for a Rocket Stove with the goal of being more green and thrifty. The expenses related to the house are consistently high. We want to keep this work space and continue to share our knowledge with the people who pass by.

We need about $13000 to achieve the renovations. We have already fundraised 2 000$ through some of our funding projects, such as shows and furniture sales. We call on your help for the additional 11 000$ .


The space you contribute to:

  • A space that supports popular education and retransmits it in other engaged communities.
  • A space that creates links between militants from rural environments and urban ones.
  • A space that creates links between activists for environmental and social justice.
  • A space for healing and exploring your own well-being and the community`s. The house is located in an beautiful part of Quebec, allowing residents to benefit from nature, focus on their personal development and contribute to an healthy lifestyle.
  •  A place for exchange and exploration of potential alternative lifestyles with long term sustainability.
  • A space that fits in with the communal life of the region

Impact :

We want to continue to offer free workspace and share our knowledge. We wish to continue to hold our events based on voluntary donation, such as our summer school, La Cueillette des Savoirs that we are organising for the month of July 2016.

For more information:

http://cueillettessavoirs.wix.com/cueillettedessavoirs

Your contribution will help us maintain this space.

Thank you for your help!

We also encourage you to spread the campaign on socials network to help us reach our goal.


There will be updates everyday during the Indiegogo campaign.

You can reach us at this e-mail address : aubergedelagreve@gmail.com

On Facebook: https://fr-ca.facebook.com/AubergeDeLaGreve/

On our website: https://aubergedelagreve.wordpress.com/a-propos/

story:
Sponsor NatuReza and help it come alive!

For the past several years, I have been working extra hard to make this album for you, composing the tunes, writing arrangements and lyrics for this very special project.

Natureza is the Portuguese word for nature. I chose this title for the album because it synthetizes many ideas present in my songs. Taking a closer look at NatuReza:

Natu - is a root for many words that expresses ideas like: where you are from, to be born, birth.

Reza - means prayer, a spiritual chant, to have faith. 

In NatuReza there are orixás, entities, waterfalls, stones, and all sorts of wild life.

This is an album about the Brazilian soul, a journey where we reconnect with the woods, animals, with the mythological culture of Brazil. The different ethnicities; the Black, the Native Indian, and the European, all siblings, dance, sing and drink in a festivity that celebrates NatuReza.    

I invite you to embark in NatuReza and rediscover the Brazilian culture. By entering, you will gain access to Brazil's wonderful folklore universe, see it's myths and legends, and experience this incredible journey through the landscapes of NatuReza.

My goal in this project is not only to deliver amazing music and perks but also to preserve Brazil's traditional identity.

[Português. English continues right after]

Aos amigos(as) e familiares do Brasil

COMO PARTICIPAR

Este financiamento coletivo funciona como uma espécie de pré-venda. Ao fazer uma contribuição, você garante a sua recompensa - por exemplo, uma árvore com seu nome, um ingresso, o CD físico ou o arquivo digital, um show.

É só clicar na recompensa que você escolher e colocar seus dados. Não demora mais que 3 minutos.

Precisamos arrecadar ao menos R$ 49.200 para gravar o disco e produzir os CDs.

O que você ganha ao participar? Não só você compra o disco, mas você está possibilitando que outras pessoas possam ter acesso a minha música.

Conto com seu apoio!

 

The Impact

With this campaign, we hope to bring awarness to ecological matters, focusing your attention to the preservation of Brazilian rainforests and it's history and culture. Planting a tree symbolizes the individual effort of every person that decides to back our campaign. By launching this album, we seek to inspire through art the need to protect our natural resources and prevent further environmental degradation. You think that's a huge extrapolation? Absolutely not. We are convinced that the more people learn about the topic and fall in love with the wonders of Nature, the more chances we have of keeping our planet healthy.

Budget (Orçamento)

Your contribution will pay for:

Recording Costs: $15,000

  • Studio Rental
  • The outstanding musicians involved in recording the album
  • Music Producer
  • Sound/recording engineer
  • Mixing engineer
  • Mastering engineer
  • Vocal coach & vocal production fees 
  • Visual packaging (artwork + album design & liner notes) 
  • Videographer fees (behind the scenes footage for the making of record)
  • Perk production
  • Miscellaneous expense

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know what it is like to love and/or appreciate something so much and not be able to give more than we wish we could to support it. Don't worry, if you can't fund our campaign today, you will be extra awesome by sharing it with your social media contacts, sending it as an email blast to people who appreciate great art and music, and by screaming about our campaign on the streets. You can easily share the campaign online by using the Indiegogo share tools or by using this link (https://igg.me/at/NatuReza).

    Stay in touch, come back often for progress updates, and perhaps, when the campaign is finished, you can continue to support us by contributing to the InDemand campaign or by sharing our project with the world once more! Let's break a record together (no pun intended)!

    and...Thank you...Obrigado...Gracias...Merci...Danke...Dankon

    YOU ARE AWESOME!

    FAQs

    When will the album come out? 
    We have not announced a release date as of yet, but we will communicate that to you at the end of this campaign.

    When will my stuff ship?
    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to to you at least 24 hours prior to the official release.

    How do I pay for shipping?
    After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package, you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by the indicated amount according to your location.

    I forgot to pay for shipping!
    Not a problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!

    I placed an order and have a question.
    If you've placed an order, you can file a support ticket or contact us directly at indiegogopedro@gmail.com. If you have not placed an order, please tweet @pedrobmusic and we'll do our best to respond. 

    How many notes in the Bebop scale?                                                                                                                     8   :)
story_txt:
Sponsor NatuReza and help it come alive!
For the past several years, I have been working extra hard to make this album for you, composing the tunes, writing arrangements and lyrics for this very special project.
Natureza is the Portuguese word for nature. I chose this title for the album because it synthetizes many ideas present in my songs. Taking a closer look at NatuReza:
Natu - is a root for many words that expresses ideas like: where you are from, to be born, birth.
Reza - means prayer, a spiritual chant, to have faith. 
In NatuReza there are orixás, entities, waterfalls, stones, and all sorts of wild life.
This is an album about the Brazilian soul, a journey where we reconnect with the woods, animals, with the mythological culture of Brazil. The different ethnicities; the Black, the Native Indian, and the European, all siblings, dance, sing and drink in a festivity that celebrates NatuReza.    
I invite you to embark in NatuReza and rediscover the Brazilian culture. By entering, you will gain access to Brazil's wonderful folklore universe, see it's myths and legends, and experience this incredible journey through the landscapes of NatuReza.

My goal in this project is not only to deliver amazing music and perks but also to preserve Brazil's traditional identity.

[Português. English continues right after]
Aos amigos(as) e familiares do Brasil
COMO PARTICIPAR
Este financiamento coletivo funciona como uma espécie de pré-venda. Ao fazer uma contribuição, você garante a sua recompensa - por exemplo, uma árvore com seu nome, um ingresso, o CD físico ou o arquivo digital, um show.
É só clicar na recompensa que você escolher e colocar seus dados. Não demora mais que 3 minutos.
Precisamos arrecadar ao menos R$ 49.200 para gravar o disco e produzir os CDs.
O que você ganha ao participar? Não só você compra o disco, mas você está possibilitando que outras pessoas possam ter acesso a minha música.
Conto com seu apoio!
 
The Impact

With this campaign, we hope to bring awarness to ecological matters, focusing your attention to the preservation of Brazilian rainforests and it's history and culture. Planting a tree symbolizes the individual effort of every person that decides to back our campaign. By launching this album, we seek to inspire through art the need to protect our natural resources and prevent further environmental degradation. You think that's a huge extrapolation? Absolutely not. We are convinced that the more people learn about the topic and fall in love with the wonders of Nature, the more chances we have of keeping our planet healthy.

Budget (Orçamento)
Your contribution will pay for:
Recording Costs: $15,000

Studio Rental
The outstanding musicians involved in recording the album
Music Producer
Sound/recording engineer
Mixing engineer
Mastering engineer
Vocal coach & vocal production fees 
Visual packaging (artwork + album design & liner notes) 
Videographer fees (behind the scenes footage for the making of record)
Perk production
Miscellaneous expense


Other Ways You Can Help
We know what it is like to love and/or appreciate something so much and not be able to give more than we wish we could to support it. Don't worry, if you can't fund our campaign today, you will be extra awesome by sharing it with your social media contacts, sending it as an email blast to people who appreciate great art and music, and by screaming about our campaign on the streets. You can easily share the campaign online by using the Indiegogo share tools or by using this link (https://igg.me/at/NatuReza).
Stay in touch, come back often for progress updates, and perhaps, when the campaign is finished, you can continue to support us by contributing to the InDemand campaign or by sharing our project with the world once more! Let's break a record together (no pun intended)!
and...Thank you...Obrigado...Gracias...Merci...Danke...Dankon
YOU ARE AWESOME!
FAQs
When will the album come out? We have not announced a release date as of yet, but we will communicate that to you at the end of this campaign.
When will my stuff ship?Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to to you at least 24 hours prior to the official release.
How do I pay for shipping?After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package, you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by the indicated amount according to your location.
I forgot to pay for shipping!Not a problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!
I placed an order and have a question.If you've placed an order, you can file a support ticket or contact us directly at indiegogopedro@gmail.com. If you have not placed an order, please tweet @pedrobmusic and we'll do our best to respond. 
How many notes in the Bebop scale?                                                                                                                     8   :)

story:
Who We Are

We love opera. We've been creating opera using only local talent for 33 years. We are committed to launching the careers of young opera singers as well as bringing opera into the community through our education outreach programs, Dinner and a Diva series, and other events. 

We are growing. Over the last decade, we have gone from one act operas with piano accompaniment to full scale productions with orchestra. An average production can include 8 principal singers, 20 chorus members, 16 orchestra players, and 30 production staff, including directors, stage managers, carpenters, painters, and sound and lighting engineers. Not to mention countless volunteers. These are your friends, neighbors, and coworkers who are also passionate about opera.  

We are unique. We are the only opera company in Atlanta that focuses SOLELY on supporting local artists through our programs. We believe in the talent located right here in our city and we want to give you the opportunity to see and hear it.

Here's Where You Come In

"Man of La Mancha" is an ambitious production for us. It will stretch our comfort zone, it will challenge our performers, and it will excite our audiences. We want you to be a part of bringing this to life.

  • We need to raise at least $15,000 to make this dream a reality.
  • We are asking for as little as $25 per donation. It doesn't take much to make a difference, and it DOES make a difference.
  • As a donor, you are contributing directly back into your community, supporting our Atlanta artists.

Our Challenges

Last year we were faced with postponing a production because of lack of funding. That didn't stop us from doing what we love. We continued our monthly Dinner and a Diva series, won a grant to launch a new education production for children, and came back stronger than ever with this spring's production of Gilbert and Sullivan's "The Mikado." We are working harder than ever to continue bringing you outstanding opera and we respect and appreciate any amount you can give.

There are Many Ways to Help

We understand that giving financially just isn't in the cards for everyone. Our company also thrives on a community of dedicated volunteers to keep our organization going. Would you like to be a part of this wonderful opera company? Here's how you can contribute:

  • Be an usher at a main stage performance
  • Help our board members with mailings and other tasks
  • Donate an item or service to our annual silent auction
  • Spread the word about our company

Email info@ccityopera.org for more information on the ways you can become involved with our company.

story:
STORY:

After weeks of planning, we are beyond ecstatic to have lined up our first regional tour starting on July 7th in Atlanta, GA for Pumpin Gumption Vol. 5! We've been extremely active within the city's underground hip-hop arena over the past couple of years and realize the need to expand our audience outside of the local market. The various platforms that we've created such as "Say What You Say Saturdays" and "Pumpin Gumption" have allowed us to build a network of regional contacts that we've been able to leverage while family and friends like you have been eager to give input as well.

Now that we've lined up our itinerary and scheduled days to take off from work, its now time for the fun part -- budgeting, because we know fuel and lodging won't exactly pay for itself. Yes, there's always the opportunity to juug and finesse but we'd rather not explore those options for obvious reasons. Instead, we have packaged together a few items that are extensively exclusive and personable to you, our willing supporters.

The journey from being military members to becoming successful artists have been a long one up until this point and there's plenty of traveling left to do. We've embraced the grind and are beyond ready to shake things up across hip-hop world. In return for your hand in helping us share our art, we offer a number of limited edition and autographed items for your collection. We thank you for your continued support, believing in our craft and accompanying us along the way. Let's keep building!

story:
After decades of primarily working on other people’s music I am finally ready to release a full-length solo album of my own songs into the world! The album is called "SILVER SUITCASE", and I am looking for partners like you to come alongside me in this pursuit. 

I’ve done as much as I can on my own and I’m reaching out to build a team of people to help finance the release of this record – mastering, artwork and photography, a publicity campaign, video production, video promotion, manufacturing CD’s and other merchandise (possibly even vinyl), radio promotion, and developing the live band. I’m quite proud of the record and believe it deserves a real shot at getting heard by a large audience.

You can hear track one, "Pictures" , on matthammonmusic.com now. 

Over the years, I helped start some bands that you might know and love: Mineral, The Gloria Record, The Rebecca West, etc… I have recorded and /or toured with Bob Mould of Husker Du and Sugar, Verbow (feat. Jason Narducy), The Damnwells / Alex Dezen, Tess Wiley and many others…I have produced tons of records, singles and demos for songwriters like Paige Lewis, Mando Saenz, and Jenna Kuykendall, to name but a few.

Perhaps you know me from my work with wife Cameron Dezen Hammon and the stuff we have done all over the world over the last decade or so.

Whatever the case - while I was working with all of those great artists I was quietly amassing volumes and volumes of my own material and packing them away for some unknown future date when I could really focus on them.  I came to a place in 2012 when I was ready to step out on my own, musically, but just as I had broken ground on this album my life took an unexpected turn - the unthinkable happened.

I found out I had cancer. 

I was forced to reinvent almost everything about my life, and recording my own music went pretty far down the priority list. Thanks to my wonderful doctors and the support of family and friends I'M FINE NOW, grateful to have had the opportunity to "see what I was made of", and more eager than ever to make every minute count.

That’s where this record comes in -

What I’ve done with this record is this: I went through the "Silver Suitcase" in my head and cherry-picked my 10 favorite songs from the hundreds that I had archived over the course of my life and approached them all as if they were brand new songs. I recorded them all from scratch, with new ears and a new heart (and some timely lyric workshopping with Over The Rhine) - playing all the instruments myself (except for one song my dear friend and long-time collaborator David Rice help resurrect) and I mixed it myself, too, in my converted one-car garage. 

Making the music is the easy part – that part I can do on my own.

The hard part is giving it wings once its finished, so it doesn’t "die on the vine". There is so music out there – more than ever before. There’s also a lot of turmoil out there in the world and countless honorable causes to support financially. All I really have to say about it is that I believe honest rock and roll still has a large role to play in our world – not as an escape mechanism but as a mechanism to engage – to engage life itself, to be hopeful and human and provide the occasion for people to emote and cry and dance and feel something good.

So I humbly come to you asking for your support as I put this record out into the world.

There are many different levels of funding on my indie go-go page, all of which consist of an immediate download of the entire record, from receiving exclusive acoustic versions of the tunes, or having me work on your recording projects…all the way up to having me come play a show in your house, etc… So check out the Indie Go Go page and please consider joining me in putting out this very meaningful and timely album of honest rock and roll music.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support!

Matt Hammon

Houston, TX USA

matthammonmusic.com

story:
The Pitch

Help us bring a professional chamber orchestra to the Shenango Valley: the PIERCE THEATRE PLAYERS. 

Led by Stephen Barr and Jay Koziorynsky, the PTP will offer a unique and innovative source of quality classical music performance for the Shenango Valley, presented in an intimate setting with a relaxed atmosphere. 

Bringing together great composers of the past with our own local virtuoso performers of the present, we aim to present a diverse offering of music encompassing not only established symphonic masterpieces, but also music from other vocal and contemporary traditions, and with an eye to promising voices of the future.  

Our business model will keep the musicians as central to both the music-making and the organization.  Thus the PTP will serve not only as a cultural resource for the Valley, but also as a positive outlet for the creative expression of its members, aiming to feature its musicians both as soloists and in chamber music ensembles, and by presenting concerts of the highest caliber and artistic standards.

If having a professional chamber orchestra almost literally in your backyard is something you're down with, then read on and find out all the details! And help support us with your donation!


What We Need

Let's face it, folks: funding an orchestra ain't easy!  We want to create a self-sufficient ensemble that can serve the Shenango Valley and provide quality classical music performances to its communities.  To do that, we have to get started...we have to have a concert!  

We need funds to produce our concert debut and start our organization.  On October 8th, 2016, we plan to debut with a concert at the historic Pierce Opera House in Sharpsville, PA.  The music includes:

          - MOZART Violin Concerto, K 219

          - BEETHOVEN Symphony No. 8

          - A selection of opera arias sung by local vocalists

  • Our goal is simple: we want to create a new orchestra for the Shenango Valley, one that will showcase our local talented musicians performing quality orchestral and chamber music of the highest caliber.
  • We're talking serious music here.  Bach, Handel, Mozart, Beethoven. And more. Symphonies. Overtures. Concertos. Opera. If you miss hearing this kind of music live in the Valley, then the PTP will be the group for you.

We will be operating under the auspices of the Pierce Opera House and ACTS—the Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville.  ACTS is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization whose board supports and has endorsed our initiative.  This means that your donation is tax-deductible per IRS regulations. 

So...we've got a venue.  We've got the players.  We've got the support of an existing arts organization in the valley, already known for its excellent production values.  What we need now is the funding to get this venture off the ground, and that's where YOU come in.

Your funds will serve to:

  • Pay our excellent musicians.  Playing music is what these great people do, and it requires a lot of their time and energy to individually prepare, and then on top of that rehearsal as a group to make it all come together.  Music is their vocation; so we have to be able to compensate them fairly for their time and effort!
  • Produce quality audio and video recordings.
  • Publicize, create programs, graphics and web design.
  • Music rental, accounting, and other misc. expenses
  • Start planning for future concerts and working toward becoming a self-sufficient arts organization serving the greater Shenango Valley area.


What You Get

  • A chamber orchestra composed of some of the best players in the greater Shenango Valley area—local talent, brought together in the name of performing GREAT music for YOU.  If you love true classical orchestral music, you can be certain that the Pierce Theatre Players will deliver concerts of nothing but the best.
  • What are we playing? MOZART. BEETHOVEN. Need we say more?
  • You get awesome music performance in a chill, down to earth atmosphere. We'll play in the historic Pierce Opera House in Sharpsville.  It's small and intimate, a fun space to be in.  
  • We don't wear tuxes (don't worry, we'll still look hip!).  When you come hear us play, you don't have to dress to the nines if you don't want to (but you can still look hip!).
  • Drink wine while we play. YUM.
  • We've got perks. Take a look to the right.  We've come up with some cool things that we want to give you in exchange for your generous support!


Who We Are

Stephen Barr is a product of the Shenango Valley: a 1994 graduate of Hickory High School, 1998 graduate of Westminster College, and now a professor of music at Slippery Rock University.  He is the director of the Shenango Valley Chorale, and also directs the chorus and pit orchestra for shows with Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville. 

Jay Koziorynsky is an active freelancer with the Youngstown, Wheeling, and Akron Symphony Orchestras as well as a violist with Opera Circle Cleveland. Jay has been a member of the Greenville Symphony Orchestra since 2008, and has served as the orchestra assistant concertmaster since 2012. No stranger to the Pierce Opera House, Jay has been performing shows with ACTS and Valley Lyric Opera since 2010. As an advocate for music education, Jay maintains a private studio of 35 violin and viola students. 

The Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville (ACTS) was founded on February 1st, 2011.  ACTS is committed to providing leadership and education in cultural development and performing arts in the region, striving to create a legacy of quality entertainment by tapping the resources of all age groups and encouraging the pursuit of artistic talent.

http://www.actsharpsville.org/index.html


Our musicians are professionals in their field: teachers, members of other professional orchestras, graduate students in music performance, and more. Click on the "About" link at the top right of the page to see all of the members of our team!

Pierce Opera House: Housed in the old Iron Banking Co. Building, this three story Italianate building was built in 1871 by “General” James Pierce, a prominent figure in the industrial development of the Shenango Valley as well as in the history of American iron industry.  He founded the first bank in Sharpsville, the Iron Banking Co. Pierce’s son, Walter, started the town’s newspaper, The Sharpsville Advertiser, which was also located here.

The third floor of this building contains the Pierce Opera House. For about 40 years, it hosted operas, operettas, musical concerts, and programs of spoken word; early motion pictures were shown after their introduction. From the 1890s to about 1920, high school graduation ceremonies were held here, and in the first decade of the 20th century, the occasional high school basketball game was played here as well. The opera house has been restored in the last decade and once again regularly hosts operas, plays and concerts. 

https://www.facebook.com/Pierce-Opera-House-282204478472130/



Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is rising the absolute minimum we need to successfully launch our October debut concert.  If we reach our goal of $6500, we will be able to make this happen.

  • We've teamed up with ACTS and their board to present this initiative.  We have what we think is a great idea, and they have the experience building an arts organization from the ground up.  They'll be here with us advising and supervising every step of the way.
  • ACTS is generously sponsoring us, but is not responsible for funding our budget.  That's up to us—and you.
  • ACTS is a recognized 501(c)3 charitable nonprofit by the IRS and as such, donations are tax deductable as allowed by law.
  • What happens if we don't reach the goal? We have a few plans in place to be able to make our debut concert happen even if we don't meet our goal, but those involve compromises and cuts we hope we won't have to make.  We may have to hire less players or move our debut concert to the spring in order to collect more funds.  But we are optimistic that with your help, we can reach our goal.
  • What happens if we exceed our goal?  We have plans for that too! 

    If we meet our goal of $6500 and continue raising funds above our minimum, we will be able to do so much more. We've set some "stretch goals" past our minimum goal so you can get an idea:

Stretch Goal 1 ($9000): We’ll be able to pay the musicians slightly more and reimburse some pre-launch expenses.  

Stretch Goal 2: ($13,500) PTP will be completely funded for our debut concert: our musicians will be paid in full, our creative team will get paid, and we will have a downpayment on a spring concert and/or a 2017-18 season. We will also be able to pay for professional-quality videography for the concert and post-production. If we reach this goal, all donors at the $100 dollar level and above will receive a USB drive containing all of the digital assets at their giving level, including bonus behind-the-scenes footage and some other goodies.

Stretch Goal 3 ($18,000+): We’ll be able to take our ambitious plans and project them several years into the future.  While we can't publicly announce all of those plans, we can say that we've already had discussions with other arts people in the Shenango Valley about collaboration, concerts in other venues, and outreach into schools.  We want to be an integrated and vital part of the arts and education community of the Shenango Valley!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, there are other ways you can help!

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign: SHARE on Facebook, TWEET it on Twitter, take a picture of it and INSTAGRAM it.  
  • The Indiegogo share tools are at the top of the page—help us out and use them!  
  • Or you can tell people by good old-fashioned word of mouth.
  • Whatever way you do it, TELL EVERYONE!  The more people that know, the better chance this becomes a reality!
  • However you support us, we thank you for your efforts in helping this project become reality!
story_txt:
The Pitch
Help us bring a professional chamber orchestra to the Shenango Valley: the PIERCE THEATRE PLAYERS. 
Led by Stephen Barr and Jay Koziorynsky, the PTP will offer a unique and innovative source of quality classical music performance for the Shenango Valley, presented in an intimate setting with a relaxed atmosphere. Bringing together great composers of the past with our own local virtuoso performers of the present, we aim to present a diverse offering of music encompassing not only established symphonic masterpieces, but also music from other vocal and contemporary traditions, and with an eye to promising voices of the future.  Our business model will keep the musicians as central to both the music-making and the organization.  Thus the PTP will serve not only as a cultural resource for the Valley, but also as a positive outlet for the creative expression of its members, aiming to feature its musicians both as soloists and in chamber music ensembles, and by presenting concerts of the highest caliber and artistic standards.If having a professional chamber orchestra almost literally in your backyard is something you're down with, then read on and find out all the details! And help support us with your donation!What We NeedLet's face it, folks: funding an orchestra ain't easy!  We want to create a self-sufficient ensemble that can serve the Shenango Valley and provide quality classical music performances to its communities.  To do that, we have to get started...we have to have a concert!  We need funds to produce our concert debut and start our organization.  On October 8th, 2016, we plan to debut with a concert at the historic Pierce Opera House in Sharpsville, PA.  The music includes:          - MOZART Violin Concerto, K 219          - BEETHOVEN Symphony No. 8          - A selection of opera arias sung by local vocalists
Our goal is simple: we want to create a new orchestra for the Shenango Valley, one that will showcase our local talented musicians performing quality orchestral and chamber music of the highest caliber.
We're talking serious music here.  Bach, Handel, Mozart, Beethoven. And more. Symphonies. Overtures. Concertos. Opera. If you miss hearing this kind of music live in the Valley, then the PTP will be the group for you.
We will be operating under the auspices of the Pierce Opera House and ACTS—the Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville.  ACTS is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization whose board supports and has endorsed our initiative.  This means that your donation is tax-deductible per IRS regulations. So...we've got a venue.  We've got the players.  We've got the support of an existing arts organization in the valley, already known for its excellent production values.  What we need now is the funding to get this venture off the ground, and that's where YOU come in.Your funds will serve to:

Pay our excellent musicians.  Playing music is what these great people do, and it requires a lot of their time and energy to individually prepare, and then on top of that rehearsal as a group to make it all come together.  Music is their vocation; so we have to be able to compensate them fairly for their time and effort!

Produce quality audio and video recordings.

Publicize, create programs, graphics and web design.
Music rental, accounting, and other misc. expenses
Start planning for future concerts and working toward becoming a self-sufficient arts organization serving the greater Shenango Valley area.



What You Get



A chamber orchestra composed of some of the best players in the greater Shenango Valley area—local talent, brought together in the name of performing GREAT music for YOU.  If you love true classical orchestral music, you can be certain that the Pierce Theatre Players will deliver concerts of nothing but the best.

What are we playing? MOZART. BEETHOVEN. Need we say more?

You get awesome music performance in a chill, down to earth atmosphere. We'll play in the historic Pierce Opera House in Sharpsville.  It's small and intimate, a fun space to be in.  
We don't wear tuxes (don't worry, we'll still look hip!).  When you come hear us play, you don't have to dress to the nines if you don't want to (but you can still look hip!).

Drink wine while we play. YUM.

We've got perks. Take a look to the right.  We've come up with some cool things that we want to give you in exchange for your generous support!

Who We Are

Stephen Barr is a product of the Shenango Valley: a 1994 graduate of Hickory High School, 1998 graduate of Westminster College, and now a professor of music at Slippery Rock University.  He is the director of the Shenango Valley Chorale, and also directs the chorus and pit orchestra for shows with Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville. 
Jay Koziorynsky is an active freelancer with the Youngstown, Wheeling, and Akron Symphony Orchestras as well as a violist with Opera Circle Cleveland. Jay has been a member of the Greenville Symphony Orchestra since 2008, and has served as the orchestra assistant concertmaster since 2012. No stranger to the Pierce Opera House, Jay has been performing shows with ACTS and Valley Lyric Opera since 2010. As an advocate for music education, Jay maintains a private studio of 35 violin and viola students. 
The Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville (ACTS) was founded on February 1st, 2011.  ACTS is committed to providing leadership and education in cultural development and performing arts in the region, striving to create a legacy of quality entertainment by tapping the resources of all age groups and encouraging the pursuit of artistic talent.
http://www.actsharpsville.org/index.html


Our musicians are professionals in their field: teachers, members of other professional orchestras, graduate students in music performance, and more. Click on the "About" link at the top right of the page to see all of the members of our team!
Pierce Opera House: Housed in the old Iron Banking Co. Building, this three story Italianate building was built in 1871 by “General” James Pierce, a prominent figure in the industrial development of the Shenango Valley as well as in the history of American iron industry.  He founded the first bank in Sharpsville, the Iron Banking Co. Pierce’s son, Walter, started the town’s newspaper, The Sharpsville Advertiser, which was also located here.

The third floor of this building contains the Pierce Opera House. For about 40 years, it hosted operas, operettas, musical concerts, and programs of spoken word; early motion pictures were shown after their introduction. From the 1890s to about 1920, high school graduation ceremonies were held here, and in the first
decade of the 20th century, the occasional high school basketball game was played here as well. The opera house has been restored in the last decade and once again regularly hosts operas, plays and concerts. 
https://www.facebook.com/Pierce-Opera-House-282204478472130/





Risks & Challenges
The main challenge is rising the absolute minimum we need to successfully launch our October debut concert.  If we reach our goal of $6500, we will be able to make this happen.
We've teamed up with ACTS and their board to present this initiative.  We have what we think is a great idea, and they have the experience building an arts organization from the ground up.  They'll be here with us advising and supervising every step of the way.
ACTS is generously sponsoring us, but is not responsible for funding our budget.  That's up to us—and you.
ACTS is a recognized 501(c)3 charitable nonprofit by the IRS and as such, donations are tax deductable as allowed by law.

What happens if we don't reach the goal? We have a few plans in place to be able to make our debut concert happen even if we don't meet our goal, but those involve compromises and cuts we hope we won't have to make.  We may have to hire less players or move our debut concert to the spring in order to collect more funds.  But we are optimistic that with your help, we can reach our goal.

What happens if we exceed our goal?  We have plans for that too! If we meet our goal of $6500 and continue raising funds above our minimum, we will be able to do so much more. We've set some "stretch goals" past our minimum goal so you can get an idea:


Stretch Goal 1 ($9000): We’ll be able to pay the musicians slightly more and reimburse some pre-launch expenses.  

Stretch Goal 2: ($13,500) PTP will be completely funded for our debut concert: our musicians will be paid in full, our creative team will get paid, and we will have a downpayment on a spring concert and/or a 2017-18 season. We will also be able to pay for professional-quality videography for the concert and post-production. If we reach this goal, all donors at the $100 dollar level and above will receive a USB drive containing all of the digital assets at their giving level, including bonus behind-the-scenes footage and some other goodies.
Stretch Goal 3 ($18,000+): We’ll be able to take our ambitious plans and project them several years into the future.  While we can't publicly announce all of those plans, we can say that we've already had discussions with other arts people in the Shenango Valley about collaboration, concerts in other venues, and outreach into schools.  We want to be an integrated and vital part of the arts and education community of the Shenango Valley!
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you're not able to contribute, there are other ways you can help!
Help us get the word out about our campaign: SHARE on Facebook, TWEET it on Twitter, take a picture of it and INSTAGRAM it.  
The Indiegogo share tools are at the top of the page—help us out and use them!  
Or you can tell people by good old-fashioned word of mouth.
Whatever way you do it, TELL EVERYONE!  The more people that know, the better chance this becomes a reality!
However you support us, we thank you for your efforts in helping this project become reality!

story:
Short Summary

משתתפים: מקהלת ברתיני בניצוחו של רונן בורשבסקי, המלחין, המעבד והפסנתרן ניזאר אל-חטאר, הזמרת מאריא ג'ובראן ואנסמבל נגנים בכלים מזרחיים ומערביים. הפרוייקט כולל הקלטות והפקת אלבום וכן סדרת מופעים בארץ ובחו"ל. הזמינו מראש כרטיסים למופע על פי בחירתכם ותקליטורים. בעזרתכם הנדיבה, הפרוייקט יקרום עור, גידים, צלילים ונשמה.

"הפרוייקט מהווה משימה מוסיקלית חדשנית ממש. חיבורם של אמנים ערבים ואמנים יהודים מהווה מימושו של חזון השלום, כשהמוזיקה היא האמצעי. אני מקווה שתהווה אבן דרך בהתפתחותו של סגנון חדש של שירת מקהלה בישראל וצעד נוסף לקידום השלום."

פרופ' מיכאל וולפה, האקדמיה למוסיקה, ירושלים

Participants: The Gary Bertini Choir, Nizar Elkhatar-composer, arranger and pianist, Soprano Maria Gubran, An ensemble, playing eastern and western instruments. The project includes recording and producing a CD album, as well as a concert series to be performed in Israel and abroad. Place your advance order now for the CD and the concert date of your choice. Thanks to your generous contribution, the project will come alive with sounds and soul.

“The project is a completely innovative musical effort. These connections between Arab and Jewish artists are indeed the realization of the vision of peace, with music as the intermediary."

Prof. Michael Wolpe, The Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance

In august 2017, the choir is visiting the Academie de La Roch D'hys in France, to record the project's CD. The international distribution of the CD will be done by Harmonia Mundi-a world leading label.

The choir has already scheduled the following concerts:

  • 20th August 2017 at 19:30 | Notre Dame De Semur en Auxois, France
  • 21st August 2017 at 19:30 | Saint Seine L’Abbaye, France
  • 4th November 20:30 | Opening night of the International Oud Festival - Beit Shmuel, Jerusalem
  • 8th April 2018 20:00 | Jerusalem Mormon University, Mt. Scopus

Additional concerts will be scheduled and published soon

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

כדי להרים את הפרוייקט הזה לרמה הגבוהה ביותר אנו מגייסים סכום של כ-200,000 ש"ח. החלק הארי של התקציב מוקדש להקלטות ולהפקת התקליטור כולל חוברת הסברים מעוצבת ותרגומים לשתי שפות, ולעלויות הכרוכות בשיווק, הפצה וכד'. חלקו האחר של התקציב מוקדש לכיסוי עלויות האנסמבל, המקהלה, המנצח והסולנית. גם למעבדים ולמלחינים - ניזאר אל חאטר ושרה שוהם מוקדש חלק משמעותי מהתקציב הכולל

What we plan to raise is the sum of 56,000$.                                                                     

This cover the following expenses:

1. Budget of the composers work (Nizar El-Khater and Sarah Shoham) - 7,000$, 

2. Ensemble of piano, violin, oud, flute, cello, percussion - 5,000$,

3. The soloist  - 1,500$, 

4. Direct cost of  7 joint rehearsal sessions of choir and the ensemble - 6,500$, 

5. Conductor's work - 3,000$

5. Recordings: Studio equipment and rentals  + Tone Mastering and mix - 12,500$,  

6. CD production & graphic design (including a tri-lingual booklet) -14,500$,  

7. P.R.  marketing & distributing - 6,000$.

     מה מקבלים התורמים

Perks: 25$ contribution - you get the digital version of the CD by e-mail.

              35$ contribution - you get the CD by post to your address wherever you are.

              45$ - Entrance ticket to one of our concerts.

              75$ - Tickets for a couple to one of our concerts

             250$ - your name will be in the honorable list of sponsors, mentioned in the        

                     CD's beautiful booklet + 1 concert ticket

            280$ - your name will be in the honorable list of sponsors, mentioned in the        

                     CD's beautiful booklet + 2 concert ticket

          1000$ - You can dedicate one of the songs in the CD to somebody you love and cherish. This dedication will be written in the booklet under the chosen number and also in concerts programs in the future.

Failing to get our goal budget will not cause us to cancel the project, no way! The consequence will be that instead of the French Label Ad Vitam we shall work with an Israeli label (though highly professional too), CD production will be done in a cheaper budget, with just very little PR and marketing, but the final product will still be very good, and the main purpose - creating new cultural bridges and opening new options - will be fully achieved! On the other hand - the concerts will be exactly as planned !

The Impact

By Joining us in our exceptional project you help to make our dream real: to find a common denomination, to build up a human and cultural bridge between two almost hostile communities in our torn country. Understanding and openness between Jews and Arabs in Israel- both Mouslims and Christians- are valuable to the whole world.

Those of you who cann't support us financially can easily spread out the information about it by facebook or by Indiegogo sharing tools as well. We'll be very grateful to you for that !!!

story:
Earthly Baroque CD Recording Project

Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo site - we are excited that you are here!  

Musicians of the Old Post Road has been bringing masterworks and rediscovered pieces from the Baroque to the Romantic eras to enthusiastic audiences for nearly 30 years. 

For centuries classical composers have been inspired by sounds from the natural world, and in turn, our love of nature inspired us last fall to curate a program of works by Baroque composers who cleverly and beautifully evoked natural sounds in their musical creations.

The Earthly Baroque program was born!

Compelled by our audience's very enthusiastic response to the Earthly Baroque concerts, we are recording the program on CD in order to bring it to a larger audience and directly into your home!

Featuring a world premiere reconstruction of John Frederick Lampe's

utterly charming Cu'ckoo Concerto by Artistic Director Daniel Ryan, this recording project also includes our unique interpretations of Vivaldi's beloved Goldfinch concerto, Biber's action-packed violin Sonata Representativa, Gregor Josef Werner's stormy November suite, William William's pastoral Sonata in Imitation of Birds, and more!

What We Need & What You Get

We have already raised nearly half of the total cost of $15,000, so we know the demand and interest is there. Our goal with this campaign is to raise the final $8,000 needed to cover the remaining costs of recording and producing the CD, and we need your help!

Recording and production costs include renting a beautiful venue with the proper acoustics to bring out the rich timbres of our period instruments, fees for the sound engineer and producer, editing and mastering, and harpsichord moving and tuning.

Peruse this page for some of the unique perks we have set aside for our supporters! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that support comes in many forms!  

If you are not able to contribute financially but want to help us reach our goal, please consider one of the following:

  • Share our link on your Facebook page.
  • Tweet about our project and ask others to contribute.
  • Email to other potentially interested parties.
  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share with their one-click buttons to the right of the pink Back It button!
