story:
Who We Are and How YOU can Help

  • Hi! We are Harmonious! Cleveland's premier professional a cappella group. We are a brand new group dedicated to spreading the joys of a cappella to the Cleveland area.
  • We've been performing at small gigs and open mics around the city, but in order to host proper performances, we need proper equipment. 
  • This is where you come in—your donations will go towards purchasing equipment that will bring our sound to life! With your help, we will be able to reach a much larger audience and make our sound accessible for all of Northeast Ohio and more!  
  • Your contributions will help a group of musicians achieve what they wouldn't be able to do on their own.   

What we need and What you get

  • In order to make our goals a reality, we will need about $3,000.  This amount of money will help us get brand new equipment, including microphones, a mixer, a sound board, speakers, and more.  

  • $10 – We will give you shout-out on our Facebook page thanking you for your donation.

    $25 – We will list you on the donor page on our website and give you a Facebook shout-out.

    $50 – We will mail you a Harmonious logo sticker, as well as the other incentives.

    $75 – We will record our rendition of Happy Birthday to you or anyone you would like! We will also send you the other incentives.

    $100 – We will record any song in our repertoire and dedicate it to you or the person of your choosing, we can also update the lyrics if you want to send us any changes!  You will not receive the Happy Birthday recording, but you will receive all other incentives.

    $150 – You will receive a Harmonious T-shirt as well as either the dedicated full song recording or the Happy Birthday recording. You will also receive all other incentives.

    $250 – You will receive all three premium incentives! A dedicated full song, a recording of happy birthday, and two Harmonious T-shirts! You will also receive all other incentives.

    $500 – We will travel to you (anywhere in northeast Ohio) and perform a full 3 song set of your choosing! You will also receive a T-shirt, Happy Birthday recording, and all other smaller incentives. 


  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use whatever money we were able to raise to purchase the essential equipment in order to get our sound out into the world.  

Not Sure?  

It's possible that you may be skeptical investing in a start up a cappella group. However, we are very passionate about what we do and can offer a type of sound that Cleveland has been lacking for way too long!  

A cappella has been taking the world by storm, especially with the booming success of groups like the Pentatonix and movies / TV shows like Pitch Perfect. Since Cleveland has seen such a cultural and economic resurgence in recent years, why shouldn't our great city also be known for having great a cappella? Well it can be, starting with us.  

You can still help!

If you happen to be strapped for cash (we understand, we're artists)  you can still help!  Please like our Harmonious A Cappella Facebook page and tell your friends about our fundraiser!   

Please help us achieve our goals!  Thank you!
story_txt:
Who We Are and How YOU can Help


Hi! We are Harmonious! Cleveland's premier professional a cappella group. We are a brand new group dedicated to spreading the joys of a cappella to the Cleveland area.

We've been performing at small gigs and open mics around the city, but in order to host proper performances, we need proper equipment.  This is where you come in—your donations will go towards purchasing equipment that will bring our sound to life! With your help, we will be able to reach a much larger audience and make our sound accessible for all of Northeast Ohio and more!   Your contributions will help a group of musicians achieve what they wouldn't be able to do on their own.   
   What we need and What you get  In order to make our goals a reality, we will need about $3,000.  This amount of money will help us get brand new equipment, including microphones, a mixer, a sound board, speakers, and more.  



$10 – We will give you shout-out on our Facebook page thanking you for your donation.
$25 – We will list you on the donor page on our website and give you a Facebook shout-out.
$50 – We will mail you a Harmonious logo sticker, as well as the other incentives.
$75 – We will record our rendition of Happy Birthday to you or anyone you would like! We will also send you the other incentives.
$100 – We will record any song in our repertoire and dedicate it to you or the person of your choosing, we can also update the lyrics if you want to send us any changes!  You will not receive the Happy Birthday recording, but you will receive all other incentives.
$150 – You will receive a Harmonious T-shirt as well as either the dedicated full song recording or the Happy Birthday recording. You will also receive all other incentives.
$250 – You will receive all three premium incentives! A dedicated full song, a recording of happy birthday, and two Harmonious T-shirts! You will also receive all other incentives.
$500 – We will travel to you (anywhere in northeast Ohio) and perform a full 3 song set of your choosing! You will also receive a T-shirt, Happy Birthday recording, and all other smaller incentives. 

 If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use whatever money we were able to raise to purchase the essential equipment in order to get our sound out into the world.      Not Sure?  
 It's possible that you may be skeptical investing in a start up a cappella group. However, we are very passionate about what we do and can offer a type of sound that Cleveland has been lacking for way too long!  
A cappella has been taking the world by storm, especially with the booming success of groups like the Pentatonix and movies / TV shows like Pitch Perfect. Since Cleveland has seen such a cultural and economic resurgence in recent years, why shouldn't our great city also be known for having great a cappella? Well it can be, starting with us.  
 You can still help!
If you happen to be strapped for cash (we understand, we're artists)  you can still help!  Please like our Harmonious A Cappella Facebook page and tell your friends about our fundraiser!   
Please help us achieve our goals!  Thank you!

story:
WHICH REPERTOIRE IS INCLUDED?

All my pieces for cello and piano: The Philosophy of Composition (2009), inspired by Edgar Allan Poe's essay of the same title and a memorial to the South African poet Don Maclennan; a New Work (as yet untitled) for cello and piano (2016); and two short pieces - Connectivity (2008), composed for the Messiaen centenary, and an early song without words (1975). 
Two solo pieces: Pentimenti for solo cello (2013), marking the centenary of the riotous premiere of 'The Rite of Spring'; A Fractured Landscape for piano (2010), a memorial to the writer and musician Edward Said.

WHO AM I?

I am a composer, born Cape Town in 1951, studied in Cape Town, Johannesburg and London, and received a doctorate in composition from Rhodes University in 2000. I moved to London in 1977 to continue my career as composer, pianist, teacher, writer and new music activist, returning in 1998 after the advent of democracy in South Africa. There I started "Growing Composers", a programme for mentoring young black composers, and an annual festival, "New Music Indaba", for the performance of new music. The artists on this planned CD are among many from all over the world who visited South Africa to give concerts and workshops. My overriding ambitions were twofold: to get previously disadvantaged composers onto the new music scene and to get South African new music onto the international stage. 

My two previous CDs collected my solo piano music up to 2004 (Jill Richards) and my string quartets and piano quintet (Fitzwilliam String Quartet), and were praised in the South African, British and German press. You can read reviews and more about me at www.michaelblake.co.za.

You can read more about the artists who will record the new CD at www.,gauwerky.de and www.daanvandewalle.com.

WHAT IMPACT COULD THIS CD HAVE?

The CD recording of my complete cello music by two superb artists gives me  an opportunity to have another aspect of my music in the public domain. And having it played by wonderfully committed artists, takes the experience to another level. South African composers do not often have this opportunity and I would like to think that the next generation will see this as a model and inspiration for what they can do themselves.

Your contributions will quite simply make it possible to turn many months of creative hard work by the composer and the performers into a beautiful and long-lasting end product, one that listeners will appreciate and will definitely want to have in their CD libraries - for both the aural and visual content.

WHAT DO WE NEED AND WHAT WILL YOU GET?

We need around €7,500 to get this CD onto the shelves and into your homes. That will cover the cost of recording, editing and mastering the CD, producing the booklet and manufacturing and distributing the final product, covering the artists' fees and travel to, and accommodation in, Cologne during the recording.

Every contributor receives at least one signed CD. For additional benefits see 'Perks'.

WHY SUPPORT THIS PROJECT?

This CD will boost the audience for South African art music, and with your help we can record and distribute worldwide on the Wergo label: https://de.schott-music.com/wergo/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Marie Marquis, and I am a New York based soprano.  I'm doing this campaign to help fund my training at the Aspen Opera Center in Aspen, Colorado this summer. At the Graduate Vocal Arts Program at Bard College, and in fellowships at Tanglewood Music Center and Songfest, I studied poetry, art song, and new music techniques extensively, but now I'm finding the need to further fine-tune my operatic and auditioning skills.

This is where Aspen comes in! It is an 8 week long summer music festival run by world class faculty, headed by Ed Berkeley and  Elizabeth Buccheri. While there I'll have weekly voice lessons, seminars in acting, German opera scenes, text, and Feldenkrais method, and I will have the opportunity to sing in opera chorus, chamber music concerts, and to work behind the scenes in the festival's mainstage operas. Aspen is also a wonderful place to make new connections with future colleagues and mentors.

This year, I have had the privilege of singing Belinda in "Dido and Aeneas" with Heartbeat Opera, performing as a featured soloist with the Richmond Choral Society, Ars Musica, and St. Johns Church, and I've just been named the winner of the Joy in Singing Debut Artist Award. Your support will help me on my journey to greater and greater successes!

What I Need & What You Get

  • The program costs for participation in the Aspen Music Festival total $7850. $3800 for tuition, $3800 for housing, $150 Health Services fee, and $100 facility fee. 
  • Your funding will also help cover food while I'm in Aspen and travel costs to Colorado and back to New York. 
  • I have saved enough to pay for a portion of the costs, but I still need $3,200 in order to fully fund the program!
  • Perks for donating include bi-weekly updates from me while in Aspen, a thank-you haiku, an exclusive recording, baked goods, even a recital in your home!

From the Festival

From the Aspen Music Festival Website:

"The Aspen Music Festival and School is the country’s premier summer music festival, offering a combination of intensive one-on-one instruction and professional performance experience.

The Aspen Opera Center, formerly known as the Aspen Opera Theater Center, offers a wide range of exciting performance opportunities. These include: vocal chamber music performances; weekly public Opera Scenes Master Classes; house concerts; and three fully-staged productions in the Wheeler Opera House, where all roles are sung by AOC singers and performances are led by distinguished conductors and directors.

AOC singers also participate in an intensive curriculum of weekly voice lessons, vocal master classes taught by resident artist-faculty and guest artists, opera music, acting, song repertory, dance classes, rehearsals, auditioning and professional-orientation workshops, and individual music and dramatic coaching."

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Tell your friends about my campaign!
  • Visit my website and like my facebook page!
  • You can also buy me a cup of tea while I'm in Aspen by clicking this link: http://ko-fi.com/A1402KR

story:
Named for Superman, whose birth name was Kal El, Cal El is a rapper who is saving the world with his music. He performs a wide variety of styles, incorporating everything from hardcore lyricism to catchy melodies, and he has been performing music since he was only five years old. Born in Brooklyn and raised in Edison, NJ, Cal El was influenced early on by artists such as Michael Jackson, Nas, Biggie Smalls, Sade, and Tupac. Now, however, he does his work mostly in isolation so as to encourage himself to produce music that is both unique and wholly reflective of his own personal identity.

Cal El has earned a small but devoted following over the short time since he has gone professional, and he is expanding his base constantly. He plans on eventually performing at the Grammys. For now, he is focused on introducing his music to people who will enjoy it, and in order to do that, he needs to get himself out there. Cal El is devoted to his craft and spends all of his waking moments developing his career, but he wants to start making bounds and leaps rather than steps. The thing holding him back is, of course, money.

We have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $15,000. These funds would go a long way toward advancing Cal El’s position in the industry, giving him an opportunity to produce his R&B / hip-hop album, film some music videos, and travel around the country performing shows. Cal El is ready for this. He has put in the hours, and now is the time for him to move onto the next level. Your contributions will make that possible. Every dollar counts. We thank you sincerely.
